There's a reason he can look into Lord Voldemort's mind. A part of Voldemort lives inside him.

I'm afraid you have used up all my stores interrogating students, the last of it on Miss Chang. Unless you wish to poison Potter - and I assure you, I would have the greatest sympathy if you did - I cannot help you.

Read it, control it, unhinge it. In the past it was often the Dark Lord's pleasure to invade the minds of his victims, creating visions designed to torture them into madness. Only after extracting the last exquisite ounce of agony, only when he had them litterly begging for death would he finally... kill them. Used properly, the power of Occlumency will help shield you from access or influence. In these lessons I will attempt to penetrate your mind. You will attempt to resist. Prepare yourself! Legillimens!
No! He belongs to the Dark Lord!

Can surely survive another minute without you. Besides, I only wish to convey a message.

I will.
I will.
I will.

There will be no foolish wand-waving or silly incantations in this class. As such, I don't expect many of you to appreciate the subtle science and exact art that is potion-making. However, for those select few...
Who possess, the predisposition... I can teach you how to bewitch the mind and ensnare the senses. I can tell you how to bottle fame, brew glory, and even put a stopper in death.
Then again, maybe some of you have come to Hogwarts in possession of abilities so formidable that you feel confident enough to not pay attention!
Mister Potter. Our new celebrity.

For your information Potter, Asphodel and Wormwood make a sleeping potion so powerful it is known as the Draught of the Living Death, a Bezoar is a stone taken from the stomach of a goat and it will save you from most poisons. As for Monkshood and Wolfbane, they are the same plant which also goes by the name of Aconite. Well, why aren't you all copying this down?
What would three young Gryffindors such as yourselves be doing inside... on a day like this?
You ought to be careful. People will think you're...
Up to something.
Tell me, what would I get if I added powdered root of asphodel to an infusion of wormwood?
You don't know? Well, let's try again. Where, Mr. Potter, would you look if I asked you to find me a bezoar?

Pity. Clearly, fame isn't everything, is it, Mr. Potter?
You don't want me as your enemy, Quirrell.
Always.

Salazar Slytherin wished to be more selective about the students admitted to Hogwarts. He believed magical learning should be kept within all magic families. In other words, pure bloods. Unable to sway the others, he decided to leave the school. Now according to legend, Slytherin had built a hidden chamber in this castle, known as the Chamber of Secrets. Though shortly before departing, he sealed it until that time when his own true heir returned to the school. The heir alone would be able to open the chamber and unleash the horror within, and by so doing, purge the school of all those who, in Slytherin's view, were unworthy to study magic.
Well naturally the school has been searched many times. No such chamber has been found.
Well, the chamber is said to be the home... of a monster.

Could I have your attention, please? Because of recent events, these new rules will be put into affect immediately. All students will return to their house common rooms by 6 o'clock every evening. All students will be escorted to each lesson by a teacher. No exceptions. I should tell you this

Wanna play chess?

I know what you're thinking Harry, but don't. There's something not right about that mirror.
That's wizard's chess.
Mental that one, I'm telling you.
Fluffy?
Happy Christmas, Harry.
I look good!
Hey, pea brain!
What?
Wingardium Leviosa!
Do you really have that... scar?
Why spiders? Why couldn't it be "follow the butterflies"?
Um... Ron Weasley.
Lockhart's memory charm backfired! He hasn't got a clue who he is!
No.
It's not much, but it's home.
That would be a cheerful visit. "Hello Hagrid! Tell us, have you been setting anything mad and hairy loose in the castle lately?"
My wand. Look at my wand.
Three guesses who.
Who cares?
Come on, Harry. Fred and George were just having a laugh.
Okay, so half the school thinks you're nipping off to the Chamber of Secrets every night. Who cares?
Why would that make anyone feel any better?
If it kills by looking people in the eye, why is it no one's dead?
And Mrs. Norris? I'm pretty sure she didn't have a camera or a mirror, Harry.
Follow the spiders? Follow the spiders? If Hagrid ever gets out of Azkaban, I'll kill him!
I mean, what was the point of sending us in there? What have we found out?
Ginny. She's been talking about you all summer. Bit annoying, really.
They were starving him, Mum! There were bars on his window!
Harry!
Can we panic now?
Where's Hermione when you need her?
Bloody hell. Whatever shed this must be 60 feet long, or more.
Look at your tail.
Have you spoken to Hermione?
Moaning Myrtle!
Uh-oh. I smell trouble.
Those are Nimbus Two-Thousand and Ones! How'd you get those?
You'll pay for that one Malfoy! Eat slugs!
Do you think it's true? Do you think there really is a Chamber of Secrets?
Of course! You heard him. 'You'll be next mudbloods'.
Enlighten me. Why are we brewing this potion in broad daylight, in the middle of a girls lavatory? Don't you think we'll get caught?
Why?
But, it can't hurt if someone throws something at you. I mean, it would just go right through you.
Are you mad?
You're a parselmouth! Why didn't you tell us?
Oh, that's what you said to it?
I head you speaking parseltongue. Snake language.
Exactly! Now the whole school is gonna think you're his great-great-great-grandson or something.
Dad loves muggles. Thinks they're fascinating.
Honestly, Professor Snape, I think it did more damage to us.
Maybe we could trick them into telling.
Is there anything you CAN do?
Eugh... essence of Crabbe...
How thick could you get?
Brilliant! Malfoy will tell us anything!
What do we do now?
Yeah, tell them... I'll tell them...
Hermione, no! He's not worth it.
Not good, brilliant!
A bit? A bit? You almost tore my leg off!
She's gone mental, Hermione has. I mean, not that she wasn't always mental, but now it's out in the open for everyone to see!
Twice.
Huh?
Oh, no. I'm fine here.
I didn't mean to open it.
It was badly wrapped.
It's Scabbers who did it.
He's my rat, sir. Well he's not really a rat. Well, he was a rat, he was my brother Percy's rat, but then they gave him an owl, and I got...
Sure...

Oh yeah... well, Harry's got a sort of wonky cross... that's trials and suffering. And, uh, that there could be the sun, and that's happiness, so... you're gonna suffer... but you're gonna be happy about it...
Who do you think that is?
Do you know everything?
How is it she knows everything?
Oh.
Right. Next time I see Crookshanks, I'll let him know.
Brilliant! Loads of cool stuff. Mummies, tombs. Even Scabbers enjoyed himself.
Yeah, along with the dung beetle.
Bloody hell!
I'm warning you Hermione! Keep that bloody beast of yours away from Scabbers or I'll turn it into a tea cozy!
A cat? Is that what they told you? It looks more like a pig with hair if you ask me.
He's got a point, you know.
Probably Neville's forgotten the password again.
Oh... You're there...
What the bloody hell was that all about?
So painful. They... they might chop it.
It's too late. It's ruined. It'll have to chopped off.
Brilliant!
I still think it's brilliant.
That's not true!
Thick-heads.
Harry, what did you just do?
Gorgeous. Unless of course you've been ripped to pieces.
I haven't lost anything! Your cat killed him!
Harry, you've seen the way that blood thirsty beast of hers is always lurking about. And now Scabbers is gone!
Your cat killed him!
Did.
Hermione, when did you get here?
It's sorta painful. They uh, they might... chop it.
It's too late, it's ruined. It'll have to be chopped off.
Serves her right. She was a terrible singer...
Let me get this strait. Sirius Black has escaped from Azkaban to come after you?
Sure. Except no one's ever broken out of Azkaban before, and he's a murderous raving lunatic.
I haven't shown anyone!
Well, you sort of went rigid. We thought maybe you were having a fit or something.
No... I felt weird though, like I'd never be cheerful again.
Listen to the idiot! He's really laying it on thick, isn't he?
There's something moving out there.
Neville, you're supposed to stroke it!
You fell off your broom.
There's something else you should know, Harry. Your Nimbus - when it blew away? - it sort of landed in the Whomping Willow. And well...
Shove off, Malfoy.
Harry, it's a trap! And he's a dog, he's an Animagus!
Not good, brilliant!
Harry! What did you just do?
Me? He's mental!
Scabbers has been in my family for...
So what?
What are you trying to do to him?
Scabbers! Leave him alone!
Get off him! What are you doing?
There's no one like Krum! He's like a bird the way he rides the wind! He's more than an athlete! He's an artist.
Shut up!
No, we would not care to join you and *Victor*.
He's from Durmstrang! You're fraternizing with the enemy!
I think he's got a bit more than friendship on his mind. He's using you.
Doubt it. He's way too old.
Yeah, that's what I think.
Go on.
Well... that... that's completely off the point...
Blimey, Dad! How far up are we?
Blimey, Harry. You've slayed dragons. If you can't get a date, who can?
What? Now I'm really depressed. Oi, Hermione... you're a girl.
Come with one of us! It's one thing for a bloke to show up alone, but for a girl it's just sad.
Bloody hell. She's lying, right?
Do you think we'll ever just have a quiet year at Hogwarts?
Yeah, didn't think so. Oh well, what's life without a few dragons?
Oh, I won't. You know I won't.
Don't be silly. There she was, just walking by... you know how I like it when they walk... I couldn't help it... it just sort of slipped out!
What else? I ran for it!
Oh look, Mum's sent me something.
Mum sent me a dress!
Nose down, Harry. Ginny, this must be for you.
Dress robes? For what?
I reckon you'd have to be barking mad to put your own name in the Goblet of Fire.
I wasn't the only one who thought you'd done it. Everyone was saying it behind your back.
At least I warned you about the dragons.

No, I did! Don't you remember? I told Hermione to tell you that Seamus told me that Parvati told Dean that Hagrid was looking for you! Seamus never actually told me anything, so it was really me all along. I thought we'd be alright, you know, after you figured that out.
Yeah... it is, isn't it. I suppose I was a bit distraught.
Merci...
Brilliant, isn't he? Completely demented, of course. Terrifying to be in the same room with him. But he's really been there, you know? He's looked evil in the eye!
Ruddy pumpkin head, isn't he?
What are those?
Well, those're all right! No lace, no dodgy little collar...
Traditional? They're ancient! I look like my great aunt Tessie!
I smell like my great Aunt Tessie!
Bloody hell!

Look, nobody liked Crouch. I know this from my father. Loads of people wanted him dead. But, he was a Ministry Official. It's not even like he turned up stiff in Knockturn Alley. He was murdered at Hogwarts. This is a big deal.
Yeah.
What do you suppose is on Karkaroff's arm?
Yeah, that's me. Ron Weasley, Harry Potter's stupid friend!
Piss off.
No. Absolutely not.
Where?
You think so?
Anything else?
Fine.
We're still a bunch of misfits.
Don't know...
Hey, Dad! Where are we going?
We came back for Harry.
Loads, according to Dad. That's what worries them so much. It happened right under their noses.
Well... my dad did tell me about one. The Imperius Curse?
What?
Yeah, yeah a bit.
Zacharias_Smith: So Dumbledore says because he says! The point is, where's the proof?
Horace_Slughorn: Exactly how did you get out of the castle, Harry?
Aaauughh!... Merlin's beard, Harry!
Yes, I did actually!... What made you think that?
Ten Galleons a leaf to the right buyer!... Not that I'm familiar with any such back alley transactions, but one does hear rumors. My own interests are purely academic, of course.
Harry! I must insist you accompany me back to the castle immediately!
What makes you say that?
I would have thought an expert potion-maker like yourself could whip up an antidote for a love potion in no time, Harry?
Perhaps you're right.
How sweet! I once had a fish... Francis. He was very dear to me. One afternoon, I came downstairs and... it vanished. Poof.
Yes, doesn't it? But that's life! I suppose, you - you go along with and suddenly... poof.
What about you, Miss Granger? What do your parents do in the muggle world?
And is that considered a dangerous profession?
Whoops! All hands on deck, there, Granger!
Thank you for the pineapple, you're quite right, it is my favorite - but how did you know?
What's the matter with Wenby?
Very well. Better bring him in. I'd have thought you could have whipped up a remedy for this in no time, Harry.
Perhaps you're right.
Please don't think badly of me when you see it. You have no idea what he was like... even back then.
Perhaps you're right Harry.
Oh, thank you. It's all in the upholstry.
I come about the stuffing naturally.
What you see here before you is a curious little potion. It does cause infatuation or obsession.

Now, Amortentia doesn't create actual love, that would be impossible. But it does cause powerful infatuation or obsession, and for that reason... it is probably the most dangerous potion in this room.
Some of your classmates... well, let's just say they're unlikely to make the shelf.
Anyone who aspires to be anyone ends up here. But then again, you already are someone, aren't you, Harry?
Mr. Riddle had a number of teachers whilst he was here at Hogwarts.

I... of course, it's only natural you should want to know more. But I'm afraid I must disappoint you, Harry. When I first met young Mr. Riddle, he was a quiet, albeit brilliant boy committed to becoming a first-rate wizard. Not unlike others I've known. Not unlike yourself, in fact. If the monster existed, it was buried deep within.
Viktor_Krum: You have no business here! This tent is for champions, and friends.
Harry_Potter: It's alright Ginny, It's over. It's just a memory.
Malfoy?
No Colin! Get out of the way!
Come on, let's take him to Hagrid's.
He'll know what to do.
You wish.
Your family?
What terrible things? Who's plotting them?
I can't. Hogwarts is my home!

This connection between me and Voldemort... what if the reason for it is that I am becoming more like him? I just feel so angry, all the time. What if after everything that I've been through, something's gone wrong inside me? What if I'm becoming bad?
Wet. I mean, she was sort of crying.
How come you're not at the feast?
That's awful!
Do you want any help finding them?
Are you sure you don't want any help looking?
First we've got to find a place to practice where Umbridge won't find out.
It's too small.
What's that?
I'm not going to talk about Cedric, so if that's why you're here you might as well clear out now.
C'mon, Hermione, let's go. They're just here because they think I'm some sort of freak.
Wait... look, it all sounds *great* when you say it like that. But the truth is most of that was just luck. I didn't know what I was doing half the time, I nearly always had help...

No, Hermione, I'm not! Facing this stuff in real life is not like school. In school, if you make a mistake you can just try again tomorrow. But out there, when you're a second away from being murdered or watching a friend die right before your eyes... you don't know what that's like.
Look, it's not that I don't appreciate everything you've done, all of you, but - but I've got you into enough trouble as it is.
...So how are we going to get to London?
This is mad. Who'd want to be taught by me? I'm a nutter, remember?
Thanks, Ron.
I've been thinking about something Dumbledore said to me.
That even though we've got a fight ahead of us, we've got one thing that Voldemort doesn't have.
Something worth fighting for.
We're going to make them proud, Neville. That's a promise.
No you don't.
It's my fault.
The prophecy said neither one can live while the other one survives. It means one of us is going to have to kill the other, in the end.
Why didn't you tell me?
Are you all right? I heard Umbridge gave you a rough time the other day.
Cedric *did* know this stuff. He was really good. It's just, Voldemort was better.
Probably full of Nargles, though.
I've no idea.
I've waited fourteen years...
Think I can wait a little longer. NOW!
Thanks. Seems you're about the only ones that do.
What do you mean?
Nothing.
No. Dumbledore's got enough on his mind right now. Anyway, I don't want to give Umbridge the satisfaction.
Yeah, well I haven't got any of those, have I Ron?
No, it's not! Hermione whatever this is, it's not simple. You don't understand.
What? No, I'm staying with you!
You mean, like a weapon?
Good! I want to join! If Voldemort's raising an army then I want to fight!
Well, what use is that? If we're gonna be attacked, it won't be risk-free.
And how's theory supposed to prepare us for what's out there?
It's not a lie! I saw him! I fought him!
So according to you, Cedric Diggory dropped dead OF HIS OWN ACCORD.
There's a lot of that going around, Hermione. So what is this place?
You couldn't have put this in a letter, I suppose. I've gone all summer without a scrap of news.
Only what?
I think you've got an admirer.
It's brilliant! It's like Hogwarts wants us to fight back!
Don't say a word against my father!
I'm not weak!
My father was a great man!
So, you've known someone who died?
I'm sorry.
How many times?
You haven't given me any ink.
That. Pulling the carriage.
I'm sorry, Professor. But I must not tell lies.
CRUCIO!

Yeah, but I agreed. I tried so hard to help, and all it's done is made things worse. Anyway, it doesn't matter anymore, because I don't want to play anymore. All it does is make you care too much. The more you care the more you have to lose. You maybe it's just best to...
To go it alone.
Hey Big D. Beat up another 10 year old?
Five against one. That's very brave.
Why?
But that's insane! No one in their right mind could believe that Dumbledore...
JUST STAY AWAY FROM ME!

I saw it! It's just like with Mr. Weasley! It's the same door I've been dreaming about for months, only I couldn't remember where I'd seen it before! Sirius said Voldemort was after something, something he didn't have last time, and it's in the department of Mysteries!
What if he is? I'm supposed to just let him die? Hermione, he's the only family I've got left!
Different.
Why not?

What are you doing?

Hearing?
I didn't...

Expelliarmus!
I don't understand. What has the Ministry of Magic got against me?
Oh... yeah.
But I am the Chosen One.
Sorry... kidding!
She's smart... funny... attractive...
Well you know... she has nice... skin.
Well, I dunno, I'm just saying it could be a contributing factor.
I-I've never thought about it before. But now that you mention it, yeah. Very nice.
Not to mention the pincers...
Quiet, please.
Thanks.
Excellent... really excellent!
Right. I'm going down to Hagrid's.
I know, but I've got a really good feeling about Hagrid's. I feel like it's the place to be tonight. Do you know what I mean?
Trust me! I know what I'm doing, or Felix does.
Hi!
It feels like this.
Divine. Had ourselves a little late night snack, did we?
Or twenty.
Honestly, you know, I reckon she was starting to annoy you.
Oh... brilliant.
Well, I'd bloody well hope so, she's been snogging you for three months.
Who are you talking about?
Okay, very funny.
What was that for?
Alright, fine, you're in love with her! Have you ever actually met her?
Yes. What does it mean?
Um... have you ever fixed a nose before?
...Okay, yeah, sure, give it a go.
Augh...!
Well? How do I look?
...Brilliant.
Professor Flitwick, you've known me for five years.
Through the front door sir.
Incarcerous!
Fight back!, you coward! Fight back!
Sectumsempra!
Oh, sorry, sir, I should've announced myself. Cleared my throat. Coughed. You probably feared I was Professor Sprout!
Oh, well, just the general behavior, sir - the sneaking around, jumping when you saw me... Are those tentacular leaves, sir? They're very valuable, aren't they?
Personally, these plants always kind of freak me out.
That would be counterproductive, sir!
No idea!
Oh, no one. Bit of a tosser, really.
Sorry, sir, but I really should be getting back to the party. My date...
Oh no, no, no. I mean, she's brilliant, but we're friends.
Sorry I made you miss the carriages by the way, Luna.
Oh, I am your friend, Luna.
Well, sir, I think this called for a more practiced hand.
I don't sleep with it!
Poof.
But, Sir, I thought we weren't allowed to apparate on Hogwarts' grounds.
I just apparated, didn't I?
I never noticed how beautiful this place is.
No I'm not!
What happens when you break an Unbreakable Vow?
I'm not coming back Hermione. I've got to finish whatever Dumbledore started, and I don't know where that'll lead me, but I'll let you and Ron know where I am when I can.
Did you know, sir? Then?
That's not what it sounded like.
What brings you here, sir?
I'd have thought that this called for a more practised hand, sir.
Fight back, you cowards, fight back!
Quiet, please!
Thanks. Alright, um, now then, remember just because you made the team last year, that doesn't guarantee you a spot this year, is that clear?
Good.
All right, fine, you're in love with her! You haven't even met her!
But I am the Chosen One.
Okay, sorry... kidding.
Hd ourselves a little midnight snack, have we?
Or twenty.
Honestly, you know, I reckon she was starting to annoy you.
Oh, yes. Very nice.
Well, she's funny, smart, attractive.
She has nice... skin.
I reckon he's right.
Shelf, sir?
Did Voldemort ever make the shelf, sir?
You knew him, didn't you, sir? Tom Riddle? You were his teacher.
What was he like?
I'm sorry, sir. Forgive me. He killed my parents.
Ron, you don't have a wife.
Absolutely not, no. Besides, I'm just a waste of space. Isn't that right, Vernon?
Thanks.
They'll torture you. If they think for a moment you know where I'm going, they'll stop at nothing.
Well, just keep talking about that little ball of light touching your heart, and she'll come 'round.
No, of course not. How are you, Luna?
Very nice to meet you, sir.
What?
How about you tell me now?
Maybe that's the best reason to have it. Because of everything that's going on.
Hermione... I appreciate the thought, honestly. But given that we were almost killed by a couple of Death Eaters a few minutes ago...
No one else is going to die. Not for me.
It was you!
And the doe. That was you as well.
My Patronus is a stag.
Merry Christmas, Hermione.
This is mental.
Ron! Don't listen to it!
Ron! Stab it!
Ron! It lies! Stab it! STAB IT!
What's the trace?
The real one?
No, absolutely not.
How did you find us?
"It"?
Engorgio!
Reducio!
No. This is where I was born. I'm not returning as someone else.
Same.
You think I'm not listening too? You think I don't know how this feels?
Fine then, go! Go then! Leave the locket.
Forgive me minister, but it's a little hard to tell the difference now-a-days.
I don't care about a bloody wedding! No matter whose it is. I have to start searching for the Horcruxes. It's the only chance we have to beat him. And the longer we wait, the stronger he gets.
I thought you knew what you had signed up for!
No.
This one's name is Rowle. He was on the Astronomy Tower the night Snape killed Dumbledore.
If we kill them, they'll know we were here.
It's better we wipe their memories.
We have to go there, now.
Hermione! When have any of our plans ever actually worked? We plan, we get there, all hell breaks loose!
Because I have something worth living for.
Is this all real? Or is it just happening inside my head?
Okay, there's something we need to find, something hidden here in the castle, and it may help us defeat You-Know-Who.
We don't know.
We don't know that either. I realise that's not much to go on.
I'm going there now.
There's a reason I can hear them... the Horcruxes. I think I've known for awhile.
And I think you have too.
No. Kill the snake. Kill the snake and then it's just him.
Albus Severus Potter... you were named for two Headmasters of Hogwarts. One of them was a Slytherin, and he was probably the bravest man I've ever known.
Hi there.
Ready?
You were right. When you told Professor Snape that wand was failing you. It will always fail you!
But what if that wand never belonged to Snape? What if its allegiance was always to someone else? C'mon, Tom... let's finish this the way we started it. Together!
I'll lure him into the castle. We have to kill the snake.
I'm a bit preoccupied at the moment, Luna.
We'll talk later, ok?
Later!
The Resurrection Stone...
Why are you here? All of you?
I'm sorry. I never wanted any of you to die for me.
And Remus, your son...
You'll stay with me?
And he won't be able to see you?
Stay close to me.
Ginny! Neville! Are you all right?
Luna?
Voldemort has the Elder Wand.
And the snake's still alive.
And I have nothing to kill it with.
I have to go back, haven't I?
I have a choice?
And where would it take me?
I suppose I'll have to kill him before he finds me.
I would ask you the same.
You knew it was me. You didn't say anything.
Hermione, give me a flask, anything!
Come on Tom, let's finish this the way we started, together.
It's good to see you too, Professor.
Time. As much as you can get me, Professor.
It's complicated. Why did Bellatrix Lestrange think it should be in her vault?
Dumbledore trusted me to see this through.
Why should he...
I trusted him.
He knows if we find them, and destroy all the horcruxes we'll be able to kill him. I reckon he'll stop at nothing to make sure we don't find the rest. There's more, one of them is at Hogwarts.
There's something hidden here in the castle, and it may help us defeat you-know-who.
I'm afraid it's quite extensive, how dare you stand where he stood. Tell them how it happened that night! Tell them how you looked him in the eye, a man who trusted you, and killed him! Tell them!

It answered to somebody else. When he killed Snape, he thought the wand would become his, but the thing is, the wand never belonged to Snape. It was Draco who disarmed Dumbledore that night in the Astronomy Tower. From that moment on, the wand answered him... until the other night when I disarmed Draco at Malfoy Manor.
What then?
Gilderoy_Lockhart: Hello. Who are you?
Really! And,uh, wh-who am I?
It's an odd sort of place, this, isn't it? Do you live here?
Really?
Ah... yes, well, that can sometimes happen. Um, but, uh, the point is, uh, you can no longer feel any pain. And, very clearly, the bones are not broken.
Much more flexible, though.
Let's have a volunteer pair. Potter, Weasley, how about you?
I'm afraid that's my doing, Severus. You see, Harry was helping me answer my fan mail.
Spooky how the time flies when one's having fun.
Harry, Harry, Harry. Can you possibly imagine a better way to serve detention, than by helping me to answer my fan mail?
Fame is a fickle friend Harry. Celebrity is as celebrity does. Remember that.
there's no need for me to stay!

Professor Dumbledore has granted me permission to start this little dueling club, to train you all up, in case you ever need to defend yourselves, as I myself have done on countless occasions. For full details, see my published works.
Yes, now you mention it. I'm rather gifted with Memory Charms. Otherwise, you see, all those wizards would have gone blabbing. And I'd never have sold another book.
Laugh after you, Mr. Finnigan. The pixies can be devilishly tricky little things. See what you make of them.
Round them up! Round them up! Round up the pixies
Peskipiksi Pesternomi!

Let me introduce you to your new Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher... me. Gilderoy Lockhart, Order of Merlin, Third Class, Honorary member of the Dark Force Defense League, and five times winner of Witch Weekly's Most Charming Smile Award. But I don't talk about that; I didn't get rid of the Banden Banshee by smiling at him.
Books can be misleading...
My dear boy, do use your common sense! My books wouldn't have sold half as well if people didn't think *I'd* done all those things!
Sorry?
Voice?
What are you talking about, Harry?
So... you first, Mr. Potter. Say goodbye to your memories. Obliviate!
Percy_Weasley: And keep an eye on the staircases. They like to change.
Oh, that's Professor Snape, head of Slytherin House.
Potions. But everyone knows it's the Dark Arts he fancies. He's been after Quirrell's job for *years*.
Keep an eye on the staircases, they like to change.
Filius_Flitwick: There you are! We've been looking everywhere for you two.
Bellatrix_Lestrange: Neville Longbottom, isn't it? How's mum and dad?
He knows how to play. Itty-bitty-baby-Potter.
You coming to get me?
Avada Kedavra!
You? The Dark Lord told you?
Swear to it... make the Unbreakable Vow.
It's just empty words. He'll give it his best effort, when it maters most. He'll just slither back into his hole... coward.
Will you, Severus Snape, watch over Draco Malfoy, as he attempts to fulfill the Dark Lord's wishes?
And will you, to the best of your ability, protect him from harm?
And, if Draco should fail, will you yourself carry out the deed the Dark Lord has ordered Draco to perform?
Love to, Albus, but I'm afraid we're on a bit of a tight schedule.
Do it!
No! The Dark Lord was clear, the boy's to do it.
You stupid elf! You could have killed me!
How dare you defy your master!
I don't believe it.
Yes, what is wrong with his face?
Get Draco.
Well, well, well, look what we have here. It's Harry Potter. He's all bright, and shiny, and new again, just in time for the Dark Lord.
Blech!
Cissy, put the boys in the cellar! I'm going to have a conversation with this one, girl to girl.
The boy... is he dead?
Ha ha ha!
My Lord!
Dudley_Dursley: 36! But last year, last year I had 37!
I don't care how big they are!
Well you're one to talk, moaning in your sleep every night. At least I'm not afraid of my pillow. "Don't kill Cedric!" Who's Cedric, your boyfriend?
I don't understand. Isn't he coming with us?
I don't think you're a waste of space.
Neville_Longbottom: No, that's all I need... you to set my bloody kneecaps on fire!
Hey, wait, where are you going? What about the counter-curse?
Parvati Patil says that she wouldn't come out of the girls bathroom. She said that she'd been in there all afternoon, crying.
No! I won't let you! You'll get Gryffindor into trouble again! Uh, I-I'll fight you!
Why is it always me?
Hey, get me down!
Hey, get me down!
Professor Snape.
And he killed a basilisk, with the sword in Dumbledore's office.
So how are we going to get to London?
Dumbledore's Army's supposed to be about doing something real.
Or was all that just words to you?

Fourteen years ago, a Death Eater named Bellatrix Lestrange used the Crutiatus Curse on my parents. She tortured them for information, but they never gave in. I'm quite proud to be their son. But I'm not sure I'm ready for everyone to know just yet.
Better, now they're about to be avenged!
Don't give it to him, Harry!
Right then, so what's the plan Harry?
Right, what is it?
Blow it up? Boom?
It doesn't matter that Harry's gone.
People die every day. Friends, family. Yeah, we still lost Harry tonight. He's still with us, in here.
So's Fred, Remus, Tonks... they didn't die in vain. But YOU will. 'Cause you're wrong! Harry's heart did beat for us! For all of us! It's not over!
Never better! I feel like I could spit fire! You haven't seen Luna have you?
I'm mad for her. I think it's about time I told her, since we'll probably both be dead by dawn!
I'd like to say something...
Oh my god! I've killed Harry Potter!
Absolutely.
Most likely.
Well, there's some debate among herbologists about its effectiveness in fresh water as opposed to salt water...
Th-there's um... the Cruciatus Curse.
Amazing! Amazing!
What's wrong, Harry? You seem a little tense!
You know, if you're interested in plants, you should use Goshawk's Guide To Herbology. There's someone in Tibet who's growing gravity resistant trees...
I don't know about turnips, but you could always use gillyweed.
Hannah_Abbott: But why would he want to attack Justin?
And you definitely think Potter's the Heir of Slytherin?
Harry always seemed so nice, though. And after all, he is the one who made You-Know-Who disappear.
Sirius_Black: I expect you're tired of hearing this, but you look so like your father. Except your eyes. You have...
It's cruel that I got to spend so much time with James and Lily, and you so little. But know this; the ones that love us never really leave us. And you can always find them in here.

Brilliant, Snape - once again you've put your keen and penetrating mind to the task and as usual come to the wrong conclusion. Now if you'll excuse us, Remus and I have some unfinished business to attend to.
He can't help it. It's habit by now.
Be quiet yourself, Remus!
Why don't you run along and play with your chemistry set?
Enough talk, Remus! C'mon, let's kill him!
I did my waiting! Twelve years of it! In Azkaban!
Peter Pettigrew! And he's in this room, right now! Come out, come out, Peter! Come out and play!
Sorry about the bite, I reckon that twinges a bit.

I *was* going for the rat. Normally, I have a very sweet disposition as a dog. In fact, more than once, James suggested that I make the change permanent. The tail I could live with. But the fleas? They're murder.
I would have died! I would have died rather than betray my friends, as we would have done for you!
It's beautiful, isn't it? I'll never forget the first time I walked through those doors. It'll be nice to do it again as a free man.
That was a noble thing you did back there. He doesn't deserve it.
You know the man you truly are, Remus! This heart is where you truly live! This heart! Here! This flesh is only flesh!
Well, you'd know all about the madness within, wouldn't you Remus?
No, only one will die tonight.
And you know it. And for now, that'll do.
The map never lies! Pettigrew's alive.
He can't help it, it's habit by now.
Be quiet yourself, Remus!
Severus, please!
That map never lies! Pettigrew's alive! And he's right there!
Not you! Your rat!
Twelve years! Curiously a long life for a rat! He's missing a toe, isn't he?
Finger! But then the coward cut it off so they would think he was dead! And then he transformed into a rat!
How dare you speak to Harry!
How dare you talk about James in front of him!
I would have died!
I would have died rather than betray my friends!
You should have realized, Peter, that if Voldemort wouldn't kill you we would!
Together!
Only one will die tonight.
I don't have much time, Harry, so let's get right to it. Did you or did you not put your name into the Goblet of Fire?
Shh. I had to ask. Now tell me about this dream of yours. You mentioned Wormtail and Voldemort, but who was the third man in the room?
You didn't hear a name?
And what was that?
Yes... it's just a dream. Look, Harry, the Death Eaters at the world cup; your name rising out of the Goblet of Fire; these are not just coincidences! Hogwarts isn't safe anymore.

I'm saying the devils are inside the walls. Igor Karkaroff. He was a Death Eater and no one, *no one* stops being a Death Eater. Then there's Barty Crouch. Heart of stone, sent his own son to Azkaban.
I haven't a clue who put your name in the Goblet, Harry, but whoever did is no friend to you. People die in this tournament.
"The bird bites."

I want you to listen to me very carefully, Harry. You're not a bad person. You're a very good person, who bad things have happened to. Besides, the world isn't split into good people and Death Eaters. We've all got both light and dark inside us. What matters is the part we choose to act on. That's who we really are.
Get away from my Godson!
If anyone's got a right to know it's Harry. If it wasn't for him we wouldn't even know Voldemort was back! He's not a child, Molly!
He's not your son.
He's got me!
I hated the lot of them. My parents, with their pure-blood mania... my repulsive cousin, Bellatrix Lestrange...
My mother did that after I ran away. Charming woman.
Kreacher! That's enough of your bile. Away with you!
It's been 14 years, and still not a day goes by that I don't miss your dad.
I want you to take the others and get out of here.
You've done beautifully. Now let me take it from here.
We think Voldemort wants to build up his army again.

Fourteen years ago he had huge numbers at his command, not just witches and wizards but all manner of dark creatures. He has been recruiting heavily and we have been attempting to do the same. But gathering followers isn't all he's interested in...
We believe Voldemort may be after something...
Something he didn't have last time.
You'll have to kill me.
The latest intelligence is that Fudge doesn't want you trained in combat.

That's exactly what he thinks. That Dumbledore is assembling his own forces to take on the Ministry. He's becoming more paranoid by the minute. The others wouldn't want me telling you this, Harry, but things aren't going at all well with the Order. Fudge is blocking the truth at every turn, and these disappearances are just how it started before. Voldemort is on the move.
This is my parent's house. I offered it to Dumbledore as headquarters for the Order. It's about the only useful thing I've been able to do.
Fudge is using all his power, including his influence at the Daily Prophet, to smear anyone who claims the Dark Lord has returned.
When all this is over we'll be a proper family. You'll see.
I had to see you off, didn't I? What's life without a little risk?
Quicker than falling asleep.
No.
We're here, you see.
Draco_Malfoy: You'll soon find out that some wizarding families are better than others, Potter. You don't wanna go making friends with the wrong sort. I can help you there.
The Forest? I thought that was a joke. We can't go in there. Students aren't allowed. And there are-
... werewolves.
Okay. Then I get Fang!
Think my name's funny, do you? No need to ask yours. Red hair... and a hand-me-down robe. You must be a Weasley.
Wait 'til my father hears about this! This is servant's stuff!
I'm not scared, Potter!
Did you hear that?
Is that so?
Have it your way then.
It's true then, what they're saying on the train. Harry Potter has come to Hogwarts.
You don't want to go making friends with the wrong sort. I can help you there.
Reading? I didn't know you could read.
Scared, Potter?
Oh, look, Potter, you got yourself a girlfriend.
That's right. And that's not all that's new this year.
You see, Weasley, unlike some, my father can afford the best.
No one asked your opinion, you filthy little Mudblood!
Father always said that Dumbledore was the worst thing that ever happened to this place.
What? You think there's someone here who's worse than Dumbledore? Well? Do you?
Good one, Goyle. You're absolutely right.

My father did say this; it's been fifty years since the chamber has been opened. He wouldn't tell me who opened it, only that they were expelled. The last time the Chamber of Secrets was opened, a mudblood died. So it's only a matter of time before one of them is killed this time. As for me, I hope it's Granger.
"Enemies of the Heir Beware"? You'll be next, mudbloods.
Training for the ballet, Potter?
I'm surprised the Ministry's still letting you walk around free, Potter. You better enjoy it while you can. I expect there's a cell in Azkaban with your name on it.
Ok! Ok! I was gate crashing. Happy?
Didn't mummy ever tell you it was rude to eavesdrop, Potter? Petrificus totalus! Oh yeah. She was dead before you could wipe the drool off your chin.
That was for my father. Enjoy your ride back to London.
Enjoy your trip back to London!
Nice face, Potter!
I have to do this! I have to kill you!
You go ahead. I want to check something.
What's wrong with his face?
You have something of mine, I'd like it back.
It's my mother's, it's powerful but it's... not the same. It doesn't quite... understand me. You know what I mean?
Petunia_Dursley: I have lived in this house for twenty years, and now in a single night, I'm expected to leave.
In the lounge, waiting to welcome them graciously to our home!
Freak! I'm telling Mummy! You're a freak! You're a freak, Lily!
Eddard_Stark: Winter is coming.
In the name of Robert of the House Baratheon, the First of His Name...
...Lord of the Seven Kingdoms, and Protector of the Realm, I, Eddard of the House Stark, Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North, sentence you to die.
You have five northern children. You're not an outsider.
It's your gods, by all the rules.
Tell me.
Your sister, the boy...
If he's coming this far north... there's only one thing he's after.
You understand why I did it?
But do you understand why I had to kill him?
The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword.
The White Walkers have been gone for thousands of years.
A madman sees what he sees.
Get the lads to saddle their horses.
He swore an oath, Cat.
Tell Bran he's coming, too.
He won't be a boy forever... and winter is coming.
You will train them yourselves. You will feed them yourselves. And if they die, you will bury them yourselves.
She was my sister. This is where she belongs.
The butcher's boy... you ran him down?
War was easier than daughters...
Handsome armor. Not a scratch on it.
Chosen your opponents wisely, then.
But you just stood there and watched.
Is that what you tell yourself at night? You're a servant of justice? That you were avenging my father when you shoved your sword in Aerys Targaryen's back?
You served him well when serving was safe.
Look at me. You're a Stark of Winterfell. You know our words.
Hm. Pycelle talks too much.
Knighted for what?
Why are you telling me this?
Where is Ser Hugh? I'll speak to him.
Varys or the queen?
Yes.
Why?
Lord Baelish, perhaps I was wrong to distrust you.
I was trained to kill my enemies, Your Grace.
It's a hard fall down these steps.
Cats? Syrio says...
He's right about that.
Well, he needs to get his strength back first.
No, but someday he could be lord of a holdfast, or sit on the king's council, or he might raise castles like Brandon the Builder.
You will marry a high lord and rule his castle, and your sons shall be knights and princes and lords.
You're too fat for your armor.
You're torturing the poor boy.
The breastplate stretcher?
I remember him well.
He was taken at my command, to answer for his crimes.
You kill me - your brother is a dead man.
I'm glad we never met on the field, Ser Barristan. As is my wife. I don't think the widow's life would suit her.
My father once told me you were the best he'd ever seen. Never knew the man to be wrong about matters of combat.
You're speaking of murdering a child.
Then we're no better than the Mad King!
You want to assassinate a girl because the Spider heard a rumor?
Based on whose information?
Mormont? You bring us the whispers of a traitor half a world away and call it fact.
He broke the law, betrayed his family, fled our land. We commit murder on the word of this man?
The narrow sea still lies between us. I'll fear the Dothraki the day they teach their horses to run on water.
I will have no part in it.
And good luck to him. I thought you were a better man.
Eh, that will never happen.
If the king got what he wanted all the time, we'd still be fighting a damned rebellion.
He'll never walk again.
So they say.
I've been in the capital a month. Why have you waited so long to tell me this?
So why do you trust me now?
What sort of doom does the king face?
Who gave it to him?
His squire, Ser Hugh?
If Ser Hugh poisoned him... who paid Ser Hugh?
Jon was a man of peace. He was Hand for seventeen years, seventeen good years. Why kill him?
Robert...
I've made many mistakes in my life, but that wasn't one of them.
What you suggest is treason.
Varys.
What about my daughters?
And Sansa?
You watched my men being slaughtered and did nothing.
The madness of mercy. That she might save her children.
The queen can't kill me. Cat holds her brother.
If that's true... then slit my throat and be done with it.
Tell me something, Varys. Who do you truly serve?

You think my life is some precious thing to me? That I would trade my honor for a few more years... of what? You grew up with actors. You learned their craft and you learnt it well. But I grew up with soldiers. I learned to die a long time ago.
Petyr_Baelish: Ah, the Starks! Quick tempers, slow minds.
I hear you're reading a boring book.
Oh, he never stops. Do you know Ser Hugh of the Vale?
Not surprising. Until recently, he was only a squire. Jon Arryn's squire. He was knighted almost immediately after his master's untimely death.
I promised Cat that I'd help you.
A singularly bad idea. Do you see that boy, there?
One of Varys' little birds. The Spider has taken a great interest in your comings and goings. Now look, there.
That one belongs to the queen. And do you see that septa pretending to read her book?
No, she's one of mine. Is there someone in your service whom you trust completely?

The wiser answer was no, my lord. Get a message to this paragon of yours, discreetly. Send him to question Ser Hugh. After that, you might want him to visit a certain armorer in the city. He lives in a large house at the top of the Street of Steel.
I have my observers, as I said, and it's possible that they saw Lord Arryn visit this armorer several times in the weeks before his death.
Distrusting me was the wisest thing you've done since you climbed off your horse.
Has anyone ever told you the story of the Mountain and the Hound?

Lovely little tale of brotherly love. The Hound was just a pup, six years old maybe. Gregor a few years older, already a big lad, already getting a bit of a reputation. Some lucky boys just born with a talent for violence. One evening, Gregor found his little brother playing with a toy by the fire - Gregor's toy, a wooden knight. Gregor never said a word, he just grabbed his brother by the scruff of his neck and shoved his face into the burning coals. Held him there while the boy screamed, while his face melted. There aren't very many people who know that story.
No, please don't. If the Hound so much as heard you mention it, I'm afraid all the knights in King's Landing would not be able to save you.
You do move quietly.
You look a bit lonely today. You should pay a visit to my brothel this evening. First boy is on the house.
Am I? All those birds that whisper in your ear, such pretty little things. Trust me... we accommodate all inclinations.
I'm a purveyor of beauty and discretion, both equally important.
All desires are valid to a man with a full purse.
Strictly speaking, such a thing would not be in accordance with the king's laws.
Tell me... does someone somewhere keep your balls in a little box? I've often wondered.
Since you last saw me or since I last saw you?
Saw me with your own eyes?
Council business. We all have so much to discuss with Ned Stark.
One shudders at the thought.
But you know something, I do believe I have seen you even more recently than you have seen me.
Yes. Earlier today, I distinctly recall you talking to Lord Stark in his chambers.

And not long after that, when I saw you escorting a certain... foreign dignitary... council business? Of course, you would have friends from across the narrow sea. You're from there yourself. After all, we're friends, aren't we, Lord Varys? I'd like to think we are. So you can imagine my burden, wondering if the king might question my friend's sympathies, to stand at a crossroads where turning left means loyalty to a friend, turning right, loyalty to the realm...
...to find myself in a position where a simple word to the king...
To a small council meeting?
My lords...
Jorah Mormont's a slaver, not a traitor. Small difference, I know, to an honorable man.
When you find yourself in bed with an ugly woman, best close your eyes, get it over with. Cut her throat. Be done with it.
Tell me
Brothels make a much better investment than ships, I've found. Whores rarely sink.
We only make peace with our enemies, my lord. That's why it's called "making peace."
When the queen proclaims one king and the king's Hand proclaims another, whose peace do the Gold Cloaks protect? Who do they follow? The man who pays them.
A naked knight, apparently.
Tywin_Lannister: Attacking him was stupid.
Lannisters don't act like fools.
Ned Stark.
Why is he still alive?
That's what you want people to think of you.
And you hear them whispering "Kingslayer" behind your back, doesn't it bother you?
A lion doesn't concern himself with the opinion of a sheep.

I suppose I should be grateful that your vanity got in the way of your recklessness. I'm giving you half of our forces. 30,000 men. And we'll bring that to Catelyn Stark's girlhood home, and remind her that Lannisters pay their debts.

Your mother's dead. Before long I'll be dead, and you and your brother and your sister and all of her children, all of us dead, all of us rotting underground. It's the family name that lives on. It's all that lives on. Not your personal glory, not your honor... but family. You understand?

You're blessed with abilities that few men possess. You're blessed to belong to the most powerful family in the kingdoms. And you're still blessed with youth. And what have you done with these blessings, eh? You served as a glorified bodyguard for two kings... one a mad man, the other a drunk.
The future of our family will be determined in these next few months. We could establish a dynasty that would last a thousand years... or we could collapse into nothing, as the Targaryens did.
I need you to become a man you're always meant to be. Not next year, not tomorrow... now.
When soldiers lack discipline, the fault lies with their commander.
I always thought you were a stunted fool. Perhaps I was wrong.
I always thought you were a stunted fool. Perhaps I was wrong.

No one will stay here. Ser Gregor will head out with 500 riders and set the Riverland on fire from God's Eye to the Red Fork. The rest of us will regroup at Harrenhal. And you will go to King's Landing.

Rule. You will serve as Hand of the King in my stead. You will bring that boy king to heel, and his mother too, if needs be. And if you get so much as a whiff of treason from any of the rest - Baelish, Varys, Pycelle...
You're my son.
Oh, one more thing
A lion does not concern himself with the opinion of sheep.
This'll be my last war... win or lose.
You think I'd be in my position if I'd lost a war?
And this is the one I'll be remembered for. "The War of Five Kings," they're calling it. My legacy will be determined in the coming months. You know what "legacy" means?

It's what you pass down to your children, and your children's children. It's what remains of you when you're gone. Harren the Black thought this castle would be his legacy. Greatest fortress ever built. Tallest towers, the strongest walls. The Great Hall had thirty-five hearths. Thirty-five, can you imagine? Look at it now. A blasted ruin. Do you know what happened?

Yes. Dragons happened. Harrenhal was built to withstand an attack from the land. A million men could've marched on these walls and a million men would've been repelled. But an attack from the air, with dragonfire... Harren and all his sons roasted alive within these walls. Aegon Targaryen changed the rules. That's why every child alive still knows his name, three hundred years after his death.
Hm?
Correct. A student of history, eh?
I'm sure I knew that when I was a boy.
Hm. She's a heroine of yours, I take it. Aren't most girls more interested in the pretty maidens from the songs? Jonquil, with flowers in her hair?
Take that back to the kitchen. Eat what you want.
Girl...
M'lord.
Lowborn girls say "m'lord", not "my lord". If you're going to pose as a commoner, you should do it properly.
Go on.
I don't care if you hanged a hundred. A man tried to kill me. I want his name and I want his head.

Pretentious name for a band of outlaws. We can't allow rebels behind our lines to harass us with impunity. We look like fools and they look like heroes; that's how kings fall. I want them dead, every one.
Have you gone soft, Clegane? I always thought you had a talent for violence. Burn the villages, burn the farms. Let them know what it means to choose the wrong side.

We'll find you accommodations more suited to your name and as a reward for your accomplishments during the Battle of Blackwater Bay. And when the time is right, you will be given a position fit for your talents, so that you can serve your family and protect our legacy. And if you serve faithfully, you will be rewarded with a suitable wife - and I would let myself be consumed by maggots before mocking the family name and making you heir to Casterly Rock!

You are an ill-made, spiteful little creature full of envy, lust, and low cunning. Men's laws give you the right to bear my name and display my colors since I cannot prove that you are not mine. And to teach me humility, the gods have condemned me to watch you waddle about wearing that proud lion that was my father's sigil and his father's before him. But neither gods nor men will ever compel me to let you turn Casterly Rock into your whorehouse. Go, now. Speak no more of your rights to Casterly Rock. Go!
One more thing.
The next whore I catch in your bed, I'll hang.
It would appear to be a position that best suits your talents.

Good. I wish you knew how to manipulate him. I don't distrust you because you're a woman. I distrust you because you're not as smart as you think you are. You've allowed that boy to ride roughshod over you and everyone else in this city.
I will.
There, you see? You will wed her, bed her, and put a child in her. Surely you're capable of that.
You wanted to be rewarded for your valor in battle. Sansa Stark is a finer reward than you could ever dare hope for. And it is past time you were wed.
Tyrion will do as he's bid.
As will you.
You'll marry Ser Loras.
The boy is heir to Highgarden. Tyrion will secure the North. You will secure the Reach.
Yes, you will. You're still fertile. You need to marry and breed.
Not another word!
My children. You've disgraced the Lannister name for far too long.
You're late.
Our business concerns her too. Sit.
Never mind that now. We have something important to discuss.
Your sister has learned that your new friends the Tyrells are plotting marry Sansa Stark to Ser Loras.
Your jokes are not appreciated.

The Karstarks have marched home. The Young Wolf has lost half his army. His days are numbered. Theon Greyjoy murdered both his brothers. That makes Sansa Stark the heir to Winterfell. And I'm not about to hand her over to the Tyrells.

There's nothing to refuse. This is a plot. Plots are not public knowledge. And the Tyrells won't carry this one out until after Joffrey's wedding. We need to act first and kill this union in its crib.
We find Sansa Stark a different husband.
I can and I do.
Do you intend on mistreating her? The girl's happiness is not my concern - nor should it be yours.
My stomach remains quite strong, however. The only thing that might turn it are details of your grandson's nocturnal activities. Do you deny them?
Why?
Is rich, the most beautiful woman in all seven kingdoms, and the mother of the king.
Old?
I don't care what people believe. And neither do you.
Where did you hear about this?
Apparently so.

When I was Hand of the King under your father's predecessor, the skulls of all the Targaryen dragons were kept in this room. And the skull of the last of them was right here. It was the size of an apple.
Yes, and the creature to whom it belonged died 300 years ago. Curiosities on the far side of the world are no threat to us.
Because we have been told as much by the many experts who serve the realm by counseling the King on matters about which he knows nothing.
You are being counseled at this very moment.
From now on I will see to it that you are appropriately consulted on important matters. Whenever necessary.
Your Grace.
You wanted to speak to me?
You're welcome to attend the meetings of your small council, Your Grace. Any or all of them.
Of course.
I have, yes.
The Tower of the Hand is where I work. To walk from there to here would take time, a time I could otherwise spend productively.
We could arrange to have you carried.
You seem rather drunk.
This isn't about your wedding. Renly Baratheon had a wedding. Your wife needs a child, a Lannister child, as soon as possible.
If you're going to give her one, you need to perform.
More than once.
You can drink. You can joke. You can engage in juvenile attempts to make your father uncomfortable. But you will do your duty.
I believe we can dispense with the bedding, Your Grace. I'm sure Tyrion didn't mean to threaten the king.
Your uncle is clearly quite drunk, Your Grace.
Any man who must say, "I am the king" is no true king. I'll make sure you understand that when I've won your war for you.
The king is tired. See him to his chambers.
Grand Maester, perhaps some essence of nightshade to help him sleep
Shall I explain to you in one easy lesson how the world works?

The house that puts family first will always defeat the house that puts the whims and wishes of its sons and daughters first. A good man does everything in his power to better his family's position, *regardless* of his own selfish desires.
Does that amuse you?
Easy for me, is it?
The day that you were born! I wanted to carry you into the sea and let the waves wash you away. Instead, I let you live. And I brought you as my son. Because you're a Lannister.
You're a fool if you believe he's the most powerful man in Westeros.
You really think a crown gives you power?
No. He never would have risked such an action if he didn't have certain assurances. Which he got from me. Do you disapprove?
Do you want to write a song for the dead Starks? Go ahead, write one. I'm in this world a little while longer to defend the Lannisters, to defend my blood.
Good. Let them remember what happens when they march on the south.
You're in rather a good mood.
I won't ask why.
Prince Oberyn.
Charmed.
Please give him my regards. With any luck, the gout will abate with time and he'll be able to walk again.
Noblemen in my part of the country don't enjoy the same lifestyle as our counterparts in Dorne.
Are you?
Which way is that?
Some believe the king choked.
I hear you studied poisons at the Citadel.
Your hatred for my family is rather well-known. You arrive at the capital, an expert in poisoning. Some days later, my grandson dies of poisoning.
You spoke with Tyrion in this very brothel on the day that you arrived. What did you discuss?
What did you discuss?
For which you blame me.
Here I stand, unarmed, unguarded... should I be concerned?
Men at war commit all kinds of crimes without their superiors' knowledge.
Categorically.
You wish to confess?
Tyrion, do you wish to confess?
You admit you poisoned the king?
You are not on trial for being a dwarf.
Have you nothing to say in your defense?
Ser Meryn! Ser Meryn, escort the prisoner back to his cell!
I condemned no one. The trial is not over.
I know nothing of the sort.
He killed his king!
It won't be murder it will be justice.
I am performing my sworn duty as Hand of the King. If Tyrion is found guilty, he will be punished accordingly.
No! He'll be punished accordingly!
I'm well aware of your oath.
What happens to my dynasty if I spare the life of my grandson's killer?

When the testimony's concluded and the guilty verdict rendered, Tyrion will be given the chance to speak. He'll plead for mercy. I'll allow him to join the Night's Watch. In three days time he'll depart for Castle Black and live out his days at the wall. You'll remove your white cloak immediately. You'll leave King's Landing to pursue your rightful place at Casterly Rock. You'll marry a suitable woman and father children name Lannister and you'll never turn your back on your family again.
And you have mine.
The gods have made their will known. Tyrion Lannister, in the name of King Tommen of the House Baratheon, First of his Name, you are hereby sentenced to death.
The Gods have made their will known.
Tyrion Lannister, in the name of king Tommen of the house Baratheon, first of his name, you are hereby sentenced to death.
Tyrion. Put down the crossbow.
Who released you? Your brother, I expect. He always had a soft spot for you. Come, we'll go and talk in my chambers.
This is how you want to speak to me, hmm? Shaming your father has always given you pleasure.

Yes. But you refused to die. I respect that. Even admire it. You fight for what's yours. I'd never let them execute you. Is that what you fear? I'll never let Ilyn Payne take your head. You're a Lannister. You're my son.
Who?
Oh, Tyrion. Put down that crossbow.
It doesn't matter.
She was a whore.
And what? You'll kill your own father in the privy? No. You're my son. Now, enough of this nonsense.
Enough. We'll go back to my chambers and speak with some dignity.
You're afraid of a dead whore?
You shot me.
Ohh... you're no son of mine.
No.
And how will you do that?
What truth would that be?
Known what?
No.
I don't believe you.
Joffrey_Baratheon: What good will my sympathies do then?
The boy means nothing to me. And I can't stand the wailing of women.
I'm telling mother!
You can't!
You let my father die. You're too old to protect anybody.
I'll tell you what. I'm going to give you a present. After I raise my armies, and kill your traitor brother, I'll give you his head as well.
Say what you will about the Targaryens, they were conquerors.
That is a seat for a conqueror.
I'm punishing her.
You can't talk to me like that. The king can do as he likes!
Traitors! I'll have their heads!
You can't insult me!
You can't!
They attacked me!
YOU'RE TALKING TO A KING!
Let them have her!
What are you doing? I want these people executed!
You're the master of whisperers, you're supposed to know everything!
The Stark forces are distracted. Now is the time to strike.
If my uncle Stannis lands on the shores of King's Landing, I'll ride out to greet him.
They say Stannis never smiles.
I'll give him a red smile. From ear to ear.
Dog, I command you to go back up there and fight!
Hound, tell the Hand that his King has asked him a question.
If I tell the Hound to cut you in half, he'll do it without a second thought.
Tell me about the Targaryen girl in the east. And her dragons.
Is it true?
Don't you think we ought to do something about it?
And the biggest was the size of a carriage.
But how do we know that these dragons are just curiosities and not the beasts that brought the whole world to heel?
But I haven't been counseled.
I should be consulted about such things.
Grandfather.
Yes, I'd like a report on the meetings of my small council.
I've been very busy. Many important matters require a king's attention.
You've been holding the council meetings in the Tower of the Hand instead of the small council chamber.
May I ask why?
So if I wanted to attend a council meeting, I would now have to climb all the stairs in the Tower of the Hand?
Time for the bedding ceremony!
Where's your respect for tradition, uncle? Come, everyone! Pick her up and carry her to her wedding bed. Get rid of her gown. She won't be needing it any longer.
Ladies, attend to my uncle. He's not heavy.
What did you say? What... did you... SAY?
Everyone is mine to torment! You'd do well to remember that, you little monster.
I am the king! I will punish you!
My father won the real war. He killed Prince Rhaegar. He took the crown while you hid under Casterly Rock!
I'm not tired.
I'm not... TIRED!
Kneel.
I said... KNEEL!
No.
You'll wait here... un...
It's nothing!
Euron_Greyjoy: I am the storm, brother. The first storm and the last. And you're in my way.
So here I am, with a thousand ships, and two good hands.
In my experience, the surest way to a woman's heart is with a gift. A priceless gift. I won't return to King's Landing until I have that for you.
Renly_Baratheon: What are you two conspiring about? Well, whatever it is, you'd best hurry up. My brother is coming.
We should've had them both killed years ago.
A pity you lost the bet. It would've been so nice for you to have a friend.
Be serious.
I'm fourth in line.
Stannis?
He's still my older brother.
Simpler time.
It was, Your Grace.
It sounds exhilarating.
Once. I think.
Rise. Remove your helm.
You are all your father promised and more, my lady. I've seen Ser Loras bested once or twice, but... never quite in that fashion.
That he did, my queen. But there can be only one champion! Brienne of Tarth, you may ask anything of me you desire. If it is within my power, it is yours.
Done! Rise, Brienne of the Kingsguard.
Can that truly be you?
When I saw your standard, I couldn't be sure. Whose banner is that?
I suppose if we use the same one, the battle will be terribly confusing. Why is your stag on fire?
Ah, you must be this fire priestess we hear so much about. Mm, brother... now I understand why you found religion in your old age.
No, no, I'm relieved. I never really believed you were a fanatic. Charmless, rigid, a bore, yes, but... but not a godly man.
"Born amidst salt and smoke." Is he a ham?

The whole realm denies it from Dorne to the Wall. Old men deny it with their death rattle and unborn children deny it in their mothers' wombs. No one wants you for their king. You never wanted any friends, brother, but a man without friends is a man without power.
Look across those fields, brother. Do you see all those banners?
No. The men holding those bolts of cloth will make me king.
Now you do the Lannisters' bidding, is that it? Tell me, was my brother's body even cold before you secured your newest patron?
Just not a loyal one.

I don't like you, Lord Baelish. I don't like your face. I don't like the words that come oozing out of your mouth. I don't want you in my tent one minute more than necessary. So tell me, why are you here?
You can trust Brienne. Her loyalty comes without charge.
Now I understand. You know I have the numbers. You know I'm marching on King's Landing. When I take the throne, you hope to retain your position... and your head.
Qyburn: Your Grace, that old rumor you told me about, my little birds investigated.
Lord_Varys: The first to arrive and the last to leave. I admire your industry.
We all have our qualities.
I think you are mistaking business with pleasure.
Oh, I'm sure. Lord Redwyne likes his boys very young, I hear.
Though I suppose beauty is a subjective quality, no? Is it true that Ser Marlon of Tumblestone prefers amputees?

And I heard the most awful rumor about a certain lord with a taste for fresh cadavers. Must be enormously difficult to accommodate that inclination. The logistics alone... to find beautiful corpses before they rot.
Strictly speaking.
Do you know I have no idea where they are? And we had been so close. But enough about me, how have you been since we last saw each other?
Now, the last time I saw you, you were talking to the Hand of the King.
Eyes I own.

Everyone's well aware of your enduring... fondness for Lord Stark's wife. If the Lannisters were behind the attempt on the Stark boy's life, and it was discovered that you helped the Starks come to that conclusion... to think... a simple word to the queen...
Have you?
Oh, please.
Disturbing news from far away. Hadn't you heard?
No rumor, my lord, the princess is with child.
Ser Jorah Mormont. He is serving as advisor to the Targaryens.

I understand your misgivings, my lord. Truly, I do. It is a terrible thing we must consider, a vile thing. Yet we who presume to rule must sometimes do vile things for the good of the realm. Should the gods grant Daenerys a son, the realm will bleed.
The wolf and the lion will be at each other's throats. We will be at war soon, my friend.
Delay, you say. Move fast, I reply. This is no longer a game for two players.
How is your son, my lord?
But his mind is sound?
A blessing, then. I suffered an early mutilation myself. Some doors close forever, others open in most unexpected places.
May I?

If the wrong ears heard what I'm about to tell you, off comes my head. And who would mourn poor Varys then? North or south, they sing no songs for spiders. But there are things you must know. You are the King's Hand and the king is a fool. Your friend, I know, but a fool, and doomed unless you save him.
I didn't trust you.
The queen is not the only one who has been watching you closely. There are few men of honor in the capital. You are one of them. I would like to believe that I am another, strange as that may seem.
The same sort as Jon Arryn. "The tears of Lys," they call it. A rare and costly thing. As clear and tasteless as water, it leaves no trace.
Some dear friend, no doubt, but which one? There were many. Lord Arryn was a kind and trusting man. There was one boy. All he was, he owed to Jon Arryn.
Pity what happened to him. Just when his life seemed to be going so nicely.
He started asking questions.
Do you know I have no idea where they are? And we had been so close.
We have nothing but gratitude for your long service, good ser. You shall be given a stout keep beside the sea, with servants to look after your every need.
Lord Stark. You must be thirsty.
I promise you, it isn't poison.
Why is it no one ever trusts the eunuch?
Not so much, my lord. I would save the rest if I were you. Hide it. Men have been known to die of thirst in these cells.
The younger one seems to have escaped the castle. Even my little birds cannot find her.
Still engaged to Joffrey. Cersei will keep her close. The rest of your household are... all dead, it grieves me to say. I do so hate the sight of blood.
And would again, my lord. I was unarmed, unarmored, and surrounded by Lannister swords. When you look at me, do you see a hero?
What madness led you to tell the queen you'd learned the truth about Joffrey's birth?

Ah, the children. It's always the innocents who suffer. It wasn't the wine that killed Robert, nor the boar. The wine slowed him down and the boar ripped him open, but it was your mercy that killed the king.
I trust you know you're a dead man, Lord Eddard.
The wrong brother, sadly, and lost to her. Your wife has let the Imp slip through her fingers.
Not today, my lord.
The realm, my lord. Someone must.
Pity. Such a pity. What of your daughter's life, my lord? Is that a precious thing to you?
To find so lovely a creature working in your father's kitchens - it almost beggars belief.
You will be pleased to know our mutual friend is doing quite well in Lady Sansa's service.
And it seems the Grand Maester has found his way into a black cell?
Well played, my lord Hand. But should I be worried? Janos Slynt, Pycelle... the small council grows smaller every day.
Power is a curious thing, my lord. Are you fond of riddles?
Three great men sit in a room
Does it? He has neither crown, nor gold, nor favor with the gods.
But if it's swordsmen who rule, why do we pretend kings hold all the power? When Ned Stark lost his head, who was truly responsible? Joffrey? The executioner? Or something else?
Power resides where men believe it resides. It's a trick. A shadow on the wall. And a very small man can cast a very large shadow.
My Lord Hand, Commander. I must compliment on the Gold Cloaks' performance these last few weeks.
Given the circumstances, my lord, I believe extreme measures are warranted.
No man can be in all rooms at all times. I have many little birds in the North, my lord, but I haven't heard their songs since Theon Greyjoy captured Winterfell.
I am trying.
Oh, no one disputes that, my lord, not even the multitudes who despise you.
I wish we could, too.
If we're going to play, you'll have to start.
A most highborn plumber.
You're quite good at being Hand, you know. Jon Arryn and Ned Stark were good men. Honorable men. But they disdained the game and those who played. You enjoy the game.
And you play it well.
They say he burns his enemies alive to honor the Lord of Light.
In the Summer Isles, they worship a fertility goddess with sixteen teats.
This morning I heard a song. All the way from Qarth, beyond the Red Waste. Danaerys Targaryen lives.
She has three dragons. But even if what they say is true, it will be years before they are fully grown. And then there'll be nowhere to hide.
I've always hated the bells. They ring for horror. A dead king, a city under siege...
Exactly.
I choose my allies carefully, and my enemies more carefully still.
Neither. A babe in the woods. I admired her father.
I could not help Lord Stark. Perhaps I can help his daughter.
You're not the only one who has taken an interest in her.
Indeed. She'd make a lovely match for the right suitor.
Littlefinger is not long for the capital. A confidant of mine has told me that when he goes, Sansa Stark goes with him.
Littlefinger was born with no lands, no wealth, no armies. He has acquired the first two. How long before he has the army?
Perhaps you'll laugh, but I know him better than most, and this is the truth. Littlefinger is one of the most dangerous men in Westeros. If Robb Stark falls, Sansa Stark is the key to the North.
Which seems such a shame. Why should a man with such a low reputation steal away such a lovely bride?
Actually, I rather enjoy him. But he would see this country burn if he could be king of the ashes.
You are too kind. I believe I have a possible solution.
My lady. I wanted to personally welcome you to King's Landing. The city has been made brighter by your presence.
A little obvious, perhaps.
Might I sit?
You've taken an interest in Sansa Stark.
Is she?
She has, sadly. Well, forgive me for wasting your time. I thought we shared certain hopes for her well-being.
A thousand blades, taken from the hands of Aegon's fallen enemies. Forged in the fiery breath of Balerion the Dread.
Heh. I'm sure you have. Ugly old thing.
The Lysa Arryn of chairs. Shame you had to settle for your second choice.
Thwarting you has never been my primary ambition, I promise you. Although, who doesn't like to see their friends fail now and then.
I did what I did for the good of the realm.
But what do we have left, once we abandon the lie? Chaos? A gaping pit waiting to swallow us all.
Tyrion Lannister is one of the few people alive who could make this country a better place. He has the mind for it, he has the will, he has the right last name. And you - you are a complication.
When I see what desire does to people, what it's done to this country, I am very glad to have no part in it. Besides, the absence of desire leaves one free to pursue other things.
What have you done?
Quickly.
Trust me, my friend. I brought you this far.
No. I only know what it's like to pick up your shit and throw it overboard.
You have your father's instincts for politics and you have compassion.
I never said you were perfect.

The Seven Kingdoms need someone stronger than Tommen but gentler than Stannis. A monarch who could intimidate the High Lords and inspire the people. A ruler loved by millions, with a powerful army, and the right family name.
Who said anything about "him"?
Any fool with a bit of luck can find himself born into power. But earning it for yourself, that takes work.
Peace. Prosperity. A land where the powerful do not prey on the powerless.
Perhaps. And perhaps we've grown so used to horror we assume there's no other way.

You have a choice, my friend. You can stay here at Illyrio's palace and drink yourself to death or you can ride with me to Meereen, meet Daenerys Targaryen and decide if the world is worth fighting for
I don't believe in saviors. I believe men of talent have a part to play in the war to come.
I saved your life. If they catch you, they catch me. I cannot say I feel overly guilty about leaving you in that fucking crate.
You already drank yourself across the Narrow Sea.
Because we are talking about the future of our country.
Cersei has offered a lordship to the man who brings her your head.
You were quite good, you know. At ruling. During your brief tenure as Hand.
Still, a man of talent.
Yes, but you show great promise in other areas as well.
Why?
Are we really going to spend the entire road to Volantis talking about the futility of everything?
People follow leaders, and they will never follow us. They find us repulsive.
Where are you going?
It's a perfectly good face.
Volantis is a large city.
The likelihood of you being spotted here increases a hundredfold.
I'm not sure how many new ways I can find of saying this.
If anyone recognizes you, you'll lose more than that.
Hello, old friend. I thought we were so happy together until you abandoned me.
The birds sing in the west, the birds sing in the east, if one knows how to listen. They tell me you've already found favor with the Mother of Dragons.
Information is the key. You need to learn your enemy's strengths and strategies. You need to learn which of your friends are not your friends.
If only. A grand old city, choking on violence, corruption, and deceit. Who could possibly have any experience managing such a massive ungainly beast?
Oh, I know.
I do not make dwarf jokes.
Of course. Men can be fickle, but birds I always trust.
I can't go off on a secret mission in the company of the most famous dwarf in the city.
Fire and Blood.
I would expect nothing less from the Mother of Dragons.
Jon Snow.
Nothing good.
Not burn him alive alongside his son?

That's what I used to tell myself about her father. I found traitors, but I wasn't the one burning them alive. I was only a purveyor of information. It's what I told myself when I watched them beg for mercy, "I'm not the one doing it." When the pitch of their screams rose higher, "I'm not the one doing it." When their hair caught fire and the smell of their burning flesh filled the throne room, "I'm not the one doing it."
Jon_Snow: What the hell do you know about being a bastard?
There are five pups. The direwolf is the sigil of your house. They were meant to have them.
Why do you read so much?
Is this a trick?
Until your brother killed that king.
First lesson
I already have one.
Of course I have.
We've guarded the Kingdoms for eight thousand years.
Soon enough.
What kind of reports?
I remember.
I build my own fires.
What's my name?
And why is my surname Snow?

I never met my mother. My father wouldn't even tell me her name. I don't know if she's living or dead. I don't know if she's a noblewoman or a fisherman's wife... or a whore. So I sat there in the brothel as Ros took off her clothes. But I couldn't do it. Because all I could think was what if I got her pregnant and she had a child, another bastard named Snow? It's not a good life for a child.
Come stand by the fire. It's warmer.
You're not. You're freezing.
You can't fight... you can't see... you're afraid of heights and almost everything else, probably.
What are you doing here, Sam?
Yes, he is.
Well, you can't get any worse.
Watch duty with Sam.
He wasn't hungry.

That's enough. Sam's no different from the rest of us. There was no place for him in the world, so he's come here. We're not gonna hurt him in the training yard anymore. Never again, no matter what Thorne says. He's our brother now, and we're going to protect him.
I wouldn't doubt it.
Sally on the side?
I didn't think you'd be so upset about it.
No.
No. As a matter of fact, I'm the same as you.
I came very close once. I was alone in a room with a naked girl, but...
I know where to put it.
Young and gorgeous. A whore named Ros.
Red.
You don't want to know.
Better.
How do you know that?
What else did the book say?
Just these two, My Lord. Been dead awhile, I'd say.
We should burn them.
No.
He... He would do whatever was right. No matter what.
Sam told you.
And this is my day? Is that what you are saying?
You do not know! No one knows. I may be a bastard, but he is my father and Robb is my brother!
Who are you?
You're Aemon Targaryen.
