My friends brought me back.
No.
Beyond the Wall?
It's Qhorin Halfhand.
What's wrong with him?
Yes.
I understand.
You want to protect your people.
No.
You kill someone for them?
Did I seem scared the other day?
Only in the beginning.
What secret?
I won't.
Aren't you?
I won't.
It's a windmill.
Ygritte, you won't win. I know your people are brave, no one denies that.
Six times in last thousand years a King Beyond the Wall has attacked the Kingdoms. Six times they failed.

Every boy in the North knows it. We grow up learning it. Where the battles were fought. The names of the heroes. Who died where. Six times you've invaded and six times you've failed. The seventh will be the same.
You don't have the discipline. You don't have the training. Your army is no army. You don't know how to fight together.
I do. I know it. If you attack the Wall, you'll die. All of you.
Yes, first we'll live.
He breeds them for the Watch.
The Watch protects him.
We just take the horses and go. The old man's no threat.
The Watch might send a few men looking for a horse thief. They'll send a lot more to hunt down murderers.
Ygritte, you know I didn't have a choice. You always knew who I was, what I am. I have to go home now. I know you won't hurt me.
I know you love me. I have to go home now.
Have you ever been beyond the Wall, sir?
And now you're here. Must not have been very good at your job.
Hush. Don't talk.
We'll go back there.
It was a difficult decision either way, ser.
Aye. You should have.
Those are giants riding mammoths down there!

It's... there's this person, this whole other person. And you're wrapped up in them, and they're wrapped up in you. And you... for a little... for a little while, you're more than just you. You're... well, I don't know! I'm not a bleeding poet.
Going to find Mance.

Who's left to give orders? The Wildling army's only an army because of Mance. He united 100 warring tribes. Without Mance, they lose their leader. They lose their purpose. They go back to fighting each other. Scatter back to their home.
I'm gonna try.
They'll kill me? If I don't go, they'll kill me anyway. They'll kill the rest of us, too.
You're right. It's a bad plan... What's your plan?
What do you want me to say?
So you and Gilly never...?
But if she had, you would have? You'd have broken your vows?
What?
I don't think Ser Alliser cares much for interpretation.
He's dead. He killed my friend, Grenn.
Grenn came from a farm.
She told you?
They'll burn you alive.
I swore a vow to the Night's Watch. If I don't take my own word seriously, what sort of "Lord of Winterfell" would I be?
Lord Janos, I'm giving you command of Greyguard.
Yes, the Fort is in a sorry state, restore it as best you can. First Builder Yarwick can spare 10...
You mistake me, my lord. That was a command, not an offer. Pack your arms and armour, say your farewells, and ride for Greyguard.
Are you refusing to obey my order?
If you have any last words, my lord, now's the time.
I heard it was best to keep your enemies close.
The dragonglass-!
I'm not a god.
Wear it. Burn it. Whatever you want. You have Castle Black.
My watch is ended.
I don't know how to do that. I thought I did, but... I failed.
I think so. Hold off on burning my body for now.
We never should have left Winterfell.
How could we know?
We were children.
There's nothing to forgive.
All right, all right, I forgive you!
You'd think after thousands of years, the Night's Watch would have learned how to make a good ale.
Where will *we* go. If I don't look after you, Father's ghost will come back and murder me.
I'm not the lord commander anymore.
I'm not the lord commander anymore.

To the traitor and bastard Jon Snow, You allowed thousands of wildlings past the wall, you have betrayed your own kind, you have betrayed the North. Winterfell is mine, bastard, come and see. Your brother Rickon is in my dungeon, his direwolf's skin is on my floor, come and see. I want my bride back. Send her to me, bastard, and I won't trouble you or your wildling lovers. Keep her from me and I will ride north and slaughter every wildling, man, woman and babe living under your protection. You will watch as I skin them living. You...
Just more of the same.
Thank you, my lady. How many fighting men can we expect?
Thank you, my lady. How many fighting men could we expect?
Lord Glover, if you could just hear us out.
The Boltons are traitors. Roose Bolton...
House Mormont.
We sent raven to Houses Manderly...
Lord Glover...
My lady. You weren't at the war council.
Any advice?
I will never let him touch you again. I will protect you, I promise.
We're digging trenches all along our flanks. They won't be able to hit us the way Stannis hit you, in a double envelopment.
A pincer move.
They won't be able to hit us from the sides.
Well, father always promised, didn't he?
What is that?
You said Lord Baelish sold you to the Boltons.
And you trust him?
What did father use to say? Everything before the word 'but' is horseshit.
You don't belong down here.
I have nothing to say to you.
Touch my sister and I'll kill you myself.
She is.
I didn't ask.
She's starting to let on.
You'll be ruling over a graveyard if we don't defeat the Night's King.

I mean no offense, Your Grace, but I don't know you. As far as I can tell, your claim to the throne rests entirely on your father's name, and my own father fought to overthrow the Mad King. The lords of the North placed their trust in me to lead them, and I will continue to do so as well as I can.
As long as you tell me how a Lannister became Hand to Daenerys Targaryen.
My people... won't accept a southern ruler. Not after everything they've suffered.
Who?
I think she has a good heart.
What you did for her... is the only reason I'm not killing you.
I saw the Night King, Davos. I looked into his eyes. How many men do we have in the north to fight him? 10,000? Less?
I would never presume to...

I never thought that dragons would exist again. No one did. The people who follow you know that you made something impossible happen. Maybe that helps them believe that you can make other impossible things happen. Build a world that's different from the shit one they've always known. But if you use them...
...to melt castles and burn cities, you're not different. You're just more of the same.
He's right. We're all on the same side.
We're all breathing.
If I don't return, at least you won't have to deal with the King in the North anymore.

With respect, Your Grace, I don't need your permission. I am a king. Now I came here, knowing that you could have your men behead me or your dragons burn me alive. I put must trust in you. A stranger. Because I knew it was the best chance for my people. For ALL our people. Now I'm asking you to trust in a stranger because it's our best chance.
Two.
Both.
I'm sorry. I'm so sorry.
I wish I could take it back. I wish we'd never gone.
Thank you, Dany.
All right. Not 'Dany'. How about 'my queen'? I'd, uh, bend the knee, but...
They'll all come to see you for what you are.
You do.
There is only one war that matters
When enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers, only better and better lies.
It appears Tyrion's assessment was correct. We're fucked.
Your family hasn't seen its end. You're still here.
Who told you that?
Has it occurred to you she might not have been a reliable source of information?
I am true to my word. Or I try to be. That is why I cannot give you what you ask. I cannot serve two queens. And I have already pledged myself to Queen Daenerys of House Targaryen.
So, why are you still talking to me?
This isn't about living in harmony. It's just about living.
Olenna_Tyrell: Kiss me, child.
It's so good of you to visit me and my foolish flock of hens. We're very sorry for your losses.
Gallant, yes, and charming and very clean. He knew how to dress and smile, and somehow this gave him the notion he was fit to be king.
Loras is young and very good at knocking men off horses with a stick. That does NOT make him wise. As for your fathead father...
She might think we have some wits about us. One of us, at any rate.

It was treason. I warned them. Robert has two sons and Renly has an older brother. How can he possibly have any claim to that ugly iron chair? We should have stayed well out of all this, if you ask me. But once the cow's been milked, there's no squirting the cream back up her udder, so here we are to see things through. What do you say to that, Sansa?
Do you know my son? The Lord of Highgarden?
You, you. Who else would know better? We've heard some troubling tales. Is there any truth to them? Has this boy mistreated you?
Has he ripped out your tongue?
Yes, all Lannisters are lions. And when a Tyrell farts, it smells like a rose. But how kind is he? How clever? Has he a good heart, a gentle hand?
Bring me some cheese.
The cheese will be served when I want it served, and I want it served now.
Yes, he had that reputation. And they named him "traitor" and took his head.
Speak freely, child. We would never betray your confidence, I swear it.
Oh. That's a pity.
Ah! Here comes my cheese.
Oh no, not at all. A sword swallower through and through.
Impossible.
My grandson is the pride of Highgarden. The most desirable bachelor in all seven kingdoms. Your daughter...
Old.
Old. I'm something of an expert on the subject.
As an authority on myself I must diasgree.
Help the poor boy!
Idiots! Help your King!
Nonsense. Your circumstances have improved markedly. You may not have enjoyed watching him die, but you enjoyed it more than you would have enjoyed being married to him, I can promise you that.
Our alliance with the Lannisters remains every bit as necessary to them as it is unpleasant for us. You did wonderful work on Joffrey. The next one should be easier.
Well, if it isn't the famous tart Queen Cersei.
Many will die no matter what we do. Better them than us.
You've lost, Cersei. It's the only joy I can find in all this misery.
The last time a Tyrell came to Dorne, he was assassinated. Hundred red scorpions, was it?
You murder your own prince, but you expect me to trust you?
What is your name again? Barbaro?
Do shut up, dear.
Anything from you?
No? Good. Let the grown women speak.
Cersei stole the future from me. She killed my son. She killed my grandson. She killed my granddaughter. Survival is not what I'm after now.

That's very nice to hear. Of course, I can't remember a queen who was better loved than my granddaughter. The common people loved her, the Nobles loved her, and what is left of her now? Ashes. Commoners, Nobles, they're all just children, really. They won't obey you unless they fear you.
He really was a cunt, wasn't he?
It's done?
And now the rains weep o'er our halls.
Your brother and his new queen thought you would be defending Casterly Rock.
So you just let them take it?
And you took your army, your real army, and went where they weren't.
Yes. You must be very wise by now.
Which is Sansa Stark?
Yes, Ned Stark had many admirers. And how many stepped forward when the executioner came for his head?
How?
That's hardly surprising. She's a beautiful girl with a famous name.
It almost feels as if you're about to arrive at the point.
And why have you come to me with this matter?
And if Littlefinger marries her, he'll have the key in his pocket.
You are a clever man, Lord Varys.
One doesn't need to be clever for that. It's all rather obvious, isn't it?

Another golden rose, how original. I eat from plates stamped with roses, I sleep in sheets embroidered with roses, I have a golden rose painted on my chamber pot... as if that makes it smell any better. Roses are boring, dear.

"Growing Strong." Ha! The dullest words of any House. "Winter Is Coming." Now that's memorable. "We Do Not Sow." Strong, strong, those are Houses you watch out for. Direwolves and krakens, fierce beasts... but a golden rose growing strong? Ha! That strikes fear in the heart.
Look, little loves. A spider in the garden. Run along, now. Grow strong.
The city is made brighter by my presence? Is that your usual line, Lord Varys? Are you here to seduce me?
Oh, no, please! Seduce away, it's been so long. Though I rather think it's all for naught. What happens when the nonexistent bumps against the decrepit?
A question for the philosophers. But you've come mincing all this way for something. So?
No.
Come, I've heard you're such a clever man. I'm curious why you sought me out.
Have I? Because I spoke to her once in this garden, and one of your little spies came running to tell you? Why shouldn't I take an interest? She's an interesting girl.
No, not particularly. But she's had an interesting childhood.
Walk with me. I know the walls have ears, but apparently the shrubbery does, too.
Gods, boy, that's enough, we're not in a tavern.
I always take figs mid-afternoon. They help move the bowels. To what do I owe this summons?
I climbed all those steps to discuss "financial matters"?
Naturally.
What good is the word "extravagant" if it can't be used to describe a royal wedding?
Good.
And?
Ah. I'd nearly forgotten.

As is a royal wedding. The people are hungry for more than just food. They crave distractions. And if we don't provide them, they'll create their own. And their distractions are likely to end with us being torn to pieces. A royal wedding is much safer, wouldn't you say?
And traditionally paid for by the royal family.
I was told you were drunk, impertinent, and thoroughly debauched. You can imagine my disappointment at finding nothing but a browbeaten bookkeeper.
Where did you go for them, Volantis?
Oh, very well. I won't have it said that House Tyrell refuses to play its part. We'll pay for half the expenses, and the celebrations will go on as planned. Is that sufficient?
Very good, then. That's settled. Good day.
Gods boy, that's enough. We're not in a tavern.
No need to speak.
Catelyn_Stark: All these years, and I still feel like an outsider when I come here.
I wonder if the old gods agree.
I am so sorry, my love.
There was a raven from King's Landing. Jon Arryn is dead. A fever took him.
I know he was like a father to you.
They both have their health, gods be good.
The raven brought more news. The king rides for Winterfell... with the queen, and all the rest of them.
You can always say no, Ned.
Do you have to?
Ned... ten is too young to see such things.
We'll need plenty of candles for Lord Tyrion's chamber. I'm told he reads all night.
How much could he possibly drink, a man of his... stature?
In any case, candles.
I want you to promise me, no more climbing.
Do you know what? You always look at your feet before you lie.
I would have dressed, your Grace.
Remove his hood.
I did. Often, and loudly.
And why would I do that?
Shadowcats and hill tribes are the least of your concerns.
Five years ago.
I am not a murderer, Lannister.
The dagger found...
To whom do I speak?
There was no time to send word.
That's why there was no time. He is my prisoner.
My sister will decide what he looks like.
If you lose, your father dies, your sisters die, we die.
I suppose it does.
Because of men like you.
Listen to yourselves. If you were sons of mine, I would knock your heads together and lock you in a bedchamber until you remembered that you were brothers.
We share a common enemy.
I vow that you shall always have a place in my home and at my table and that I shall ask no service of you that might bring you dishonor. I swear it by the old gods and the new.
Let me go and talk to Theon.
Lord Karstark! This man is our prisoner.
And crippled mine! He will answer for his crimes, I promise you, but not here.
You will strike me down? Have you forgotten me, ser? I am the widow of you liege lord, Eddard Stark! I am the mother of your king!
You know very well! He has gone to the Crag to accept the surrender!
How dare you!
I understand your grief, my lord. Better than most, I understand it. But in the name of my son, the King in the North, stand down!
Wise men do not make demands of kings.
And gag him!
Robb...
Bran and Rickon are captives in Winterfell. Sansa and Arya are captives in King's Landing. I have five children, and only one of them is free.
I grieve for your sons, My Lord...
Killing Jaime Lannister would not buy life to your children. But returning him to King's Landing may buy life for mine.
Robb...
No.
You can't help because a mother makes one for her children to protect them. Only a mother can make them.
Twice.

After a fashion. I prayed for my son Bran to survive his fall. Many years before that, one of the boys came down with the pox. Maester Luwin said if he made it through the night, he'd live. But it would be a very long night. So I sat with him all through the darkness, listened to his ragged little breaths, his coughing, his whimpering.

Jon Snow. When my husband brought that baby home from the war, I couldn't bear to look at him, didn't want to see those brown stranger's eyes staring at me. So I prayed to the gods "Take him away, make him die". He got the pox and I knew I was the worst woman who ever lived. A murderer. I'd condemned this poor, innocent child to a horrible death all because I was jealous of his mother, a woman he didn't even know! So I prayed to all Seven Gods "Let the boy live. Let him live and I'll love him. I'll be a mother to him. I'll beg my husband to give him a true name, to call him Stark and be done with it, to make him one of us".
And he lived. And I couldn't keep my promise. And everything that's happened since then, all this horror that's come to my family... it's all because I couldn't love a motherless child.

Wait for me, Little Cat, he'd say. Wait for me and I'll come back to you. And I would sit at the window every day when the sun came up, waiting. I wonder, how many times Bran or Rickon stare across the moors of Winterfell waiting for me to return? I will never see them again.
The Karstarks are Northmen. They won't forgive the killing of their lord.
Spare his life. Keep him as a hostage.
Lord Walder! Lord Walder, enough! Let it end!
Please. He is my son, my first son. Let him go and I swear we will forget this. I swear it, by the old gods and new, we will take no vengeance.
Take me for a hostage, but let Robb go!
Robb, get up, get up and walk out. Please, PLEASE!
On my honour as a Tully; on my honour as a Stark, let him go or I will CUT your wife's throat!
Don't you drink, Lord Bolton?
Jaime_Lannister: Robert will choose a new hand of the kingdom to do his job while he's out fucking boars or hunting whores... or is it the other way around?
The things I do for love...
You've much to teach me, no doubt, but our sister craves your attention.
A family trait.
That's an honor I can do without. Their days are too long, their lives are too short.
We're Lannisters. Lannisters don't act like fools.
But even if the boy lives he would be a cripple, a grotesque. Give me a good, clean death anyday.
My dear brother, there are times you make me wonder whose side you're on.
A sword for the Wall?
Good man. Have you swung it yet?
At someone, I mean.
It's a strange thing, first time you cut a man. You realize we're nothing but sacks of meat and blood, and some bone to keep it all standing.
Let me thank you ahead of time for guarding us all from the perils beyond the Wall. Wildlings and white walkers and whatnot. We're grateful to have good, strong men like you protecting us.
Is it "we" already? Have you taken your vows, then?
Give my regards to the Night's Watch. I'm sure it will be thrilling to serve in such an elite force. And if not...
...it's only for life.
I know. People have been swinging at me for years and they always seem to miss.
I have a knack for it.

It must be strange for you... coming into this room. I was standing right here when it happened. He was very brave, your brother. Your father too. They didn't deserve to die like that. Nobody deserves to die like that.

Five hundred men just stood there and watched. All the great knights of the Seven Kingdoms. You think anyone said a word, lifted a finger? No, Lord Stark. Five hundred men and this room was silent as a crypt. Except for the screams, of course, and the mad king laughing. And later... when I watched the mad king die, I remembered him laughing as your father burned... it felt like justice.
Tell me
One of the outlaws in the brotherhood.
I cut his head off, so... no.
He said the same thing he'd been saying for hours... "Burn them all".
If that's all, Your Grace...
I think we can outfox a ten year old.
I'll go to war with him if I have to... they can write a ballad about us, "The War for Cersei's Cunt!"
Never.
The king shits, and the Hand wipes.
Do you remember Thoros of Myr charging through the breach?
Such a small pack of wolves...
Seems he had some trouble on the road. You wouldn't know what happened to him, would you?
Come, Stark. I'd rather you die sword in hand.
Threaten? As in, I'm going to open your lord from balls to brains and see what Starks are made of?
My brother, lord Stark! I want him back!
Poor Ned Stark. Brave man, terrible judgement.
Catelyn Stark took my brother.
Tyrion?
One of our men interfered, speared him through the leg before I could finish him.
It wouldn't have been clean.
I could care less what anyone thinks of me.
It's the truth.
So the lion does concern himself with the opinion...

We could end this war right now, boy, save thousands of lives. You fight for the Starks, I fight for the Lannisters. Swords or lances, teeth, nails - choose your weapons, and let's end this here and now.
If your gods are real, if they're just, why is the world so full of injustice?
There are no men like me. Only me.

King in the North. I keep expecting you to leave me in one castle or another for safekeeping, but you've dragged me along from camp to camp. Have you grown fond of me, Stark? Is that it? I've never seen you with a girl.
You don't trust the loyalty of the men following you into battle?
Smart boy. What's wrong? Don't like being called "boy"?
Insulted?
Well, if that's true, Stannis is the rightful king. How convenient for him.
I was your prisoner when Ned Stark lost his head.
You think my father's going to negotiate with you? You don't know him very well.
Three victories don't make you a conqueror.
I was sixteen once. I also had to replace somone's squire on short notice.
Barristan Selmy. The fight against the kingswood outlaws, before your time.

He was a painter. A painter who only used red.I couldn't imagine being able to fight like that. Not back then. And to help him do it, to be a part of something that perfect. I don't need to explain how that felt, not to you.
It's like stepping into a dream you've been dreaming for as long as you can remember and finding out that the dream is more real than your life.

I'm not well suited for imprisonment. Shocking, I know. Some men are. Ned Stark? I imagine he made an excellent prisoner right up until the end. But me, though... my life has left me uniquely unfit for constraint.
Of course. Every day.
Good prisoners breed good jailers, apparently. The Starks are very careful. There is a way, I think. It wasn't possible until now.
It's actually quite simple.
You'll only have to do one thing.
Thank you for fighting on my behalf, Lady Stark. I would've come to your defense, but...
You've become a real she-wolf in your later years. There's not much fish left in you.
It's a long way to King's Landing. Might as well get to know one another. Have you known many men? I suppose not. Women? Horses? Aha!
I didn't mean to give offense, My Lady. Forgive me.
Why do you hate me so much? Have I ever harmed you?
Has anyone ever told you you're as boring as you are ugly?
I already have. Look at you. You're ready to chop my head off. Do you think you could? Do you think you can beat me in a fair fight?
The answer is no. There are three men in the kingdoms who might have a chance against me. You're not one of them.
If you're so confident, unlock my chains. Let's see what happens.
I took you for a fighter, a man - oh, pardon - woman of honor. Was I wrong? You're afraid.
I wish someone would have told me, I wouldn't have had to steal that pig.
Apparently eating is now a crime. Who knew?
But it's not a crime to starve. That's justice for you.
For stealing a pig?
It's a tough decision. Take the bridge and risk being seen, or cross the great water.
Anyone can see us on the bridge, but cross by water and the current could take us, or I could escape down the river.
It's wonderful to watch you wrestle with these dilemmas. Which will she choose?
Gambler at heart. Wouldn't have guessed.
Do you know how long it's going to take us to get to King's Landing walking through fields and forests?
So how shall we pass the time?
It's going to be a very dull walk.

No one enjoys the company of a humorless mute. Trust me on this. People have been serving me since I was born. You think Lady Stark is going to want a giant towheaded plank following her around for the rest of her life?
A week's journey with you and she'll order you to fall on your sword.
All the good it's done her.
I hope you're pleased. If you had armed me, they would never have taken us.
I was in chains if you recall. Our little match would have ended quite quick if my hands weren't bound.
I've been sitting in a muddy pen wrapped in chains for the past year.
You were not beating me.
My father...
When we make camp tonight, you'll be raped. More than once. None of these men have ever been with a noblewomen. You'd be wise not to resist.
They'll knock your teeth out.
No, I don't think you care about your teeth. If you fight them, they will kill you, do you understand? I'm the prisoner of value, not you.
I'm dying.
Not so hard. You'll scrub the skin off.
I need a bath. Help me out of these rags.
Now get out.
This one suits me fine.
Don't worry. I'm not interested.
If I faint, pull me out. I don't intend to be the first Lannister to die in a bath tub.
You swore a solemn vow, remember? You are supposed to get me to King's Landing in one piece. Not going so well, is it? No wonder Renly died with you guarding him.
That was unworthy. Forgive me. You protected me better than most...
I'm apologizing. I'm sick of fighting. Let's call a truce.
I trust you.
There it is. There's the look. I've seen it for seventeen years on face after face. You all despise me. Kingslayer. Oathbreaker. A man without honor. You've heard of wildfire?

The Mad King was obsessed with it. He loved to watch people burn, the way their skin blackened and blistered and melted off their bones. He burned lords he didn't like. He burned Hands who disobeyed him. He burned anyone who was against him. Before long, half the country was against him. Aerys saw traitors everywhere. So he had his pyromancer place caches of wildfire all over the city. Beneath the Sept of Baelor and the slums of Flea Bottom. Under houses, stables, taverns. Even beneath the Red Keep itself. Finally, the day of reckoning came. Robert Baratheon marched on the capital after his victory at the Trident. But my father arrived first with the whole Lannister army at his back, promising to defend the city against the rebels. I knew my father better than that. He's never been one to pick the losing side. I told the Mad King as much. I urged him to surrender peacefully. But the king didn't listen to me. He didn't listen to Varys who tried to warn him. But he did listen to Grand Maester Pycelle, that grey sunken cunt. "You can trust the Lannisters," he said "The Lannisters have always been true friends of the crown". So we opened the gates and my father sacked the city. Once again, I came to the king, begging him to surrender. He told me to bring him my father's head. Then he turned to his pyromancer. "Burn them all," he said "Burn them in their homes. Burn them in their beds". Tell me, if your precious Renly commanded you to kill your own father and stand by while thousands of men, women, and children burned alive, would you have done it? Would you have kept your oath then?

First, I killed the pyromancer. And then, when the king turned to flee, I drove my sword into his back. "Burn them all," he kept saying "Burn them all". I don't think he expected to die. He... he meant to... burn with the rest of us and rise again, reborn as a dragon to turn his enemies to ash. I slit his throat to make sure that didn't happen. That's where Ned Stark found me.
No milk of the poppy.
I'll scream.
I'll scream loudly.
Lord Bolton... is there word from the capital?
I owe you a debt.
You like it so much, you're welcome to chop off your own hand and take it.
Days?
Yes, there she is. And?
To return the Stark girls to their mother who is now dead.

Well, Arya Stark hasn't been seen since her father was killed. Where do you think she is? My money's on dead. There's a certain safety in death, wouldn't you say? And Sansa Stark is now Sansa Lannister. Bit of a complication.
What do you want me to do? Kidnap my sister-in-law? And take her where? Where would she be safer than here?
Ser Loras, it's quite all right.
Your sister looks very beautiful.
So... looking forward to your wedding?
Our fathers are both rather keen on the prospect.
Perhaps they should get married.
If you were to marry Cersei, she'd murder you in your sleep.
If you somehow managed to put a child in her first, she'd murder him, too, long before he drew his first breath. Luckily for you, none of this will happen because you'll never marry her.
My brother tells me you can keep your mouth shut. Unusual talent for a sellsword.
Is this place safe?
Uh-huh.
Ahh! Bold warrior you are, attacking a man when his guard's down.
If I still had my right hand...
Come on, then.
I'm not hungry.
No, I'll do it. Leave us.
I can hold a sword, but all my instincts are wrong. How can I protect the king when I can hardly wipe my own arse?
I'm not Father, I'm the Kingslayer. When people find out I can't slay a pigeon...
With whom? You? Men talk. As soon as someone discovers I can't fight, he'll tell everyone.
Move away!
Joffrey! Joffrey!
Joffrey!
You stood for him in his trial by combat at the Eyrie.
They say the best swords have names. Any ideas?
You know what's coming?
Now that you mention it, she did ask.
Depends. Did you do it?
"The Kingslayer Brothers". You like it? I like it.
Are you really asking if I'd kill my brother?
How can I help you?
You know I can't.
What do you want me to do? Kill the guards? Sneak you out of the city in the back of a cart? I'm the Lord Commander of the Kingsguard.
Inappropriate? You're accused of killing the king. Freeing you is treason.
Which is why we're having a trial.
Not just yours. She's offering a knighthood to whomever finds Sansa Stark.
She had more reason than anyone in the Seven Kingdoms. Do you think it's a coincidence she disappeared the same night Joffrey died?
To tell you the truth, this isn't so bad. Four walls. A pot to piss in. I was chained to a wooden post, covered in my own shit, for months.
Maybe a bit.
I'm sorry I didn't come sooner.
Mmm. It's yours.

It was reforged from Ned Stark's sword. You'll use it to defend Ned Stark's daughter. You swore an oath to return the Stark girls to their mother. Lady Stark's dead. Arya's probably dead, too, but there's still a chance to find Sansa and get her somewhere safe.
What?
You know why. She'd hoped I'd send her daughters back to her.
I swore by all the gods that if her daughters were alive, I'd return them to her.
I wanted to get back to you. Should I have told her to fuck off?
Catelyn Stark's dead.
You're going to be found guilty.
When you are, you need to enter a formal plea for mercy and asked to be sent to the Wall. Father's agreed to it. He'll spare your life and allow you to join the Night's Watch.
My father isn't Joffrey. He'll keep his word.
Do you trust me?
Keep your mouth shut, no more outbursts. This will all be over soon.
You condemned your own son to death.
This isn't a trial, it's a farce. Cersei has manipulated everything and you know it.
You always hated Tyrion.
As did I! Do you know the last order the 'Mad King' gave me? It was to bring him your head. I saved your life so you could murder my brother?
Justice?
He will be executed.

Once you said family is what lives on. All that lives on. You told me about a dynasty that would last 1,000 years. What happens to your dynasty when Tyrion dies? I'm a Kingsguard, forbidden by oath to carry on the family line.
What happens to your name? Who carries the lion banner into future battles? Your nephews? Lancel Lannister? Others whose names I don't even remember?
It survives, through me. I'll leave the Kingsguard, I'll take my place as your son and heir, if you let Tyrion live.
You have my word.
He's willing to sacrifice any of us.
Careful. I'm the last friend you've got.
Beheading.
Of course. Wet nurse dropped him on his head. Left him simple.
Nothing made YOU happier. You'd think being tormented from birth would have given you some affinity for the afflicted.
The joke wore thin, though.
I had other interests.
Why?
Every day around the world, men, women and children are murdered by the score. Who gives a dusty fuck about a bunch of beetles?
He was twice your size.
I don't know.
Good luck today.
Is that any way to speak about our mother?
No.
You should be happy to go back then.
Varys set him free.
He murdered my father. If I ever see him, I'll split him in two. And then I'll give him your regards.
I like to improvise.
We don't choose who we love. It just... well... it's beyond our control. I sound like an idiot.
What I'm trying to say, what I'm trying and failing to say...
No, I'm afraid you don't.
Fuck prophecy. Fuck fate. Fuck everyone who isn't us.
The gods won't mind. They've spilled more blood than all of us combined.
And you'll get all three. "A Lannister always - "
You have better instincts than anyone else in the Lannister army.
Get word to the Blackfish. I want to parley.
He's an old man.
Someone certainly does.
You're an anointed knight! There's quite a difference.
If you surrender, I'll spare the loves of your men. On my honor.
Not everybody wants to die for someone else's home.
Have you ever met the Blackfish?
He's even more stubborn than you are.
I never thought you'd find her. I just assumed Sansa was dead.
In my experience, girls like her don't live very long.
Not my type.
They're not good at anything. I know the ironborn. They're bitter, angry little people. All they know how to do is steal things they can't build or grow themselves.
Even Lannisters can't survive without allies. Where are our allies now? You saw what happened to Walder Frey and his family.

We couldn't. He was a useless old coward, but the Freys supported us. Now they're all dead. Whoever killed them is no friend of ours. We need allies. Stronger, better allies. We can't win this war alone.
Maybe it really is all cocks in the end.
Lord Tarly.
Rickard... isn't it?
That's it.
Widow's Wail.
It is.
The truth is Casterly Rock isn't worth much anymore. Well, it is to me, but my fond childhood memories won't keep Cersei on the throne.

For now. They won't be able to hold it. Euron Greyjoy's navy burned their ships, we emptied the larders before we left. Eventually, they'll be forced to abandon their position and march all the way across Westeros.
As Robb Stark did to me at Whispering Wood. There are always lessons in failures.
Rickon.
I'm not abandoning my army!
We can hold them off.
Don't you mean we're fucked?
Don't talk about Father.
You want Cersei to bend the knee, you can ask her yourself.
You could have killed me.

I just saw the Dothraki fight. They'll beat any mercenary army, they'll beat any army I've ever seen. Killing our men wasn't war for them, it was sport. Her dragon burned a thousand wagons. Qyburn's scorpion fired bolts bigger than you. They couldn't stop it. And she has three of them! This isn't a war we can win.
He didn't.
I'm not talking about Father. Tyrion didn't kill Joffrey, he had nothing to do with it.
It was Olenna. She confessed before she died.
After.

If you were Olenna, would you rather have seen your granddaughter married to Joffrey or Tommen? Which one would Margaery have been better able to control? Which one would have made Olenna the true ruler of the seven kingdoms? She was telling the truth.
She's dead. Like her son, her grandchildren, her whole house. And if we don't find a way out of this war, we'll follow them.
This isn't about noble houses. This is about the living and the dead.
The thrill will fade.
Men without cocks. You wouldn't find me fighting in an army if I had no cock. What's left to fight for?
Gold?
Family.
Maybe it really is all cocks in the end.
Yes. He's always been a champion of the downtrodden.
You plotted with Euron Greyjoy without telling me, the commander of your armies?
I didn't conspire with him.
I pledged to ride north. I intend to honor that pledge.
Doesn't matter what I'd call it.
Give the order, then.
You plotted with Euron Greyjoy without telling me, the commander of your armies?
I didn't conspire with him.
I pledged to ride north. I intend to honor that pledge.
Doesn't matter what I'd call it.
Give the order, then.
Alliser_Thorne: Enjoying yourselves?

Good. One of my better ideas.
The council has a reputation for serving past Hands poorly. I don't mean to follow Ned Stark to the grave.
Why? Am I about to hear one?
Depends on the sellsword.
He has a sword, the power of life and death.
I've decided I don't like riddles.
You disappoint me, Grand Maester.
So loyal that you told the queen about my plans to send Myrcella to Dorne.
See, I told Varys that I was giving the princess to the Greyjoys. I told Littlefinger I planned to wed her to Robyn Arryn. I told no one that I was offering her to the Dornish. No one but you.
Cut off his manhood and feed it to the goats.
Well make do!
Oh, and remember...
Myrcella is a princess. Some would say she was born for this.
Dorne is the safest place for her.
That's why we need to seduce them. We're going to need their support in the war your son started.
A guest.
What kind of knight beats a helpless girl?
Someone get the girl something to cover herself with.
For what crimes? She's not fighting her brother's battle, you halfwit.
The Mad King did as he like. Has your uncle Jaime ever told you what happened to him?
I'm not threatening the king, Ser, I'm educating my nephew.
Bronn, the next time the Ser Meryn speaks, kill him.
THAT was a threat. See the difference?
I apologize for my nephew's behaviour. Tell me the truth, do you want to end this engagement?
Lady Stark, you may survive us yet.
It's hard to argue with his assessment.
The king is a lost cause. It's the rest of us I'm worried about now.
Stannis Baratheon is coming for us, sooner rather than later.
She'll be safer in Dorne.
It so happens that I am. Myrcella is a sweet, innocent girl, and I don't blame her at all for you.
Schemes and plots are the same thing.
Wildfire? You wouldn't lie to me, would you, cousin?
That's a lie right there.
Tell me
The smart money would be on "more likely".
But then, perhaps his own unnatural urges would give him sympathy for yours.
I suppose there's only one way to find out.
When did she tell you this?
Swear to me on what?
But I don't care about your life.
All right, all right, enough. Even torturing you is boring. Just get out.
Oh, Lancel, tell my friend Bronn to please kill you if anything should happen to me.
I remember reading an old sailor's proverb. Piss on wildfire and your cock burns off.
Accounts differ. Most seem to implicate Catelyn Stark in some way.
Some say it was one of his own Kingsguard, while still others say it was Stannis himself who did it after negotiations went sour.
That's not what Varys says. He says Renly's army is flocking to support Stannis, which would give Stannis superiority over us on both land and sea.
And I say Father raised you to have too much respect for money.
Oh you blind, bloody fool!
We've had vicious kings, and we've had idiot kings, but I don't think we've ever been cursed with a vicious idiot for a king!
I can, I am!
The threw a cow pie at you so you decide to kill them all? They're starving, you fool! All because of a war you started!
And now I've struck a king! Did my hand fall from my wrist? Where is the Stark girl?
If she dies, you'll never get your Uncle Jaime back! You owe him quite a bit, you know!
It's hard to put a leash on a dog once you've put a crown on its head.
It's just you, me, and Joffrey. The Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm.
He needs to start acting like a king. This war you started is coming to our doorstep. And if the entire city wants Joffrey dead...
I thought the girls might help him.
I was wrong!
I did not know.
For questioning?
We talked about this.
To strike? My dear nephew, you do see these men preparing the walls for siege? You do understand Stannis Baratheon sails this way?
A brave choice, Your Grace. I'm sure your men will line up behind you.
Imagine Stannis' terror.
You're an intelligent man. I like to think I'm an intelligent man.
I wish we could converse as two honest, intelligent men.
What do you want? Tell me.
My brother was the youngest Kingsguard in history. My sister became queen at the age of nineteen. When I reached manhood, my father put me in charge of all the drains and cisterns in Casterly Rock.
The water never flowed better. And all the shit found its way to the sea. Never expected to have any real power. So when my father named me acting Hand...
I do. Last thing I expected.
I'd like to keep playing it. If Stannis breaches the gates, the game is over.
The Lord of Light wants his enemies burned. The Drowned God wants them drowned. Why are all the gods such vicious cunts? Where is the god of tits and wine?
We should sail there immediately.
A girl at the edge of the world is the least of our problems.
One game at a time, my friend.
You're in the Kingsguard, Clegane. We must beat them back or they're going to take the city... your king's city.

Don't fight for a king. Don't fight for his kingdoms. Don't fight for honor, don't fight for glory, don't fight for riches, because you won't get any. This is your city Stannis means to sack. That's your gate he's ramming. If he gets in it will be your house that burns. Your gold he steals, your women he rapes. Those are brave men knocking at our door. Let's go kill them!
Sir Lancel, tell the Hound to tell the King that the Hand is extremely busy.
That would make me the quarter-man. Just doesn't have the same ring to it.
A wedding.
Nor you, my friend.
Of course we are. Just because I pay you for your services doesn't diminish our friendship.
Oh, "enhances". Fancy word for a sellsword.
Oh, fuck me.
Will you?
Grand Maester Pycelle made the same joke. You must be proud to be as funny as a man whose balls brush his knees.

I want what is mine by right. Jaime is your eldest son, heir to your lands and titles, but he is a Kingsguard, forbidden from marriage or inheritance. The day Jaime put on the white cloak he gave up his claim to Casterly Rock. I am your son and lawful heir.
It is mine by right.
Still makes me more clever than you.
I thought we were friends.
How much?
Double?
I don't even know how much I'm paying you now.
What are they doing here?
No, I don't think so.
They stay outside!
Baelish doesn't have friends.
Oh, Ros? The redhead?
I try to know as many people as I can. You never know which one you'll need.
Yes, well, we shouldn't be judgmental about these things.
Oh, please.
All right, yes, I fucked her once.
Twice.
But since I met you, my lady, I've been with no one else.
Not as much as I like you, obviously, or she'd be the one torturing me right now. What did she say about Littlefinger?
Is there an idiot in any village who trusts Littlefinger?
We can't. Now that the Lannisters have discarded her, Sansa will have many suitors. A great beauty with a very old name.
Yes, she is, objectively, very. Her face is quite pleasing to other men, and to women, people in general. But not to me, of course. I only have eyes for you.
I don't even want to talk about her.
Only because you're making me!
This is cruel and unfair. Cruelly unfair.
Mmm, yes.
Only if you stop.
Master of Coin?
I'm quite good at spending money, but a lifetime of outrageous wealth hasn't taught me much about managing it.
Ah, the return of the conquering hero.
Does he have a little jaunt in his step?
You were gone a long time. I trust you got your money's worth - or should I say my money's worth.
It was a gift, Podrick! This is more than I give you in a year.
Oh. Then it's much more than I give you in a year.
Have you ever known a whore to turn down gold? They're happy enough to take it when I give it to them.
What did you do to them?
And they seemed to like these things?
Only they weren't paid.
Is that what you're telling us?
Sit down, Podrick.
We're going to need details. Copious details.
For years I've heard that Littlefinger is a magician
No.
Worse
We can't afford to pay it back. That's what's wrong with it. The Crown owes millions to my father.
Forgive a debt? My father? For a man of the world, you're strangely naive.
Well, ahem, the basic principle is I lend you money, and after an agreed-upon period of time, you return it with interest.
Well, you have to.

This is why I don't lend you money. Anyway, it's not my father I'm worried about, it's the Iron Bank of Braavos. We owe them tens of millions. If we fail to repay these loans, the Bank will fund our enemies. One way or another, they always get their gold back.
Podrick?
After a long consultation with my colleague, Ser Bronn, I've finally found a suitable reward for the services you've provided over and above what might be considered reasonable. Tell me, Pod...
...have you ever been with a woman?
Wonderful. Genna specializes in first-timers.
A fair enough repayment for putting your spear through my would-be killer's face, wouldn't you say? Now, as it happens Marei...
...is quite the spear-handler herself. She's here to thank you for staying by my side as the battle raged all around us.
Kayla...
...is famous from here to Volantis... in certain circles. One of four women in the world who can perform a proper Meereenese Knot.
She's here to thank you for being a thoroughly respectful fellow who's never once failed to address me as "my Lord." Be back in time for my supper.
And if I refuse?
Thank you for seeing me, my lady. I had hoped we might discuss a few financial matters.
It's the royal wedding. I'm told you had a hand in planning it.
It's shaping up to be a very involved affair. The word "extravagant" has been used.
I understand that.
But, as Master of Coin, it falls upon me to calculate the cost for the crown. As of now, it's a huge expense.
And... we're at war, Lady Olenna.
Yes, and maintaining supply lines...
And we are so grateful for your contributions, which are necessary for the preservation of the realm.
I would.
My lady...
Quite sufficient, thank you.
What is she doing here?
You'll be pleased to learn that after one conversation with Olenna Tyrell, I've saved the Crown hundreds of thousands on this wedding.
I'm Master of Coin. Saving money is important.
Very well. She's a lovely girl. Missing some of Loras' favorite bits, but I'm sure they'll make do.
It wasn't my best, but I thought...
Sansa is the key to the North? I seem to remember she has an older brother.
The Tyrell army is helping us to win this war. Do you really think it's wise to refuse them?
And how do we do that?
Wonderful.
You can't mean it.
Joffrey has made this poor girl's life miserable since the day he took her father's head. Now she's finally free of him and you want her to give her to me? That's cruel even for you.
She's a child!
I don't suppose there is anything we can do about this?
It's hard to say which of the four of us is getting the worst of the arrangement. Probably Sansa. Though Loras will certainly come to know a deep and singular misery.
Where to begin... this is awkward.
A tall child.
Not that young.
Older.
Shae's not going to like it.
I should never have told you about that.
Two women to despise me and a whole kingdom to join them.
I don't pay you to put evil notions in my head. The ones already there don't need company.
Rather less than I planned to be. Isn't it a man's duty to be drunk at his own wedding?
And?
What did you once call me? "A drunken little lust-fulled beast."
Stop. I can't. I could, I won't.
If my father wants someone to get fucked, I know where he can start... I won't share your bed. Not until you want me to.
Do you drink wine?
There will be no bedding ceremony.
There will be no bedding ceremony.
Then you'll be fucking your own bride with a wooden cock!
A bad joke Your Grace. Made out of envy of your own royal manhood. Mine is so small. My poor wife won't even know I'm there.
I am. Guilty.
But... but it is my wedding night. My tiny drunk cock and I have a job to do.
Come, wife.
I vomited on a girl once in the middle of the act. Not proud of it. But I think honesty is important between a man and wife, don't you agree? Come I'll tell you all about it. Put you in the mood.
Oh, "monster". Perhaps you should speak to me more softly then. Monsters are dangerous and, just now, kings are dying like flies.
No, it's a very good lesson only it's easy for you to preach utter devotion to family when you're making all the decisions.
When have you ever done something that wasn't in your interest but solely for the benefit of the family?
You just sent the most powerful man in Westeros to bed without his supper.
A treasonous statement. Joffrey is king.
No. I think armies give you power.
My lady, people have been laughing at me far longer than they've been laughing at you. I'm the Half-Man, the Demon-Monkey, the Imp.
The disgraced daughter and the demon monkey. We're perfect for each other.
Walder Frey is many things, but a brave man?
I'm all for cheating. This is war. But to slaughter them at a wedding...
How long does it go on?
Every time we deal with an enemy, we create two more.
You have children. How happy would you say you are?
Even Joffrey?
Keep up!
It's not easy being drunk all the time. Everyone would do it if it were easy.
The Northerners will never forget.
Who? Whom?
Ah. I could speak to Lord Varys and learn their perversions. Anyone named Desmond Crakehall must be a pervert.
I am the Imp; I have certain standards to maintain.
"Roslin caught a fine fat trout. Her brothers gave her a pair of wolf pelts for her wedding. Signed Walder Frey." Is that bad poetry, or is it supposed to mean something?
Sansa...
Why sheep shift?
My lady...
Oh, they take all kinds.
The king is very grateful that you traveled all this way for his wedding.
Well, speaking as a fellow second son, I've grown rather used to being the family insult.
Why did you come to King's Landing, Prince Oberyn?
I thought we were speaking truth.
It wasn't actually...
I've heard rumors.
I wasn't there. I don't know what...
Let's toast to Lanisters children
Please don't.
Better her than you.
Your new hand is nicer than the old one. Wouldn't you agree, Pod?
Gilded steel. Not eating. Why is no one eating? My wife wastes away, my brother starves himself...
You lost a hand, not a stomach. Try the boar. Cersei can't get enough since one killed Robert for her.
A toast. To the proud Lannister children
It's only wine.
What about your left?
You're the Lord Commander now. Command. Let others do the fighting. When was the last time Father used a sword?
Train, then. Learn to fight with your other hand.
You need a proper, discreet swordsman. As it happens, I have just the one.
Hello.
A toast. To the proud Lannister children
You saw her board the ship?
And you saw the ship sail away?
How do you know?
If it please, your Grace, Lady Sansa is very tired...
Your Grace?
Ser Podrick Payne? Has a nice ring to it. What did you tell him?
Are you going to accept their offer?
Testifying against me wasn't a suggestion. If they can't tempt you with honey, they'll choose something less sweet.
Pod, the trial's in a fortnight. They'll want an answer before that.
I will *not* have you dying on my behalf. Do you hear me? If I have to take that long walk to the executioner's block, I don't want to see your head already mounted.
Pod, I am giving you an order. Go and find my brother. Tell him I need him. And get yourself out of King's Landing before it's too late.
Pod!
This is farewell.
Pod.
There has never lived a more loyal squire.

Mm, my trial for regicide, yes, I know. I know the whole bloody country thinks I'm guilty. I know that one of my three judges has wished me dead more times than I can count, and that judge is my father. As for Cersei, well, she's probably working on a way to avoid a trial altogether by having me killed.
So should I turn around and close my eyes?
You're really asking if I killed your son?
Well, you can set me free.
Then there's really nothing else to say.
Except I didn't do it!
Sansa couldn't have done this.
No, but... Sansa's not a killer. Not yet, anyway.
Is that supposed to make me feel better?
It's complicated, yes. So how is our sister?
How do you think? Her son died in her arms.
"Her" son?
Father, I wish to confess. I wish to confess!
Yes, father. I'm guilty. Guilty. Is that what you want to hear?
No. Of that, I'm innocent. I'm guilty of a far more monstrous crime. I'm guilty of being a dwarf.
Oh, yes I am. I've been on trial for that my entire life.
Nothing but this
I did not kill Joffrey, but I wish that I had! Watching your vicious bastard die gave me more relief than a thousand lying whores!
I wish I was the monster you think I am! I wish I had enough poison for the whole pack of you! I would gladly give my life to watch you all swallow it!
I will not give my life for Joffery's murder and I know I'll get no justice here, so I will let the gods decide my fate. I demand a trial by combat.
Not going well, is it?
Oh! You think so?
Ned Stark was promised the same thing, and we both know how that turned out.
How do you know?
I think I would have remembered that.
You and my family have more in common than you might admit.
That would have made things so much easier.
If you want justice, you've come to the wrong place.
Not you. You're the golden son. You could kill a king, lose a hand, fuck your own sister, you'll always be the golden son.
Lollys Stokeworth? She doesn't strike me as your sort of girl.
She's dim-witted.
When my sister arranged this love match, did she mention that Lollys has an older sister?
And you understand the rules of inheritance?
She still gets Castle Stokeworth when her father dies.
You and my sister deserve each other. Why did you bother to come here?
Is it two wives you want or two castles?
I'm a bit short on castles at the moment, but I can offer you gold and gratitude.
You might be surprised. A Lannister always pays his debts.
My wife is heir to Winterfell. If I emerge from this with my head still on my shoulders, I may one day rule the North in her name. I could carve you out a big piece of it.
Does he frighten you so much?
Because you're my friend.
I understand.
Why are you sorry? Because you're an evil bastard with no conscience and no heart? That's what I liked about you in the first place.
Yes, we did.
I suppose I'll have to kill the Mountain myself. Won't that make for a great song?
What's the punishment for regicide? Drawing and quartering? Hanging? Breaking at the wheel?

Seems rather ordinary. And he was my nephew as well, so what is that? Fratricide is brothers. Filicide is sons. Nepoticide. That's the one. Matricide, patricide, infanticide, suicide. There's no kind of killing that doesn't have its own word.
Cousins, you're right. There is no word for cousin killing. Well done. Do you remember cousin Orson? Orson Lannister?
Simple? Used to sit all day in the garden. Crushing beetles with a rock.
Nothing made him happier.
On the contrary. Laughing at another person's misery was the only thing that made me feel like everyone else.
For you. You drifted away.
Yes, other interests. But I stayed with Orson.

I was curious. Why was he smashing all those beetles? What did he get out of it? First thing I did was ask him "Orson, why are you smashing all those beetles?". He gave me an answer "Smath the beetles. Smath 'em. kun kun kun".
I wasn't deterred. I was the smartest person I knew. Certainly I had the wherewithal to unravel the mysteries that lay at the heart of a moron. So I went to Maester Volarik's library.

Turns out, far too much has been written about great men and not nearly enough about morons. Doesn't seem right. In any case, I found nothing that illuminated the nature of Orson's affliction or the reason behind his relentless beetle slaughter. So I went back to the source. I may not have been able to speak with Orson, but I could observe him, watch him, the way men watch animals to come to a deeper understanding of their behavior. And as I watched, I became more and more sure of it. There was something happening there. His face was like the page of a book written in a language I didn't understand, but he wasn't mindless, he had his reasons. And I became possessed with knowing what they were. I began spending inordinate amounts of time watching him. I would eat my lunch in the garden, chewing my mutton to the music of "kun kun kun". And when I wasn't watching him, I was thinking about him. Father droned on about the family legacy and I thought about Orson's beetles. I read the histories of Targaryen conquests. Did I hear dragon wings? No, I heard "kun kun kun". And I still couldn't figure out why he was doing it. And I had to know because it was horrible, that all these beetles would be dying for no reason.

I know, I know. But still, it filled me with dread. Piles and piles of them, years and years of them. How many countless living crawling things smashed and dried out and returned to the dirt? In my dreams I found myself standing on a beach made of beetle husks stretching as far as the eye could see. I woke up crying, weeping for their shattered little bodies. I tried to stop Orson once.
He just pushed me aside with a "kun" and kept on smashing. Every day until that mule kicked him in the chest and killed him.
So what do you think? Why did he do it? What was it all about?
Oh, get on with it, you son of a whore!
All my life you've wanted me dead.
I loved her.
Shae.
I murdered her. With my own hands.
Doesn't matter?
I am your son and you sentenced me to die. You knew I didn't poison Joffrey, but you sentenced me all the same. Why?
I can't go back there. She's in there.
I am your son. I have always been your son.
I'm sorry... I'm sorry.
Do you know what it's like to stuff your shit through one of those air holes?
Compassion. Yes. I killed my lover with my bare hands and I shot my own father with a crossbow.
Good luck finding him.
What is it that you want exactly?
Where the castles are made of gingerbread and the moats are filled with blackberry wine. The powerful have always preyed on the powerless, that's how they became powerful in the first place.
Can I drink myself to death on the road to Meereen?
Are you a lord if you kill your father? I don't imagine they revoke your nobility for killing a whore, it must happen all the time.
I still don't see why I had to stay in this fucking crate once we set sail.
In a box. Why stop now?
She ought to offer her cunt. Best part of her for the best part of me.
I didn't rule. I was a servant.
Managed to kill a lot of people.
Because I liked it. Power. Even as a servant.
You're right. No point.
I find us repulsive.
I need to speak to someone with hair.
I will not be of any use to Daenerys Targaryen if I lose my mind. I can't remember the last face I saw that wasn't yours.
It's even better luck to suck a dwarf's cock.
I have to get out of this wheelhouse.
I have to get out of this wheelhouse.
Mmm. I have to get out of this wheelhouse.
I am losing my mind.
Look, we are thousands of miles from Westeros.
What am I?
One more drunk dwarf.
No need to worry. I was just...
Oh, thought you were someone else. Show's almost over. I'm sure there are girls inside who'd be happy to oblige.
You've made some kind of mistake. Why don't you tell me what you think you're doing, and then...
I have to ask - how *exactly* were you serving your Queen in a whorehouse half a world away? Is it possible that you were running? Why would you be running? And why would she have sent you away?
Oh, wait. You were spying on her, weren't you? It's all coming back to me. I was drunk through most of the Small Council meetings, but it's all coming back. You passed notes to Varys' little birds.

She found out, didn't she? Found out and exiled you. Now you hope to win back her favor with a gift. Risky scheme. One might even say desperate. You think Daenerys will execute me and pardon you? I'd say the reverse is just as likely.
Long, sullen silences and an occasional punch in the face. The Mormont Way.
The Smoking Sea. How many centuries before we learn how to build cities like this again? Thousands of years the Valyrians were the best in the world at almost everything. And then...

And then they weren't. "They held each other close and turned their backs upon the end. The hills that split asunder and the black that ate the skies; The flames that shot so high and hot that even dragons burned; Would never be the final sights that fell upon their eyes. A fly upon a wall, the waves the sea wind whipped and churned -"
I would clap.
Wait. WAIT! Wait, wait! Wait, you can't just hand a dried cock to a merchant and expect him to pay for it! He has to know it came from a dwarf! And how could he know unless he sees the dwarf?
Guess again!
You're an awful traveling companion, do you know that? Possibly the least charming man I've ever met.
We are traveling together, in each other's company, therefore...
I sailed from King's Landing to Pentos in a crate without ever saying a word!
It never occured to you to ask why until now? You never wondered why Tyrion Lannister decided to visit a brothel in Volantis?
I killed my father. He wanted to execute me for a crime I didn't commit. And he was fucking the woman I loved.
It's true. He has.
I'm the gift. It's a pleasure to meet you, Your Grace. My name is Tyrion Lannister.
Into your service? Your grace, we have only just met. It's too soon to know if you deserve my service.
It's a beautiful dream, stopping the wheel. You're not the first person who's ever dreamt it.

When I was a young man I heard a story about a baby born during the worst storm in living memory. She had no wealth, no lands, no army, only a name and a handful of supporters, most of whom probably thought they could use that name to benefit themselves. They kept her alive, moving her from place to place, often hours ahead of the men who had been sent to kill her. She was eventually sold off to some warlord on the edge of the world and that appeared to be that. And then a few years later the most well informed person I knew told me that this girl without wealth, lands, or armies had somehow acquired all three in a very short span of time, along with three dragons. He thought she was our best, last chance to build a better world. I thought you were worth meeting at the very least.
If only I were otherwise.
It's easy to confuse what is with what ought to be, especially when what is has worked out in your favor.
My father would have liked you.
In my experience, eloquent men are right. Every bit as often as imbeciles.
I suppose there's no point asking how you found me.
Well, she didn't execute me, so that's a promising start. Now the heroes are off to find her, and I'm stuck here trying to placate a city on the brink of civil war. Any advice for an old comrade?
If only I knew someone with a vast network of spies.
I did miss you.
Dragons do not do well in captivity.
That's what I do. I drink and I know things.
The next time I have an idea like that... punch me in the face!
You think them.
A wise man once said a true history of the world is a history of great conversations in elegant rooms.
Me, just now.
Until you do.
Trust me. My own recent experience with slavery has taught me the horrors of that institution.
Long enough to know.
I did. As a clever man once told me, "We make peace with our enemies, not our friends."
They look at me and they see a misshapen little beast. Their contempt is their weakness. They'll underestimate us every time and we will use that to our advantage.
Slavery is a horror that should be ended at once. War is a horror that should be ended at once.
The most famous dwarf in the world.
Tell a joke!
What's your excuse?
That's how you know it's working.
One day, after our queen has taken the Seven Kingdoms, I'd like to have my own vineyard. Make my own wine. The Imp's Delight. Only my close friends could drink it.
There are more than 100 ships in the Iron Fleet.
Thank you for the armada. Our Queen does love ships.
Despite appearances, I think you'll find the city's on the rise.
Perhaps we should take shelter.
Meereen is strong. Commerce has returned to the markets. The people are behind you.
Well, not all the people, of course.
We can agree upon that at least.
You have your armies, you have your ships, you have your dragons. Everything you've ever wanted since you were old enough to want anything, it's all yours for the taking. Are you afraid?
Good. You're in the great game now. And the great game's terrifying. The only people who aren't afraid of failure are madmen like your father.
He wasn't the first to love you and he won't be the last.

For what it's worth, I've been a cynic for as long as I can remember. Everyone's always asking me to believe in things. Family, gods, kings, myself. It was often tempting until I saw where belief got people. so I said, "no, thank you," to belief. And yet, here I am. I believe in you. It's embarrassing, really. I'd swear you my sword, but I don't actually own a sword.
It's yours. Now and always.
If we turn the dragons loose, tens of thousands will die in the firestorms.
I know how you wage war. We DON'T poison little girls here. Myrcella was innocent.
And Sansa? I hear she's alive and well.
Does she miss me terribly?
A sham marriage... and unconsummated.
Well, it was. Or wasn't. Anyway... she's much smarter than she lets on.
Good.
I'd very much like to believe that Jon Snow is wrong, but a wise man once said that you should never believe a thing simply because you want to believe it.
I don't remember.
I would never do that... to you.
I trust the eyes of an honest man more than I trust what everybody knows.
The war against my sister has already begun. You can't expect us to halt hostilities and join you in fighting... whatever you saw beyond the wall.
If it doesn't matter, then you might as well kneel. Swear your allegiance to Queen Daenerys, help her to defeat my sister, and together, our armies will protect the North.
It takes no time to bend the knee. Pledge your sword to her cause.
At some point, I want to hear how a Night's Watch recruit became King in the North.
A long and bloody tale. To be honest, I was drunk for most of it.

I came down here to brood over my failure to predict the Greyjoy attack. You're making it difficult. You look a lot better brooding than I do. You make me feel like I'm failing at brooding over failing.
You idiot. You fucking idiot.
You still have the largest armies.
Pull Grey Worm and the Unsullied back. We still have enough ships to carry the Dothraki to the mainland, commit to the blockade of King's Landing. We have a plan, it's still the right plan.
If I have underestimated our enemies...
We've discussed this.
A *smart* one!
Who's that for?
Did you read it?
What's it say?
All rulers demand that people bend the knee. That's why they're rulers. She gave Tarly a choice, a man who had taken up arms against her. What else could she do?
I am her Hand, not her head. I can't make her decisions for her.

You made me look like a complete fool. I thought I'd surprise you by hitting Casterly Rock, but you were three steps ahead of me. You abandoned the family home. Completely unsentimental. Father would've been proud.
Listen to me...
It'll take you a while with a sparring sword.
He was going to execute me. He knew I was innocent. He didn't hate me because of anything I did, he hated me because of what I am, a little monster sent to punish him!
Daenerys will win this war. You're a military man. You must know there's no way around that. Daenerys is not her father. She's even willing to suspend hostilities if Cersei agrees to certain terms.
I don't. Daenerys doesn't. Right now, anyway. She has a more important request.
Last time I was here, I killed my father with a crossbow.
You're not staying here?
What if someone takes the boat?
He'll do.
He'll do.
And some Clegane cunt to help them see it through.
A foreign whore you can't abduct, beat or intimidate. That must be difficult for you.
I didn't know about that...
Cersei, I didn't know.

I am the one preventing that from happening. Daenerys didn't want to debate and negotiate. She didn't want to bring you words; she wanted to bring you fire and blood until I advised her otherwise. I don't want to destroy our family. I never have.
After he sentenced me to death for a crime I didn't commit, yes, I killed him. Hate me for it if you want. I hate myself for it, in spite of what he was, in spite of what he did to me!
All right. You love your family, and I have destroyed it. I will always be a threat, so put an end to me.
I don't care! I loved them. You know I did. You know it in your heart, if there's anything left of it.
If there's no future, then why did you allow me to come?
Yes, no. Not what you hoped for, but you must've hoped for something.
Mmm, not like this.
Yes.
Because I think she will make the world a better place.
She knows herself. She chose an advisor who would check her worst impulses instead of feeding them. That's the difference between you.
You're pregnant.

We are a group of people who do not like one another, as this recent demonstration has shown. We have suffered at each other's hands. We have lost people we love at each other's hands. If all we wanted was more of the same, there would be no need for this gathering. We are entirely capable of waging war against each other without meeting face-to-face.
We all know that will never happen.
Kevan_Lannister: That is kind of you to say. I would like to hear it from the king himself.
He should be here, learning what it means to rule.

I returned to the capital to pay my respect to my brother, and to you, and to serve the king. I did not return to the capital to serve as your puppet, to watch you stack the Small Council with sycophants. Sending your own brother away so you may...
I do not recognize your authority to dictate what is and what is not my concern. You are the queen mother. Nothing more.
If he wants to send for me, I will be waiting for him... at Casterly Rock.
We'll have civil war. Many will die.
Edmure_Tully: Robb knows I meant no disr...

My blunder sent Tywin's mad dog scurrying back to Casterly Rock with his tail between his legs. I think King Robb understands we're not going to win this war if he's the only one winning any battles. There's glory to go around!
The Mountain was garrisoned across the river from it.
Of course not. We took the fight to him! He could not withstand us.
Word of this can't leave Riverrun. They were Tywin Lannister's nephews. The Lannisters pay their debts. They never stop talking about it.
It wouldn't be lying. We will bury them and remain silent until the war is done.
Samwell_Tarly: It is a bit nippy.
So why exactly did you not make love to Ros with the perfect...?
Jon Snow.
Because... you're a bastard from the North.
So... you *didn't* know where to put it?
Hello. Ser Alliser said I'm to be your new watch partner. I should warn you, I don't see all that well.
No, that's all right, I'm fine.
I don't like high places.

On the morning of my eighteenth nameday, my father came to me. "You're almost a man now," he said, "but you are not worthy of my land and title. Tomorrow you're going to take the black, forsake all claim to your inheritance, and start north. If you do not," he said, "then we'll have a hunt, and somewhere in these woods your horse will stumble, and you'll be thrown from your saddle to die. Or so I'll tell your mother. Nothing would please me more."
Ser Alliser's going to make me fight again tomorrow, isn't he?
I know for a fact that some of the officers go to that brothel in Mole's Town.
Don't you think it's a little bit unfair? Making us take our vows while they sneak off for a little Sally on the side?
It's silly, isn't it? What, *we* can't defend the Wall unless we're celibate? It's absurd.
Why not? Because I'm fat?
But I like girls just as much as you do. They might not like me as much. I've never... been with one. You've probably had hundreds.
Yeah. Yeah, I... I find that hard to believe.
Didn't know where to put it?
Was she... old and ugly?
What color hair?
Oh, I like red hair. And her... her um.
What, that good?
They were touched by White Walkers. That's why they came back. That's why their eyes turned blue. Only fire will stop them.
I read about it in a book... a very old book in Maester Aemon's library.
The White Walkers sleep beneath the ice for thousands of years. And when they wake up...
The smell.
You don't care.
You left me. When the White Walkers came, you left me.
Quickly. Quickly.
No, we have to go. Now!
Follow me. I know the best way. Come on.
Craster got his daughters to feed.
We can't just show up and steal all his food. We're brothers of the Night's Watch, not thieves.
You're Jon's brother! The one who fell from the window!
I've been around Ghost long enough to know a direwolf when I see one.
Pyp, open the gate!
Yes!
Oh, Pyp, open the fucking gate!
Yes, well, best get used to it.
Maester Aemon. How did you know...
Of course I'm afraid. There's a band of wildlings coming to kill us.

I didn't know I was going to kill it. But I had to do something, I didn't have any choice. It was going to kill Gilly and take the baby. If someone had asked me my name, right there, I wouldn't have known. I wasn't Samwell Tarly anymore. I wasn't the steward of the Night's Watch, or son of Randyll Tarly, or any of that. I was nothing at all. When your nothing at all there's no more reason to be afraid.
Yes, well, I'm not nothing anymore.
Oh, is it over?
So, what's it like?
No, you're really not.
Where are we going?
You can't do that. No one gave you any orders.
Without Mance? You're going to kill him?
They'll never let you within 100 yards of him. And even if they did, even if you managed to kill him...
They won't just kill you. They'll boil you, they'll flay you, they'll make it last days.
Jon.

I want you to tell me what it was like to have someone. To be with someone. To love someone and have them love you back. We're all gonna die a lot sooner than I'd planned. You're the closest I'll ever get to knowing.
No. She just had a baby.
And she never offered.
The interesting thing is, our vows never specifically forbid intimate relations with women.

"I shall take no wife." Yes, that's in there. There's no denying that. "I shall father no children." It's very specific. But what our vows have to say about other activities is open to interpretation.

Whilst Lord Janos was hiding with the women and children, Jon Snow was leading. Ser Alliser fought bravely, this true. When he was wounded, it was Jon who saved us. He took charge of the Wall's defense, he killed the Magnar of Thenns, he went north to deal with Mance Rayder, knowing it would've almost certainly meant his own death. Before that, he lead the mission to avenge Lord Commander Mormont. Mormont, himself, chose Jon to be his steward. He saw something in Jon and now we've all seen it to. He may be young, but he's the commander we turned to when the night was darkest.
I only said that the more time that you spend practicing, the faster you'll be able to read.
Alright, alright! That's enough of that!
From Lord Commander Snow at Castle Black.
I'm... I'm to be the new maester.
He died...
Maester Aemon became quite ill, shortly after the election. He since passed away... which is why I'm here.
Yes, well I suppose life is irregular.
It's when a man sets aside his lawful wife.

These maesters... they set me to the task of preserving that man's window counting and annulments and bowel movements for all eternity, while the secret to defeating the Night King's probably sitting on some dusty shelf somewhere, completely ignored. But that's alright, isn't it? We can all become slavering, murderous imbeciles in thrall to evil incarnate as long as we can have access to the full records of High Septon Maynard's 15,782 SHITS!
I'm tired of reading about the achievements of better men.
I wasn't sure if you'd remember me.
Oh...
I do not know that that means.
Stannis_Baratheon: He wasn't "my beloved brother". I didn't love him. He didn't love me.
A lie. Take it out.
Jaime Lannister, the Kingslayer. Call him what he is.
Make it SER Jaime Lannister the Kingslayer. Whatever else he is, the man's still a knight.

When Eddard Stark learnt the truth, he told only me. I'll not make the same mistake. Send copies of that letter to every corner of the realm, from the Arbor to the Wall. The time has come to choose. Let no man claim ignorance as an excuse.
I'll not make peace with Renly while he calls himself king.

Who'd steal the northern half of my kingdom. I've always served thieves according to their deserts, as you well know, Ser Davos. Joffrey, Renly, Robb Stark, they're all thieves. They'll bend the knee or I'll destroy them.
Who else might it be?
My own.
Watch yourself, Renly.
That's twice I've warned you.
It is strange to find you beside my brother, Lady Stark. Your husband was a supporter of my claim. Lord Eddard's integrity cost him his head, and you sit beside this pretender and chastise me.
The Iron Throne is mine. By right. All those that deny that are my foes.

For the sake of the mother who bore us, I will give you this one night to reconsider. Strike your banners, come to me before dawn, and I will grant you your old seat in the council. I'll even name you my heir... until a son is born to me. Otherwise, I shall destroy you.
You think a few bolts of cloth will make you king?
We shall see, Renly. Come the dawn, we shall see.
Do your knucklebones bring you luck?
Fewer.
Four FEWER fingernails to clean. Never understood why you had to wear them.
You were a hero and a smuggler. A good act does not wash out the bad, nor a bad the good.
What do you mean to do with him?
Then why bathe him and dress him in fine clothes? If it needs to be done, then do it. Don't torture the boy.
No.
And you've slaughtered many lambs.
The usurper Robb Stark.
The usurper Balon Greyjoy.
The usurper Joffrey Baratheon.
He shares no blood with me. He is a bastard, born of incest, as was his brother before him.
It's not a story. It's the truth.
Gold you loaned him.
More than any man living.
Four thousand.
None.
Do you know who I am?
It is customary to kneel when surrendering to a king.
I'll have thousands of you men in chains by nightfall, have nowhere to put them, have nothing to feed them. I'm not here to slaughter beat dogs. Their fate depends on their king.
You have many enemies in Castle Black. Have you considered sending Alliser Thorne elsewhere? Give him command of Eastwatch-by-the-Sea.
Whoever said that didn't have many enemies.
Nothing.
This is the right time and I will risk everything because if I don't, we've lost. We march to victory, or we march to defeat. But we go forward. Only forward.
If you had to choose between Rhaenyra and Aegon, who'd you have chosen?
