Sometimes a person much choose. Sometimes... the world forces his hand. If a man knows what he is and remains true to himself, the choice is no choice at all. He must fulfill his destiny, and become who he is meant to be. However much he may hate it.
Bolton has women fighting for him?
I did.
Go on, do your duty.
Robb_Stark: Tell Lord Tywin, winter is coming for him. Twenty thousand northerners marching south to find out if he really does shit gold.
Well, that makes it simple then.
I must be.
Why is that good?
Treason? Sansa wrote this.
Joffrey puts my father in chains, now he wants his ass kissed.
I won't refuse. If His Grace summons me to go to King's Landing, I'll go to King's Landing. But not alone. Call the banners.
They've all sworn to defend my father, have they not?
Now we'll see what the words are worth.

There must always be a Stark in Winterfell. Until I return that will be you. You are not to leave the castle walls while we are gone, do you understand? Listen to Maester Luwin. Look after your little brother.
I'll send messages whenever I can. If you don't hear from me, don't be scared. Til I return.
I sent two thousand men to their graves today.
Aye, but the dead won't hear them.
If we do it your way, Kingslayer, you'd win. We're not doing it your way.
Now and always.
If I left you with one of my bannermen, your father would know within a fortnight. My bannerman would receive a raven with a message
Oh, I trust them with my life. Just not with yours.
You insult yourself, Kingslayer. You've been defeated by a boy. You're held captive by a boy. Perhaps you'll be killed by a boy.
Stannis Baratheon sent ravens to all the high lords of Westeros. King Joffrey Baratheon is neither a true king, nor a true Baratheon. He's your bastard son.
My father learned the truth. That's why you had him executed.
Your son killed him so the world wouldn't learn who fathered him, and you... you pushed my brother from a window because he saw you with the queen.
I'm sending one of your cousins down to King's Landing with my peace terms.
No... but he's starting to know me.
It's better than three defeats.
This cannot be true.
Why? Why would Theon...?
My brothers...
I must go north at once.
There will be no talk. He will die for this!
Tell your son Bran and Rickon's safety is paramount. And Theon... I want him brought to me alive. I want to look him in the eye and ask him 'Why?'... and then I will take his head myself!
Tell me this isn't true.
Why?
You betrayed me.
No! You knew I would not allow it, and you did it anyway.
Jaime Lannister has played you for a fool. You have weakened our position; you brought discord into our camp; and you did all behind my back.
Send word to your son. Any Ironborn who surrender will be allowed to return safely to their homes.
My father is dead. And the only parent I have left has no right to call anyone reckless.
It's not about glory. Your instructions were to wait for him to come to you.
What value was the mill?
Is he there now?

I wanted to draw the Mountain into the west, into our country where we could surround him and kill him. I wanted him to chase us, which he would have done because he is a mad dog without a strategic thought in his head. I could have that head on a spike by now. Instead, I have a mill.
Is that all of them? It took five of you to murder two unarmed squires.
My mother had nothing to do with this. This was your treason.
Leave him.
This one was only the watcher. Hang him last so he can watch the others die.
Would you make me a liar as well as a murderer?
I'm not fighting for justice if I don't serve justice to murderers in my ranks, no matter how highborn. He has to die.
You tended to their wounds. You brought them supper. Now they're dead.
That didn't stop you from betraying me. And it won't save you now.
Kneel, my lord.
Rickard Karstark, Lord of Karhold, here in sight of gods and men, I sentence you to die. Would you speak a final word?
Mother...
All men should keep their word, kings most of all.
Oh, do you? It seems to me the father should have some say in his son's naming.
I do.
Viserys_Targaryen: So do I. I want us both to go home, but, they took it from us. So tell me, sweet sister, how do we go home?
We go home with an army. With Khal Drogo's army. I would let his whole tribe fuck you - all forty thousand men - and their horses too if that's what it took.
But he... he didn't say anything! Did he like her?
Under my reign, you won't be punished for such nonsense.
You dare! You give commands to me? To me?
You do not command the dragon. I'm lord of the Seven Kingdoms. I don't take orders from savages or their sluts.
You would turn me into one of them, wouldn't you! Next you'll want to braid my hair!

Brave men didn't kill dragons. The brave men rode them. Rode them from Valyria to build the greatest civilization this world has ever seen. The breath of the greatest dragon forged the Iron Throne, which the Usurper is keeping warm for me. The swords of the vanquished, a thousand of them... melted together like so many candles.
Well, after 15 years in a pleasure house, I imagine just seeing the sky makes you happy.

No. No, the last one died many years before I was born. I'll tell you what I have seen-their skulls. They used to decorate the throne room in the Red Keep. When I was very young, just three or four, my father used to walk me down the rows and I'd recite their names for him. When I got them all right, he'd give me a sweet. The ones closest to the door were the last ones they were able to hatch and they were all stunted and wrong with skulls no bigger than dog skulls. But... but as you got closer to the Iron Throne... they got bigger and bigger and bigger. There was Ghiscar and Valryon, Vermithrax, Essovius... Archonei, Meraxes, Vhagar... and Balerion the Dread... whose fire forged the Seven Kingdoms into one.
Khal Drogo! I'm here for the feast!
That is no place for a king!
Tommen_Baratheon: Is Joffrey going to kill Sansa's brother?
Sometimes it feels odd. I'm the king, I've married the most beautiful woman in the world, and it's all because my brother died.
I don't feel guilty. That's what's odd.
Lyanna_Mormont: House Mormont has kept faith with House Stark for a thousand years. We will not break faith today.
We're not a large house, but we are a proud one. And every man from Bear Island fights with the strength of ten mainlanders.
Bear Island knows no King but the King of the North, whose name is Stark.
House Mormonts has kept faith with house Starks for thousand years... We will not break faith today.

Your son was butchered at the Red Wedding, Lord Manderly. And you refused the call. You swore allegiance to House Stark, Lord Glover, but in their hour of greatest need, you refused the call. And you, Lord Cerwyn - your father was skinned alive by Ramsay Bolton... still, you refused the call. But House Mormont remembers. The North remembers! We know no king but the King in the North whose name is Stark. I don't care if he's a bastard. Ned Stark's blood runs through his veins. He's my king from this day until his last day.
Daenerys_Targaryen: I don't want to be his Queen. I want to go home.
I don't know.
I... I don't think this is the Dothraki way.
What do you pray for, Ser Jorah?
You've no right to a braid! You've won no victories yet!
He was no dragon. Fire cannot kill a dragon.
I am the blood of the dragon.
I will. But it is not your screams I want. Only your life.
And you're sure there's no other way?
No one will take my dragons.
The time to strike is now, the Starks fight the Lannisters, the Baratheons fight each other.
When my dragons are grown, we will take back what was stolen from me and destroy those who wronged me! We will lay waste to armies and burn cities to the ground!
Where are they? Where are my dragons?
Astapor?
They have my dragons. A mother does not flee without her children.
You should sail to Astapor, I'm sure you'll be safe there.
Then serve me! If my dragons are in the House of the Undying, then take me there.
And what of my magic? You saw me step into the fire, you watched the witch burn. What did the flames do to me, do you remember?
They are my children. And they are the only children I will ever have... Take me to them.
Dracarys!
I owe you my life, ser.
Yes. All men must die, but we are not men.
You're both here to advise me. I value your advice, but if you ever question me in front of strangers again, you'll be advising someone else. Is that understood?
Dracarys!
A dragon is not a slave.
Dracarys!
What is your name?
"Grey Worm."

From this day forward, you will choose your own names. You will tell your fellow soldiers to do the same. Throw away your slave name; choose the name your parents gave you, or any other. A name that gives you pride.
And what happens to things that don't bend?
My ship?
And what do you ask in return?

And the lives of your wise Masters, but I also want something in return. You will release every slave in Yunkai. Every man, woman, and child shall be given as much food, clothing, and property as they can carry as payment for their years of servitude. Reject this gift and I shall show you no mercy.
I did, but my dragons made no promises. And you threatened their mother.
My gold. You gave it to me, remember? And I shall put it to good use. You'd be wise to do the same with my gift to you. Now get out.
Will you fight for me? Swear to me.
Ser Barristan. When it come to battle, kill that one first.
A man who fights for gold can't afford to lose to a girl.
People learn to love their chains.
I will answer injustice with justice.
How can I rule seven kingdoms if I can't control Slaver's Bay?
I will not let those I have freed slide back into chains.
So why did you do it?
How many ships?
How many men can they carry?
Would that be enough to take King's Landing?
This pardon was signed the year we met. Why were you pardoned? Unless you're saying this document was forged?
Why, then?
And what was the content of these letters?
What information?
You told them I was carrying Drogo's child?
Yes or no?
That wine merchant tried to poison me because of your information.
Because you knew it was poisoned.
You betrayed me. From the first.
...and stole my brother's throne. You want me to forgive you?

Love? LOVE? How can you say that to me? Any other man and I would have you executed, but you, I do not want you in my city, dead or alive. Go back to your masters in King's Landing, collect your pardon, if you can.
Angry snakes lash out. It makes chopping off their heads that much easier.
Who are you?
So I should welcome you into my service because you murdered members of your own family?
Lannister, Targaryen, Baratheon, Stark, Tyrell they're all just spokes on a wheel. This ones on top, then that ones on top and on and on it spins crushing those on the ground.
I'm not going to stop the wheel, I'm going to break the wheel.
How do I know you are who you say you are?
*That* is greatness?
Do not touch me. I am Daenerys Stormborn of the House Targaryen.
The First of Her Name, the Unburnt, Queen of Meereen, Queen of the Andals and the Rhoynar and the First Men, Khalisee of the Great Grass Sea, Breaker of Chains and Mother of Dragons.

And here, now, what what great matters do the Great Khals discuss? Which little villages you'll raid, how many girls you'll get to fuck, how many horses you'll demand in tribute. You are small men. None of you are fit to lead the Dothraki. But I am. So I will.

Every Khal who ever lived chose three bloodriders to fight beside him and guard his way, But I am not a Khal. I will not choose three blood riders. I choose you all. I will ask more of you than any Khal has ever asked of his Khalsar. Will you ride the wooden horses across the black salt sea? Will you kill my enemies in their iron suits and tear down their stone houses? Will you give me the Seven Kingdoms, the gift Khal Drogo promised me, before the Mother of Mountains? Are you with me, now and always?
Lord Tyrion tells me your father was a terrible king.
So why shouldn't I wait for him?
And I imagine your offer is free of any marriage demands?
The city's on the rise?
You've brought us 100 ships from the Iron Fleet with men to sail them. In return, I expect you want me to support your claim to the throne of the Iron Islands?
And what's wrong with you?
Tyrion Lannister, I name you Hand of the Queen.
Do you know what frightens me? I said farewell to a man who loves me. A man I thought I cared for. And I felt nothing. Just impatient to get on with it.
Well, you have completely failed to console me.
It's your counsel I need.
If I'm going to rule in Westeros, I'll need to make alliances. The best way to make alliances is with marriage.
I don't know. Maybe no one.
I can't bring a lover to Westeros.
So that's what you want? To be my mistress?
I can't.
No one tells me to do anything.
Our fathers were evil men. They left the world worse than they found it. We're not going to do that, we're going to leave the world better than we found it.
Shall we begin?
I swear this
I'm grateful to you, Lady Olenna, for your counsel. I'm grateful to all of you, but you have chosen to follow me. I will not attack King's Landing. WE will not attack King's Landing.
Which wise man said this?
Are you trying to present your own statements as ancient wisdom?
I was born to rule the Seven Kingdoms, and I will!
I will fight for you. I will fight for the North. When you bend the knee.
They will if their king does. They chose you to lead them. They chose you to protect them. Isn't their survival more important than your pride?
My enemies are in the Red Keep. What kind of a Queen am I if I'm not willing to risk my life to fight them?
Dracarys!
What do you think I should do?
I'm at war. I'm losing, What do you think I should do?
I've grown used to him.
I haven't given you permission to leave.

I don't. If we hadn't gone, I wouldn't have seen. You have to see it to know. Now I know. The dragons are my children. They're the only children I'll ever have. Don't you understand? We are going to destroy the Night King and his army. And we'll do it together. You have my word.
'Dany'?
Who was the last person who called me that? I'm not sure. Was it my brother? Mm, not the company you want to keep.
What about those who swore allegiance to you?
I can't have children.
The witch who murdered my husband.
Just the King in the North? Not me?
Cersei_Lannister: You should be the Hand of the King.
Please.
This is your home. I'm your guest.
Handsome one, isn't he? I lost my first boy.
A little black-haired beauty. He was a fighter too... tried to beat the fever that took him. Forgive me. It's the last thing you need to hear right now.

It was years ago. Robert was crazed, beat his hands bloody on the wall, all the things men do to show you how much they care. The boy looked just like him. Such a little thing... a bird without feathers. They came to take his body away and Robert held me. I screamed and I battled, but he held me.
That little bundle. They took him away and I never saw him again. Never have visited the crypt, never.
I pray to the mother every morning and night that she return your child to you.
Perhaps this time she'll listen.
When Aerys Targaryen sat on the Iron Throne, your father was a rebel and a traitor. Someday, you'll sit on the throne, and the truth will be what you make it.

Yes, she's very beautiful, and young... and if you don't like her, you only need to see her on formal occasions, and when the time comes, to make little princes and princesses... and if you'd rather fuck painted whores, you'll fuck painted whores. And if you'd rather lie with noble virgins, so be it. You are my darling boy, and the world will be exactly as you want it to be.
Everyone who isn't us is an enemy.
A good king knows when to save his strength and when to destroy his enemies.
And my husband?
Let me go...
Let me go...
As was I.
Every day.
Seventeen years is quite a long time.
Yes, it is.
What was she like?

At first, just saying her name even in private felt like I was breathing life back into her. I thought if I didn't talk about her, she'd just fade away for you. When I realized that wasn't going to happen, I refused to ask out of spite. I didn't want to give you the satisfaction of thinking I cared enough to ask. And eventually it became clear that my spite didn't mean anything to you. As far as I could tell, you actually enjoyed it.
What harm could Lyanna Stark's ghost do to either of us that we haven't done to each other a hundred times over?
I felt something for you once, you know?
Even after we lost our first boy. For quite a while, actually. Was it ever possible for us? Was there ever a time, ever a moment?
It doesn't make me feel anything.
Without a Hand, everything will fall to pieces.
He's not serious enough. I'll say this for Ned Stark
The Dothraki don't sail. Every child knows that. They don't have discipline, they don't have armor, they don't have siege weapons.
Is my father wrong?
Five.
What do you want?
Our marriage.
I shall wear this as a badge of honor.

You should have taken the realm for yourself. Jaime told me about the day King's Landing fell. He was sitting on the Iron Throne and you made him give it up. All you needed to do was climb those steps yourself. Such a sad mistake.
Oh but it was. When you play the game of thrones you win, or you die. There is no middle ground.

Hated him? I worshiped him. Every girl in the Seven Kingdoms dreamt about him, but he was mine by oath. And when I finally saw him on my wedding day on the Sept of Baelor, lean and fierce and black bearded was the happiest moment of my life. And then that night he crawled into my bed, stinking of wine, doing what he can, what little he could do. And whispered in my ear "Lyanna." Your sister was a corpse and I was a living girl, and he loved her more than me.
Ser Barristan Selmy.
Rise, Ser Barristan. You may remove your helm.

You have served the realm long and faithfully. Every man and woman in the Seven Kingdoms owes you thanks. But it is time to put aside your armor and your sword. It is time to rest and look back with pride on your many years of service.
Whose death, Ser Barristan? Yours or your king's?
The council has determined that Ser Jaime Lannister will take your place as Lord Commander of the Kingsguard.
Careful, ser!
And what truth is that?
Cut his throat.
Stop. Wait. I've changed my mind. Let him go.
Step back three paces. Turn around. Close your eyes.
Power... is power.
You want to be Hand of the King? You want to rule? This is what ruling is; lying on a bed of weeds, ripping them out by the root, one by one, before they strangle you in your sleep!
I don't care what you think! You've never taken it seriously; you haven't, Jaime hasn't! It's all fallen on me.
You're funny. You've always been funny, but none of your jokes will match the first one, will they? Do you remember, back when you ripped my mother open on your way out of her and she bled to death?
Mother gone, for the sake of you. There's no bigger joke in the world than that.
He might. Would you like that?
I will not let you ship her of to Dorne as I was shipped off to Robert Baratheon.
Are you mad? The Martells loathe us.
She'll be a hostage.
You won't get away with this. You think the piece of paper Father gave you keeps you safe? Ned Stark had a piece of paper, too.
Aren't there other things you should be doing, like sealing my daughter in a crate so you can ship her away?
Yes, I know how "concerned" you are for her safety.
So clever. Aren't you? Always so clever with your schemes and your plots.
Killed? By whom?
Really? Who'd have thought?
Whomever did it, I say well done.
Littlefinger says we can outspend him three-to-one.
I'm sure you'll make a point eventually.
I'm not the one giving the boy whores to abuse.
Did you?
Any time a Targaryen is born, the gods flip a coin.
Sansa? Come here, little dove.
What are you doing?
You're perfect, aren't you? Praying? What are you praying for?
Oh? On all of us?
Even me?
Even Joffrey?

Oh, shut up, you little fool. Praying for the gods to have mercy on us all? The gods have no mercy, that's why they are gods. My father told me that when he caught me praying. My mother had just died, you see. I didn't really understand the concept of death. The finality of it. I thought if I prayed very very hard, the gods would return her to me. I was four.
He believes in them, he just doesn't like them very much.
Tears aren't a woman's only weapon. The best one's between your legs.
You're a clever man. But you're not half as clever as you think you are.
Protecting me... I assume. Will you let me in?
If I wanted to kill you, do you think I'd let a wooden door stop me?
I'm not afraid of you, little brother.
Margaery has her claws on Joffrey. She knows how to manipulate him.
Perhaps... you should try stopping him from doing what he likes.
You should be thanking the gods for this. This is more than you deserve.
What do you mean?
I will not.
No, I won't do it.
Yes, it is.
She's flowered, I assure you. She and I have discussed it at length.
We can have them both killed.
Father doesn't discriminate.
Nobody cares what your father once told you.
Come along.
We have so much to celebrate. A wedding to plan. You must rest.
Until we've dealt with all our enemies.
Then I suppose it will go on for quite a long time.
Not very. But if it weren't for my children, I would have thrown myself from the highest tower in the Red Keep. They're the reason I'm alive.
Even Joffrey.
You're such an ingrate. I spent days with the goldsmith getting the details just right.
Better part of an afternoon.
I suppose I am.
Small pleasures.
Can't say I've ever met a Sand before.
No? How tolerant of you.
I suppose you'll never know, Prince Oberyn. It's a shame your older brother couldn't attend the wedding.
More repugnant than your gnarled fingers on that girl's thighs?
My little brother had you sent to the black cells when you annoyed him. What do you think I could do to you if you annoyed me?

But you ARE. You're annoying me right now. Every breath you draw in my presence annoys me. So here's what I want you to do. I want you to leave my presence. Leave this wedding right now, go to the kitchens, and instruct them that all the leftovers from the feast will be brought to the kennels.
The QUEEN is telling you the leftovers will feed the dogs... or you will.
Help him! Someone help him!
Joffrey!
Joffrey! Joffrey!
Don't touch him! Joffrey! Please! My God, what is it? Help him!
Why did Catelyn Stark set you free?
I've been wondering for months. Ever since that great cow brought you back to the capital. Why did she set you free?
Everywhere in the world, they hurt little girls.
Ser Gregor, welcome to the capital. Thank you for riding here so quickly.
You seem to be in good form.
Does it matter?
When you marched into the throne room to tell me we'd won the Battle of Blackwater...

I was sitting on the Iron Throne with Tommen. I was about to give him essence of nightshade. That's how far I was willing to go when I thought someone awful had come to take my son away. Someone awful is coming to take him away.

Joffrey is dead. Myrcella's been sold like livestock. And now you want to ship me off to Highgarden and steal my boy. My last boy. Margaery will dig her claws in, you will dig your claws in and you'll fight over him like beasts until you rip him apart. I will burn our house to the ground before I let that happen.
I'll tell everyone the truth.

You don't know, do you? You never believed it. How is that possible? What am I saying? Of course it's possible. How can some so consumed by the idea of his family have any conception what his actual family was doing? We were right there in front of you, and you didn't see us. One look in the past 20 years, one real look at your own children and you would have known.
Everything they say is true, about Jaime and me.
Your legacy is a lie.
Uncle Kevan, in light of your position as commander of the Lannister armies, it would please the king for you to serve as his Master of War. No man living better deserves the title.
The king is very busy at this moment.
He is learning. On this occasion, in his capacity as ruler, he has asked me to speak on his behalf.
My brother has left the capital to lead a sensitive diplomatic mission.
That is not your concern as Master of War.
You would abandon your king in his time of need?
Well, if it isn't the famous tart-tongued Queen of Thorns.
I choose violence.
And? Was it just a rumor or something more?
I heard. How could we ever trust a man like that?
You think I listened to father for forty years and learned nothing?

If the Mad King's daughter takes the Iron Throne, she'll destroy the Realm as we know it. Some of you are bannermen of House Tyrell, but House Tyrell is in open rebellion against the crown. With their help, the Mad King's daughter has ferried an army of savages to our shores

You will remember the Mad King. You remember the horrors he inflicted upon his people. His daughter is no different. In Essos, her brutality is already legendary. She crucified hundreds of noble men in Slaver's Bay, and when she grew bored of that, she fed them to her dragons.
It is my solemn duty to protect the people and I will, but I need your help, my lords. We must stand together. All of us, if we hope to stop her.
Dead men, dragons, and dragon queens... whatever stands in our way, we will defeat it.
You saw the crossbow, you saw his body.
After all this time, it still amazes me that you...
And this was before or after she drank the poison you so kindly provided her?
And you believed her?
So we fight and die, or we submit and die. I know my choice. A soldier should know his.

If those things come for us there, will be no kingdoms to rule. Everything we suffered will have been for nothing. Everything we lost will have been for nothing. The crown accepts your truce. Until the dead are defeated, they are the true enemy. In return, the King in the North will extend this truce. He will remain in the North where he belongs. He will not take up arms against the Lannister's. He will not chose sides.
I would never ask it of you. You would never agree to it. And if you did, I would trust you even less than I do now. I ask it only of Ned Stark's son. I know Ned Stark's son will be true to his word.
Then there is nothing left to discuss. The dead will come North first. Enjoy dealing with them. We will deal with whatever is left of you.
And now you've got both working towards the same goal, the goal you've been working towards your entire life...
...the destruction of this family.
You killed our father.
I will not hear it, not from you. I will NOT hear it!
I will not...
Doesn't matter. Your love doesn't matter, your feelings don't matter. I don't care why you did what you did, I only care what it cost us. It cost us our future.
Not to help my enemies collaborate in my destruction.
What did you hope for? To make Jon Snow submit to your Queen?
But eventually, you want everyone to bend the knee to her.
Why?
You said she'd destroy King's Landing.
I don't care about checking my worst impulses, I don't care about making the world a better place. Hang the world.

That thing you dragged here, I know what it is, I know what it means. And when it came at me, I didn't think about the world, not at all. As soon as it opened its mouth, the world disappeared for me, right down its black throat. All I could think about was keeping those gnashing teeth away from the ones who matter most, away from my family. Maybe Euron Greyjoy had the right idea. Get on a boat, take those who matter...
No one walks away from me.
So instead, we should settle our differences and live together in harmony for the rest of our days?
Then why are we here?
And I intend to stay amongst the living.
And you conspired with Tyrion, the man who murdered our father, without telling me, your queen.
And that will be treason.
Disobeying your queen's command, fighting with her enemies, what would you call it?
I told you no one walks away from me.
And you conspired with Tyrion, the man who murdered our father, without telling me, your queen.
And that will be treason.
Disobeying your queen's command, fighting with her enemies, what would you call it?
I told you no one walks away from me.
I've been promised to the prince. When will we marry?
But I will be queen?
Will the king and I have children.
That doesn't make sense.
Rast: You ARE in love, Lord Snow. You girls can do as you please. But if Thorne puts me up against Lady Piggy, I'm gonna slice me off a side of bacon.

What's the matter, Piggy? You crying 'cause you're cold? There's two hundred brothers killed by dead men, and you're still here, whimpering. That seem fair to you? I seen 'em torn to pieces fighting while you was off somewhere hiding in a hole. Why don't you lie down and rest for a while, eh? You know you want to.
Looks like that piggy is done for.
Why? So the rest of us can die? We'll move faster without him.
If he can't, we may as well just go without him...
Why should the rest of us go...
What am I supposed to do?
Run fast, Piggy, and sleep well! I'll be cutting your throat one of these nights.
So you admit you've got a hidden larder, then? How else'd you make it through winter?
It wasn't his foot that killed him. That bastard Craster starved him to death.
The day we leave, Craster will tap a barrel of our wine and sit down to a feast of ham and potatoes and laugh at us starving in the snow. He's a bloody wildling all he is.
I wouldn't stand a chance. None of us would.
Barristan_Selmy: Hmm.
Of course, Your Grace.
A Tyroshi. Never learned the name.
Lance through the heart.
Life is strange. Not so many years ago, we fought as enemies at the Trident.
He was a fine man, your father. What the Mad King did to him was a terrible crime.
I hear the king wants to joust today.
I don't believe so, Your Grace.
Your Grace, the Kingsguard is a sworn brotherhood. Our vows are taken for life. Only death relieves us of our sacred trust.
Your Grace...
The man who profaned his blade with the blood of the king he had sworn to defend!
A hall to die in, and men to bury me.
I am a knight! I shall die a knight!
Here, boy!
Melt it down and add it to the others!
The honor is mine, my queen.

King Robert is dead. I have been searching for you, Daenerys Stormborn, to ask your forgiveness. I was sworn to protect your family. I failed them. I am Barristan Selmy, Kingsguard to your father. Allow me to join your Queensguard and I will not fail you again.
Mm. You were first through the breach at Pike.
Thoros of Myr. Bloody madman. Robert knighted you after the battle?
Robert would have laughed. He was a good man. A great warrior. And a terrible king.
The Yunkish are a proud people; they will not bend.
Gladly, your Grace.
We're not going to sneak an army through a back gate.
The city is yours. All these people are your subjects, now. Sometimes it is best to answer injustice with mercy.
And we have taken the Meereenese navy, Your Grace.
93, Your Grace.
9,300, not counting sailors.
Davos_Seaworth: Well, life's been good since you hacked them off, Your Grace. And it's four less fingernails to clean.
Pardon?
It reminds me of where I come from and where I am now. It reminds me of your justice. It was an honest punishment, and you were good with the cleaver.
I think mothers and fathers made up the gods because they wanted their children to sleep through the night.
Oh, that's a long story.
You ever been in a boat before?
Do you know how to swim?
Don't fall out!
...the first night of the full moon. Why is there a G in "night"?
If you mistrust fancy people so much, why were you in such a hurry to trust her?
She does know her way around a man's head, I'll give her that.
Uh...
Thirty-two.
Well, strictly speaking, I didn't do the thieving, that would be the pirates. I just moved what they stole from one place to another.

This is the payment that was demanded by King Stannis for my crimes. I consider it an honest accounting. He's an honest man, and he's your best chance to get back the money you've sunk into Westeros, which is a lot, I imagine. Wars are expensive.
As long as Stannis lives, the war is NOT over. Who's the real power in King's Landing?
Now, humor me.
How old is Tywin Lannister?

Sixty-seven, and when he dies, who's in command? A half-grown boy, the product of incest? Cersei Lannister, the queen whose people despise her? Jaime Lannister, the man best known for killing the king he was sworn to protect? When Tywin's gone, who do you back?
Begging your pardon, I think it's a problem for now. There's only one reliable leader left in Westeros
This is Stannis Baratheon, the one true king of the Seven Kingdoms.
What?
It's better to wait for the right time than risk everything.
I've never been much of a fighter. Apologies for what you're about to see.

Fuck him, then. Fuck all of them. I'm not a devout man, obviously. Seven gods, drowned gods, tree gods, it's all the same. I'm not asking the lord of light for help. I'm asking the woman who showed me that miracles exist.
Have you ever tried?
You clean up as much of the shit as you can.
Good. Now go fail again.
I may not know the north, but I know men. They're more or less the same in any corner of the world and even the bravest of them don't want to see their wives and children skinned for a lost cause.
No, thanks. It does sound delicious, but I better keep a clear head. I can never sleep the night before a battle.
I walk. Think and walk. Think and walk until I'm far enough away from camp so that no one can hear me shitting my guts out.
Tell him. Tell him who it belonged to.
Tell him what you did to her. Tell him!
Why?
You burned a little girl alive!
If he commands you to burn children, your Lord is evil!
I loved that girl, like she was my own. She was good, she was kind, and you killed her!
The only way for what? They all died anyway! You said Stannis was 'the one'; you had him believing it. You had everyone fooled, and you lied.
Aye, you were wrong. How many died because you were wrong?
This is Jon Snow... he's King in the North.

You don't believe him? I understand that, it sounds like nonsense. But if destiny has brought Daenerys Targaryen back to our shores, it has also made Jon Snow King in the North. You were the first to bring Dothraki to Westeros? He is the first to make allies of wildlings and Northmen. He was named Lord Commander of the Night's Watch, he was named King in the North, not because of his birthright. He HAS no birthright, he's a damn bastard! All those hard sons of bitches chose him as their leader, because they believed in him. All those things you don't believe in, he faced those things, he fought those things for the good of his people. He risked his life for his people. He took a knife in the heart for his people. He gave his own...
If we don't put aside our enmities and band together, we will die. And then it doesn't matter whose skeleton sits on the Iron Throne.
I believe you know of whom I speak.
A good heart? I've noticed you staring at her 'good heart'.
Fewer.
Nothing fucks you harder than time.
As my father used to say, "It's better to be a coward for a minute, than dead for the rest of your life."
Our reasons aren't your reasons.
Nobody mind me. All I've ever done is lived to a ripe old age.
Last time I was here, you killed my son with wildfire.
There's a path to the left that hugs the cliff. The guards hardly ever patrol it. Too many steps.
I've got me own business in Flea Bottom.
Then we're fucked! Best hurry!
Thought you might still be rowing.
This is Gendry.
A harmless courtesy, your Grace.
Your Grace, the Lannisters are the true enemy. If, for the time being, you could make peace with your brother...
But many have already declared for him. Mace Tyrell, Randyll Tarly...
And how many ships has the Lord of Light got in his fleet?
I'm sure he doesn't, but we do if we're going to war. If not Renly, Your Grace, join forces with Robb Stark.
The queen?
I wish I had a God, truly. I'm not mocking you, but I've seen men pray to every God there is... pray for wind, pray for rain, pray for home. None of it works.
I wasn't praying.
My lady, I can't read the words.
No, no...
No...
No, we can't...
I wouldn't know where to start.
Margaery_Tyrell: Loras! Highgarden!
Now, now, my love. My brother fought valiantly for you.
Calling yourself a king doesn't make you one, and if Renly wasn't a king, I wasn't a queen.
No. I want to be *the* queen.
Lady Sansa, it is an honor to present my grandmother, the Lady Olenna of House Tyrell.
Renly was brave and gentle, Grandmother. Father liked him, and so did Loras.
Grandmother! What will Sansa think of us?
I'm to be his wife. I only want to know what that means.
Go on.
She's terrified, Grandmother, just look at her.
Lady Brienne.
So good of you to come.
That's not true, my love. Brienne had nothing to do with it.
He's choking!
One of my husbands preferred the company of men and was stabbed through the heart. Another was happiest torturing animals and was poisoned at our wedding feast. I must be cursed.
But I would have been the queen.
I understand. But it's not your fault. You know that, don't you? You mustn't feel guilty.
The desires that once drove me no longer do.
There's something wrong.
Cersei is not here. Tommen is not here. Why do you think they're not here?

Forget about the bloody gods and listen to what I'm telling you. Cersei understands the consequences of her absence and she is absent anyway, which means she does not intend to suffer those consequences. The trial can wait. We all need to leave.
Gendry: You know you shouldn't insult people that are bigger than you are.
And who told you that?
How'd you know he was a knight?
You don't have to be a knight to buy armor. Any idiot can buy armor.
'Cause I sold armor.
What about you anyway? You thought they were after you? Why? Did you kill someone or is it just because you're a girl?
Yes, you are. Do you think I'm as stupid as the rest of them?
Yeah, that's true, but you're still a girl.
Yeah? Well, pull your cock out and take a piss, then.
Well, they won't. Not from me.
So you're a highborn, then. You're a lady.

Yeah, but you were a lord's daughter, and you lived in a castle and you... look, all that about cocks, I should never have said... and I've been pissing in front of you and everything. I should be calling you "my lady".
As my lady commands.
Well, that was unladylike.
Then you're stupid. They scare me.
Huh? Sideface?
Why?
But just explain it to me. He offered to have any three people you wanted dead. All you had to do was give him the names. Anyone. You could have picked King Joffrey.
You could have picked Tywin Lannister.
Because you could have ended the war!
North.
King's Landing. Tobho Mott's shop.
That's because he's twice as good.
Yes, it is.
Well, be safe.
You don't... burn your fingers.
What is this place?
They're a family. I've never had a family.
You wouldn't be my family. You'd be m'lady.
So how'd you become a lord?
Better not, then. I'm a bit busy.
No.
No.
You're me. Never been with a woman. Never talked to a woman, really. And then she comes at you - big words, no clothes. What would you have done?
I should have known. Every time a highborn asks my name, it's trouble.
How can we be?
Maester_Aemon: The Starks are always right eventually; winter is coming. This one will be long and dark things will come with it... When winter does come, gods help us all if we're not ready!
Tell me, did you ever wonder why the men of the Night's Watch take no wives and father no children?

So they will not love. Love is the death of duty. If the day should ever come when your lord father was forced to choose between honor on the one hand and those he loves on the other, what would he do?
Then Lord Stark is one man in 10,000. Most of us are not so strong. What is honor compared to a woman's love? And what is duty against the feel of a newborn son in your arms? Or a brother's smile?
We're all human. Oh, we all do our duty when there's no cost to it. Honor comes easy then. Yet sooner or later in every man's life there comes a day when it's not easy. A day when he must choose.
Oh, it hurts, boy, Oh, yes. I know.
My father was Maekar, the First of his Name. My brother Aegon reigned after him, when I had refused the throne, and he was followed by his son Aerys, whom they called the Mad King.

I am a master of the Citadel, bound in service to Castle Black and the Night's Watch. I will not tell you... to stay or go. You must make that choice yourself, and live with it for the rest of your days. As I have.
I grew up in King's Landing.
We could spend all night trading tales of lost loves. Nothing makes the past a sweeter place to visit than the prospect of imminent death.
And what is it that couldn't wait until morning, Tarly?
That it was you? Who else but Samwell Tarly would be wasting candles to read in the middle of the night?
Kill the boy, And the let the man be born.
Arya_Stark: I know which end to use.
Syrio says a water dancer can stand on one toe for hours.
Syrio says every hurt is a lesson, and every lesson makes you better.
Tomorrow I'm going to be chasing cats.
He says every swordsman should study cats. They're as quiet as shadows and as light as feathers. You have to be quick to catch them.
Now that Bran's awake, will he come live with us?
He wants to be a knight of the Kingsguard. He can't be one now, can he?
Can I be lord of a holdfast?
Why do they call you Littlefinger?
Then I wouldn't get to insult anyone.
If you got within a mile of a battle, you'd fill your pants.
Gendry's an armorer's apprentice. Hot Pie, tell Gendry what makes a fight into a battle.
Stupider. The Night's Watch doesn't take girls, everyone knows that.
I don't need to take a piss.
Lommy and Hot Pie can't know. No one can know.
My name's not Arry. It's Arya, of House Stark. Yoren is taking me home to Winterfell.
He was never a traitor. Joffrey is a liar.
No. I mean, yes. My mother was a lady and my sister...
Joffrey... Cersei... Ilyn Payne... the Hound...
Joffrey... Cersei... Ilyn Payne... the Hound. Joffrey... Cersei... Ilyn Payne... the Hound. Joffrey... Cersei... Ilyn Payne... the Hound.
You're one of them now. I should've let you burn.
I can name anyone... and you'll kill him?
I-I don't know his name. They call him the Tickler.
You're practicing for a fight. You should practice right.
It wasn't just Aegon riding his dragon. It was Rhaenys and Visenya, too.
Rhaenys rode Meraxes. Visenya rode Vhaghar.
Visenya Targaryen was a great warrior. She had a Valyrian steel sword she called "Dark Sister."
Have you met many stonemasons, my lord?
I'm not joking. A man can go kill himself.
If you help me and my friends escape.
How did you know we'd come this way?
How did you kill those guards? Was it hard?
Show me how. I want to be able to do it too.
I want to... but I can't. I need to find my brother and mother. And my sister. I need to find her too.
Jaqen got us out of Harrenhal. So why are you complaining?
If we were going north, we should have come to the red fork river by now.
It's a hundred feet wide. How could we have passed it?
You go on down the road. Just keep on singing so we know where you are. Leave us be, and I won't kill you.
No, who do you fight for?
Gendry's a smith. He was apprenticed in the armory.
He knows how to use a sword, and so do I.
You murdered Mycah! The butcher's boy. My friend. He was twelve years old. He was unarmed, and you rode him down. You slung him over your horse like he was some deer.
That's a lie! I hit Joffrey. Mycah just ran away.
Could you bring back a man without a head? Not six times. Just once.
What are you going to do with me?
I'm a hostage, and you're selling me.
Joffrey... Cersei... Ilyn Payne... Ser Meryn... the Hound.
You're a witch! You're going to hurt him!
Face, tits, balls. I hit him right where I wanted to.
Did the Lord of Light tell you that, or did she?
You're not doing this for your god! You're doing this for gold!
I know him. The small one. His name is Polliver. He captured us and took us to Harrenhal. He killed Lommy.
He was my friend. Polliver stole my sword and put it right through his neck. He's still got it.
Lots of people name their swords.
When am I going to get a horse of my own?
Little lady wants away from your stench.
Why don't you have any money? Didn't you steal anything from Joffrey before you left?

You're fine with murdering little boys, but thieving is beneath you.
You think I'm gonna escape. Where would I go? I'd be dead by nightfall without you, my family's gone, I've got no one.

Fine little blade. Maybe I'll pick my teeth with it.

He took us in. He fed us and you...
You're the worst shit in the Seven Kingdoms!
It's not fighting, it's water dancing.
The greatest swordsman who ever lived
Meryn Trant! That's why Ser Meryn's on my...

Joffrey... Cersei... Walder Frey... Meryn Trant... Tywin Lannister... the Red Woman... Beric Dondarrion... Thoros of Myr... Ilyn Payne... the Mountain.
I can't sleep until I say the names.
Only the ones I'm going to kill.
If he were here right now, what would you do?
I'm almost done. Only one name left.
Nothing can be worse than this.
"Nothing" isn't better or worse than anything. Nothing is just... nothing.
I'd have killed Joffrey with a chicken bone if I had to.
I want to see the captain.
I want to go north, to the wall.
I wouldn't need a cabin. Please, I could work, scrubbing the floors, or...
I don't care what you swore!
You said there was no Jaqen H'ghar here.
Cersei Lannister. Gregor Clegane. Walder Frey.
Which name would you like a girl to speak?
A girl is Arya Stark of Winterfell and I'm going home.
When people ask you what happened here tell them the North remembers. Tell them winter came for House Frey.
Nymeria, it's me, Arya. I'm heading North, girl. Back to Winterfell, I'm finally going home. Come with me. Come with me.
They say you killed Joffrey. Did you?
Me, too. I was angry when I heard someone else had done it. However long my list got, he was always first.
Of people I'm going to kill.
It's a long story. I imagine yours is too.
Mine neither. But... our stories aren't over yet.
They were insulting Jon, and you sat there and listened.
Their opinions are important to you?
Not if they lose their heads first.
And if Jon doesn't come back, you'll need their support... so you can work together, to give you what you really want.
You're thinking it right now. You don't want to be, but the thought just won't go away.
That's your pretty handwriting. Septa Mordane used to crack my knuckles 'cause I couldn't write as well as you.
"Robb, I write to you today with heavy heart. Our good King Robert is dead. Killed from wounds he took in a boar..."
Did they? With a knife at your throat? Did they put you in a rack and stretched you till your bones started to crack?
So was I. I would have let them kill me before I betrayed my family.

And you were stupid enough to believe them. I remember you, standing on that platform with Joffrey and Cersei when they dragged father to the block. I remember the pretty dress you were wearing, I remember the fancy way you did your hair.
I was there. Standing in the crowd near Baelor's statue.
I didn't betray him. I didn't betray Robb. I didn't betray our entire family for "my beloved Joffrey".
Alright, then. Get on with it.
I was just the executioner. You passed the sentence. You're the Lady of Winterfell.
I was never going to be as good a lady as you. So I had to be something else. I never could have survived what you survived.
I believe that's the nicest thing you've ever said to me.
"In winter we must protect ourselves. Look after one another."
Theon_Greyjoy: Can't resist some northern ass? If you like redheads, ask for Ros.
He's not my master.
She wasn't feeling well.
Milady's whereabouts...
Must've been a pretty sight.
We were outnumbered ten to one!
Careful, Imp.
Important enough for the likes of you.
Who, the Imp? I call him half a nobleman.
Why should I be jealous? Anyone with a few coppers in his pocket can own you for the night. What's a dwarf like down below? I've always wondered.
Mmm?
I'm a Greyjoy. We've been lords of the Iron Islands for three hundred years, there's not a family in Westeros that can look down on us. Not even the Lannisters.
I've been Lord Stark's ward since I was eight years old.
My father fought for the freedom of his people. What did your father do? Fucked a cook and whelped a whore.
I'm not a boy.
I don't want to pay for it.
Famed for their skills in archery, navigation and lovemaking.
Are you afraid?
Good.
It means your not stupid.
The bards will sing songs of their sacrifice.
Am I your brother, now and always?
My sword is yours, in victory and defeat, from this day until my last day.
How did you get past the guards?
You act as if I volunteered to go. You gave me away, if you remember. The day you bent the knee to Robert Baratheon, after he crushed you. Did he take what was yours then?
You gave me away! Your boy! Your last boy! You gave me away like I was some dog you didn't want anymore. And now you curse me because I've come home.
You're the crew of the Sea Bitch? I'm your commander. Welcome.
Stop.
Stop! Your captain commands you to stop!
The Stony Shore, to raid their villages. There'll be spoils in it for you, and women, if you do your jobs well.
You could do that. Take the ship, head out on your own. And I will hunt you down, drag you back here in chains, and hang you for a traitor!
Thank you. Kind of you to come see me off.
Better get out there. Wouldn't want her to set sail without you.
Who are you?
Why aren't you with the rest of them? Or did they send you? Did they send you to row me out and dump me halfway in the sea? That would be good for a laugh.
And how am I supposed to prove myself by pillaging piss-poor fishing villages?
And yet that's the task my father has given me, to prove that I'm a true Iron Islander.
The Stony Shore's not far from Torrhen's Square.
No, we could. We could never hold it for more than a few days. As soon as Winterfell got word that we'd taken Torrhen's Square, the Starks would send their men to take it back. And then...
Take me to my ship.
It's better to be cruel than weak.
A cripple. You let a cripple escape. The boy can't walk, but somehow he slipped past you.
Right. Get the horses. And the hounds.
You should be proud in your brother's achievements. I took the great castle of Winterfell with twenty men.
You hear that? That's the mating call of the Northmen. They want to fuck us! Well, I haven't had a good fuck in weeks, I'm ready for one!
They say that every ironborn man is worth a dozen from the mainland.
You think they're right?

We die today, brothers! We die bleeding from a hundred wounds, with arrows in our necks and spears in our guts! But our war cries will echo through eternity. They will sing about the Battle of Winterfell until the Iron Islands have slipped beneath the waves. Every man, woman, and child will know who we were and how long we stood! Aggar and Gelmarr! Wex and Urzen! Stygg and Black Lorren! Ironborn warriors will cry out our names as they leap onto the shores of Seagard and Faircastle!
Mothers will name their sons for us!
Girls will think of us with their lovers inside them!
And whoever kills that *fucking* horn-blower will stand in bronze above the shores of Pyke!
I WILL kill that man. I don't care how many arrows they feather me with, how many spears they run through me, I will kill that horn-blowing cunt before I fall.
I know I'm surrounded. I know that because I stood on the battlements and saw I was surrounded.
No word from my father?
Send more ravens.
The first time I saw Winterfell...

The first time I saw Winterfell, it looked like something that had been here for thousands of years, and would be here for thousands of years after I was dead. I saw it, and I thought, "Of course Ned Stark crushed our rebellion and killed my brothers. We never stood a chance against a man who lives here."

Yes, my captors were so very kind to me, you love reminding me of that. Everyone in this frozen pile of shit has always loved reminding me of that. You know what it's like to be told how lucky you are to be someone's prisoner? To be told how much YOU owe THEM? And then to go back home to your real father...
I will kill that man! I swear to the Drowned God, the old gods, the new gods, to every fucking god in every fucking heaven, I will kill that man!
And what's your counsel, trusted friend?

There's nowhere to run. I'd never make it back to the Iron Islands. And even if I did, even if by some miracle I slipped through the lines and made it home, I'd be a coward. "The Greyjoy who ran." The shame of the family.
I won't make it to the Wall. I won't make it ten feet past the Winterfell gates.
The opportunity for Jon Snow to cut my throat in my sleep!
I've done a lot, haven't I? Things I never imagined myself doing.
Wa...

If I win, you'll let me go?
Please...
The North.
Deepwood Motte.
Last Hearth.
The Karhold!

Torrhen Karstark.

You swore to tell me!
Please! Please cut it off, cut it off!
Kill me...
Theon Greyjoy.
Reek!
My name... Reek.

No, my lord. Just two farm boys.
Yes, my lord.
Jon Snow is at Castle Black.
Yes, of course, my lord.
But how can...
Pretend to be who?
Bad years?
If I got justice, my burnt body would hang over the gates of Winterfell.

The Iron Fleet isn't all he's bringing. He also wants to give you...
Not my claim.
Hers.
I'm not fit to rule.
Jon. I didn't know you were here.
Sansa... is she alright?
When I was Ramsay's prisoner, Yara tried to save me. She's the only one who tried to save me.
She needs me now.
Sansa_Stark: Arya!
Ser Loras would never do that. There is no honor in tricks.
Or maybe he'll give me yours.
I am loyal to King Joffrey, my one true love.
Does it give you joy to scare people?
Where?
What about the king?
I'll be safe here. Stannis won't hurt me.
My queen.
Praying.
For the gods to have mercy on us all.
Yes, your Grace.
Of course, your grace.
Joffrey is my...
Your father doesn't believe in the gods?
Joffrey will. The worst ones always live.
I will pray for your safe return, my lord.

Please don't stop the wedding.

Ser Eldrick Sarsfield and Lord Desmond Crakehall.
I hear that you're a pervert.
My sister used to do that to me when she was angry with me. And she was always angry with me.

We have a new queen.
He saved me.
He was helping me because I saved his life.
"We're all liars here".
And what do you want?
All right.
Careful! You've ruined it. Now I'm going to have to rebuild the whole thing.
You did.
Knocking things down isn't fixing them. It's ruining them.
You're being stupid.
Robin, I'm sorry, I...
I shouldn't have done that.
If he tells aunt Lysa...
Hello, Robin.
I'm building my home, Winterfell. At least I think I am. I haven't been back there in a long time.
No, I'm afraid not. It's not high up in the mountains. It's down on the ground.
We don't.
I never did anything with them at all. Girls didn't take part in that where I came from.
I like the sound of that.
No.
And sometimes we do.
You should leave.

If I'm going to die, let it happen while there is still some of me left.
You don't know which way she went?
How did she look?

I spent a lot of time thinking about what an ass I was to you. I wish I could change everything.
I was awful, just admit it.
Can you forgive me?
Forgive me!
Where will you go?
Go on.
Go on.

You will watch as my soldiers take turns raping your sister. You will watch as my dogs devour your wild little brother. Then I will spoon your eyes from their sockets and let my dogs do the rest, come and see. Ramsay Bolton, Lord of Winterfell and warden of the North
I would remind you that House Glover is pledged to House Stark. Sworn to answer when called upon.
You haven't fed them in seven days. You said it yourself.
They were. Now they're starving.
If Ramsay wins, I am not going back there alive. Do you understand me?
No one can protect me. No one can protect anyone.
Jon, a raven came from the Citadel. A white raven. Winter is here.
Back then I only thought about what I wanted, never about what I had. I was a stupid girl.
He did.
Only a fool would trust Littlefinger.
What do you want?
I was wrong.

At the moment, peace and quiet. No need to seize the last word, Lord Baelish. I'll assume it was something clever.

Why are you laughing?
You have to be smarter than Father. You need to be smarter than Robb. I loved them, I miss them, but they made stupid mistakes, and they both lost their heads for it.

Your list?
How did you get back to Winterfell?

Winterfell didn't just fall into our hands. We took it back, and the Mormonts and the Hornwoods and the wildings and the Vale. All of us, working together. Now, I'm sure cutting off heads is very satisfying, but that's not the way you get people to work together.
How can you even think such a horrible thing?
What?

You should have known what it was like. I was a child.
They told me it was the only way to save father.
You were there?
And what did you do? Did you come running to the rescue? Did you fight with the Lannisters and save father?
But you didn't. Just like me.
It's not what I want. It's what honor demands.
That I defend my family from those who would harm us. That I would defend the North from those who would betray us.
You stand accused of murder. You stand accused of treason. How do you answer these charges...
...Lord Baelish?
And yet, you betrayed her.

And yet, you betrayed me. When you brought me back to Winterfell, you told me there is no justice in the world not unless we make it. Thank you for all your many lessons, Lord Baelish. I will never forget them.

To kill me for marrying our enemies and betraying my family
To provide proof of my betrayals. To provide justification after she murders me.
Lady of Winterfell.

Sometimes when I'm trying to understand a person's motives, I play a little game... I assume the worst. What's the worst reason you'd have for turning me against my sister? You did it.

When the snows fall, and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies, but the pack survives
Yara_Greyjoy: Anything with a cock is easy to fool.

Theon holds the castle with a skeleton crew. Let me send word to my bastard at the Dreadfort; he can raise a few hundred men and retake Winterfell before the new moon. Your sister...

He ignored my advice at every turn. If he had been a trifle less arrogant...

I sent my bastard Ramsay to root him out. Robb Stark offered amnesty for the Ironborn if they gave us Theon.
Ramsay delivered the terms. The Ironborn turned on Theon, as we knew they would. They handed him over trussed and hooded. But Ramsay... well... Ramsay has his own way of doing things.
What did you do to him?

MY banners, not yours. You're not a Bolton, you're a Snow.
