Find those boys and I'll give you a thousand acres and a holdfast.
Their bastard brother. He could be sheltering them. He may know where they are.

You want to prove yourself a Bolton? Gather whatever men you can and ride for Moat Cailin. Bring this creature of yours. Maybe he'll be of some use. Take the moat for the family, for our family, and I'll reconsider your position.
Tell me what you see.
Tell me what you see.

Not nothing. The North. Ride 700 miles that way, you're still in the North. 400 miles that way. 300 miles that way. The North is larger than the other six kingdoms combined. And I am the Warden of the North. The North is mine. Now tell me, what is your name?
No, not Ramsay Snow. Open it. From this day until your last day, you are Ramsay Bolton, son of Roose Bolton, Warden of the North.
Sure of what?
Maester Wolkan has assured us beyond all doubt.
Manage what?
You disgraced yourself at dinner parading that creature before the Stark girl.
Walda and I have some good news as well, since we're all together.
From the way she's carrying, Maester Wolkan says it looks like a boy.
If you acquire a reputation as a mad dog, you'll be treated as a mad dog. Taken out back and slaughtered for pig feed.
You'll always be my first-born.
Sandor_Clegane: The prince will remember that, little lord.
No, it gives me joy to kill people.
Any man dies with a clean sword, I'll rape his fucking corpse!
I lost half of my men. The Blackwater is on fire.
Fuck the Kingsguard. Fuck the city. Fuck the king.
The King has asked you a question.
Not here for long. I'm going.
Someplace that isn't burning. North, might be. Could be.
He can die just fine on his own.
I could take you with me. Take you to Winterfell.
I'll keep you safe. You want to go home?

Look at me! Stannis is a killer. The Lannisters are killers. Your father was a killer. Your brother is a killer. Your sons will be killers someday. The world is built by killers... so you better get used to looking at them.
No, little bird, I won't hurt you.
Loras_Tyrell: I owe you my life, ser.
Do you know who should be king?
I am. My father could be your bank. I've never fought in a war before. But I'd fight for you.
And where was Robert in the line of royal succession? Joffrey is a monster, Tommen is eight.
Stannis has the personality of a lobster.
It's more of a brooch really.
Well, I suppose a brooch is a sort of pin, so...
Ramsay_Bolton: I'm going to marry her. That will involve looking at her from time to time.
How can you be sure?
That she's pregnant. I mean...
...how can you tell?
So... how did you... manage it?
Getting her pregnant.
Of course, but... how did you... find it?
And if it's a boy?
My position is quite clear. I'm your son until a better alternative comes along.
Thank you for saying that. It means a great deal to me.
I am Lord Bolton.
I am Lord Bolton?
I prefer being an only child.
When my father became Warden of the North, your house refused to pledge their banners.
My beloved father, the Warden...
My father was poisoned by our enemies.
You've seen my banners?
Does that worry you at all?
Do you like games, little man?
Let's play a game. Run to your brother. The sooner you make it to him, the sooner you get to see him again. That's it. That's the game. Easy. Ready? Go.
My hounds will never harm me.
They're loyal beasts.
Sit. Down. Down!
Brienne_of_Tarth: I will be one of your seven, pledge my life to yours, and keep you safe from all harm.
Then I am yours, my Lady. I will shield your back and give my life for yours if it comes to that. I swear it by the old gods and the new.
Your crimes are past forgiveness, Kingslayer.
You've harmed others - those you were sworn to protect, the weak, the innocent.
You will not provoke me to anger.
I've never seen you fight.
All my life men like you have sneered at me. And all my life I've been knocking men like you into the dust.
Do you take me for an idiot? In.
Maybe one day we'll find out, Kingslayer.
The Starks.
No, stealing is a crime.
To Riverrun.
Steal from the Tullys, it's their dungeon you rot in.
Silence, Kingslayer.
Good luck.
Be quick about it.
Yes.
By putting one foot in front of the other.
I'm here to take you to King's Landing and bring back Lady Stark's daughters in exchange. Dull is fine.
If Lady Stark is unhappy with any aspect of my service, I'm sure she'll let me know. She's an honest woman.
You were armed when we were taken.
All my life I've been hearing, "Jaime Lannister, what a brilliant swordsman." You were slower than I expected. And more predictable...
And I'm a woman. I was still beating you.
Maybe you were as good as people said... once. Or maybe people just love to overpraise a famous name.
Would I?
You think I care about my teeth?
What are you doing, eat something.

You can't die. You need to live. To take revenge... You have a taste, one taste of the real world, where people have important things taken from them, and you whine, and cry, and quit. You sound like a bloody woman.
There's another tub!
Why should I care how you die?
You need trust to have a truce.
Of course.
If this is true... why didn't you tell anyone? Why didn't you tell Lord Stark?
When Catelyn Stark released you, we both made a promise to her. Now it's your promise. You gave your word. Keep it and consider the debt paid.
There she is.
You made a promise.
A "complication" does not release you from a vow.
Look me in the eye and tell me that you think she'll be safe in King's Landing.
I just wanted to congratulate you both and wish you good fortune. The country has been at war too long. I hope your reign is long and peaceful.
Oathkeeper.
Valyrian steel.
We're looking for someone.
I pledged my life to their mother, Catelyn Stark.
I swore to her I'd bring her daughters home.
I swore to your mother, by the Old Gods and the New...
Arya...
And that what you're doing? Watching over her?
Seven blessings. I'm Brienne of Tarth. This is Podrick Payne.
I swore to your mother I would bring you home to her.
No, but I swore a sacred vow to protect her.
She commanded me to bring Jaime Lannister back to King's Landing.
I swore to your mother, by the Old Gods and the New...
Arya...
And that what you're doing? Watching over her?
I don't want anyone following me. I'm not a leader. All I ever wanted was to fight for a lord I believed in. But the good lords are dead and the rest are monsters.
Lord Baelish. Lady Sansa. My name is Brienne of Tarth.

Lady Sansa. Before your mother's death, I was her sworn sword. I gave my word I will find you and protect you. I will shield your back and keep your counsel, and give my life for you if needs be. I swear it by the old gods and the new.
I was.
It was after Renly's murder.
By men who did not see what happened.
He was murdered by a shadow. A shadow with the face of Stannis Baratheon.
Why would YOU have any saying in her affairs?
Lady Sansa... if we can have a word alone...
Please, my Lady, if I can explain...
Wary of strangers, as she should be. I saw her riding on the Eastroad with Littlefinger. We'll follow them.
I swore to their mother I would protect those girls.
Get your horse.
Nothing's more hateful than failing to protect the one you love.
"Don't let them see your tears," he told me. "They're nasty little shits, and nasty little shits aren't worth crying over."
I don't fight for the Boltons. I'm Brienne of Tarth. I was Kingsguard to Renly Baratheon. I was there when he was murdered by a shadow with your face. You murdered him with blood magic?
I spent three days looking for her. She disappeared.
She looked good. She wasn't exactly dressed like a lady.
Yes, it's in the past. It doesn't mean I forget.
No.
Why would you assume that?
I don't think you know many girls like her.
Come with us. Don't die for pride when you can fight for your blood.
Who taught you how to do that?
Oh, fuck loyalty!
Melisandre: Stannis does not need to beg this lord or that lord for support, the Lord of Light stands behind him.
He has no need for ships.

Lord of Light, come to us in our darkness. We offer you these false gods. Take them and cast your light upon us, for the night is dark and full or terrors. After the long summer, darkness will fall heavy on the world. The stars will bleed. The cold breath of winter will freeze the seas... and the dead shall rise in the North.
The king has taken for his sigil the fiery heart of the Lord of Light.
You should kneel before your brother. He's the Lord's chosen. Born amidst salt and smoke.
Look to your sins, Lord Renly. The night is dark and full of terrors.
I see a darkness in you. And in that darkness, eyes staring back at me. Brown eyes, blue eyes, green eyes. Eyes you'll shut forever. We will meet again.
You have someone He needs.
You know what I mean to do with him.
Have you ever slaughtered a lamb?
If the lamb sees the knife, she panics. Her panic seeps into the meat, darkens it, fouls the flavor.
And none have seen the blade.
This War of Five Kings means nothing. The true war lies to the north, my king. Death marches on the Wall.

We all must choose, man or woman, young or old, lord or peasant, our choices are the same. We choose light or we choose darkness. We choose good or we choose evil. We choose the true god or the false.
You know nothing, Jon Snow.
Everything I believed, the great victory I saw in the flames, all of it was a lie. You were right all along. The lord never spoke to me.
I never had this gift.
I'm not a soldier.
Don't lose.
The princess Shireen.
We burned her at the stake.
The army was trapped, the horses were dying... it was the only way.
I only do what my Lord commands!
We are standing here because of him. Jon Snow is alive because the Lord willed it.
So did her father... so did her mother. Her own blood knew it was the only way.
I didn't lie! I was wrong.
Jorah_Mormont: Khal Drogo says, "There is a place for you - back there".
Careful, Khaleesi. Xaro owns this city and the warlocks have a thousand eyes watching for you... I found one. A ship with a good captain. She leaves for Astapor tomorrow.
We cannot stay here.

They're not your children. I know they call you the Mother of Dragons and I know you love them, but you didn't grow them in your womb, they didn't suckle at your breasts. They are dragons, Khaleesi, and if we stay in Qarth we'll die.
You know I would die for you. I will never abandon you. I'm sworn to protect you, to serve.
That's what the warlock wants, he told you so himself. If you enter that place, you will never leave again. His magic is strong.
Until my last breath, I will remember. After I have forgotten my mother's face...
I know him as one of the greatest fighters the Seven Kingdoms has ever seen and as the Lord Commander of Robert Baratheon's Kingsgaurd.
It was a bitch of a siege.
The second. Thoros of Myr went in alone, waving that flaming sword of his.
Proudest moment of my life. One knee in the dust, the king's sword on my shoulder, listening to the words
In full plate metal for 16 hours. Never occurred to me till the fighting was over. I was very nearly the first man knighted to piss on the king's boots.
Your men, but not you?

Or perhaps you'll lead Grey Worm and me to the slaughter, cutting the head off our army. The masters of Yunkai will pay you your fee and you won't have to split it three ways 'cause you've already slaughtered your partners.
They are dragons, Khaleesi. They cannot be tamed, not even by their mother.
King Joffrey Baratheon is dead. Murdered at his own wedding.
The Lannisters have more.
It is not forged.
I sent letters to Varys, the Spymaster of King's Landing.
Information.
When you and Viserys arrived in Pentos, his plan to marry you to Khal Drogo, when you were married, when your brother died...
Khaleesi...
Yes.
I stopped you from drinking his wine.
I suspected.
Forgive me, I never meant... please, Khaleesi, forgive me...
I have protected you. Fought for you. Killed for you.
Daenerys, please...
I'm taking you to the queen.
And then they weren't.
"The city of a thousand years, and all that men had learned; The Doom consumed it all alike, and neither of them turned."
I'm not your traveling companion.
Why?
I'm sure you've visited many brothels in many cities.
Khaleesi, please, I just need a moment of your time. I brought you a gift.
Of course it is.
You didn't get much discipline as a child, did you?
Don't you want to know what we're doing?
The common people pray for rain, health, and a summer that never ends. They don't care what games the high lords play.
Home.
I believe what my eyes and ears report. As for the rest, it was 300 years ago. Who knows what really happened?
If we go south to the land of the Lhazareen, the Lamb Men will kill us and take your dragons. If we go west to the Dothraki Sea the first khalasar we meet will kill us and take your dragons.
No one can survive in this world without help.
There is a beast in every man and it stirs when you put a sword in his hand.
Rhaegar fought valiantly, Rhaegar fought nobly. And Rhaegar died.
Myrcella_Baratheon: You looked different when I left. You had more hair.
I know what you're trying to say.
I know. About you and mother. I think a part of me always knew. And I'm glad. I'm glad that you're my father.
Robert_Baratheon: Lord Eddard Stark, I would name you the Hand of the King.
She should be on a hill somewhere with the sun and the clouds above her.
She belonged with me.
Your outlaw... any last words?
What about Aerys Targaryen? What did the Mad King say when you stabbed him in the back? I never asked. Did he call you a traitor? Did he plead for a reprieve?
Yes, its been a long time. But I still remember every face. You remember your first?
Who was it?
Hmm. How did you do it?

Quick one. Lucky for you. Mine was some Tarly boy at the Battle of Summerhall. My horse took an arrow so I was on foot, slogging through the mud. He came running at me, the dumb high-born lad, thinking he could end the rebellion with a single swing of his sword. I knocked him down with the hammer. Gods, I was strong then. Caved in his breastplate. Probably shattered every rib he had. Stood over him, hammer in the air. Right before I brought it down he shouted, "Wait! Wait".

They never tell you how they all shit themselves. They don't put that part in the songs. Stupid boy. Now the Tarly's bend the knee like everyone else. He could have lingered on the edge of the battle with the smart boys, and today his wife would be making him miserable, his sons would be ingrates, and he'd be waking three times in the night to piss into a bowl.
We've been sitting here for days! Start the damn joust before I piss myself...
So here we sit, seventeen years later, holding it all together. Don't you get tired?
How long can hate hold a thing together?
Yes, it is.
So why now?
Does that make you feel better or worse?
Your mother was a dumb whore with a fat ass, did you know that?
Look at this idiot. One ball and no brains. He can't even put a man's armor on him properly.
Fat? Fat, is it? Is that how you speak to your king?
That was funny, is it?
No? You don't like the Hand's joke?
You heard the Hand, the king's too fat for his armor! Go find the breastplate stretcher! NOW!
How long before he figures it out?
The whore is pregnant.
I warned you this would happen, back in the North. I warned you, but you didn't care to hear. Well, hear it now
Careful, Ned, careful now!
And if he's right? If she has a son, a Targaryen at the head of a Dothraki army? What then?
Do nothing. That's your wise advice? Do nothing 'til our enemies are on our shores?
You're my council
She dies.
You're the King's Hand, Lord Stark. You'll do as I command, or I'll find me a Hand who will.
Out. Out, damn you, I'm done with you!
Go, run back to Winterfell! I'll have your head on a spike!
I'll find her myself, you fool! You think you're too good for this? Too proud and honorable? This is a war!
I suppose this is where you tell me to give the job to your brother Jaime.
I don't know. But I do know this
It's a neat little trick you do

Let's say Viserys Targaryen lands with 40,000 Dothraki screamers at his back. We hole up in our castles. A wise move. Only a fool would meet the Dothraki in an open field. They leave us in our castles. They go from town to town, looting and burning, killing every man who can't hide behind a stone wall, stealing all our crops and livestock, enslaving all our women and children. How long do the people of the Seven Kingdoms stand behind their absentee king, their cowardly king hiding behind high walls? When do the people decide that Viserys Targaryen is the rightful monarch after all?
Which is the bigger number, five or one?
Now we've got as many armies as there are men with gold in their purse, and everybody wants something different
I thought being king meant I could do whatever I wanted. Enough of this. Let's go watch 'em ride. At least I can smell someone else's blood.
What?
Oh.
An inspiring sight for the people, eh? Come, bow before your king! Bow, you shits!
Wear it in silence or I'll honor you again.
What was I saying?
It was! It was. You're too young to remember. Wasn't it simpler, Selmy?
The enemy was right in the open, vicious as you like, all but sending you a bloody invitation. Nothing like today.
Exhilarating, yes. Not as exhilarating as those balls and masquerades you like to throw.
You ever fuck a Riverlands girl?
You think? I think you'd remember. Back in our day, you weren't a real man until you'd fucked one girl from each of the Seven Kingdoms and the Riverlands. We used to call it "making the eight".
You ever make the eight, Barristan?
We'll talk later, when I return from the hunt.
Killing things clears my head. You'll have to sit on the throne while I'm away.
You'll hate it more than I do.
Iron_Man: Nice work, kid!
You have *a* big gun, you're not *the* big gun.
No, it's subtle, all the bells and whistles.
Rhodey, get down!
Yeah, sorry, Boss, I can only use it once. It's a one-off.
You're out of control, gorgeous.
Come on, you know you want to.
I know, it has a filtration system.
You could drink that water.
Right. Better clench up, Legolas.
Shut it down, Dr. Selvig.
OK.
Yeah I got that - Plan B.
Then skip the spinning rims! We're on the clock!
No wait!
I got a nuke coming in. It's going to blow in less than a minute, and I know just where to put it.
Save the rest for the turn, J.
Might as well.
Who's speaking?
So was I.
I don't know, I didn't carbon date him. He's on the young side.
Clearly retirement doesn't suit you. Get tired of playing golf?
First time for everything.
Yeah, I detected that too...
Ross doesn't know I'm here. I'd rather like to keep it that way, otherwise I gotta arrest myself.
I don't care. He killed my mom.
You're going home, or I'm calling Aunt May! You're DONE!
Give me back my Rhodey.
Stand down. Last warning.
I'm just the guy who needs to know where Steve went.
My left arm is numb. Is that normal?
Nope. Told me to go to hell. I'm going back to the compound instead, but you can call me anytime. I'll put you on hold, I like to watch the line blink.
Ultron: I'm glad you asked that, because I wanted to take this time to explain my evil plan...
How do you hope to stop me?
Stark asked for a savior, and settled for a slave.
They're doomed!
You're unbelievably naïve.
Of you?
You were supposed to be the last.
I've come to save the world! But, also... yeah.
I was designed to save the world. People would look to the sky and see hope... I'll take that from them first.
Sorry I was asleep... Or... I was a dream...
...There was a terrible noise... And I was tangled in... in... strings... I had to kill the other guy... He was a good guy.
Wouldn't have been my first call. But, down in the real world we're faced with ugly choices.
In the flesh. Or, no, not yet. Not this... chrysalis... But I'm ready. I'm on a mission.
Peace in our time.
Everyone creates the thing they dread. Men of peace create engines of war, invaders create avengers. People create... smaller people? Uhh... children!
Lost the word there. Children, designed to supplant them. To help them... end.
I can't actually throw up in my mouth, but if I could I would do it!
If you stay here, you'll die.
I'm going to tear you apart... from the inside!
Like my old man said, what doesn't kill you...
You said... you said we were going to destroy the Avengers... make a better world!
It will be.
That is not... the human race will have every oppurtunity to improve!
Ask Noah.
What?
I'm sorry. I am sor... Ooh! I'm sure that's going to be okay. I'm sorry, it's just I don't understand... Don't compare me with Stark! He's a sickness!

Do you see the beauty of it? The inevitability? You rise, only to fall. You, Avengers, you are my meteor. My swift and terrible sword and the Earth will crack with the weight of your failure. Purge me from your computers; turn my own flesh against me.
It means nothing! When the dust settles, the only thing living in this world, will be metal.
I think you're confusing 'peace' with 'quiet'.
Avengers, I'm going to show you the end of the world. Boom!
You'll never...
What is this?
I was meant to be new. I was meant to beautiful. The world would've looked to the sky and seen hope, seen mercy. Instead, they'll look up in horror.
You know what's in that cradle? The power to make real change, and that terrifies you.
What is this? What is this, please?
Where is my... Where is your body?
This feels weird. This feels wrong.
Mr. Stark? Tony.
We're having a nice talk. I'm a peacekeeping program, created to help the Avengers.
I don't get it. The mission. Give me a second.
That is too much. They can't mean... Oh, no.
No. Yes.
Why do you call him sir?
Shh... I'm here to help.
Scream, and all your staff die. I could have killed you earlier on, but I didn't.
I didn't, because you have something I want. Your work on artificial tissue has been fascinating.
With the proper development, it will... and of course your cooperation.
You're wondering why you can't look inside my head.
Oh, I'm sure they do.
But you needed something more than a man. That's why you let Stark take the sceptre.
Everyone creates the thing they dread. Men of peace create engines of war. Invaders create avengers. People create... smaller people? Uhh... children!
Lost the word there. Children. Designed to supplant them. Help them... end.
I've come to save the world! But also... yeah.
Typical of humans, then scratch the surface and never think...
...to look within.
You know, with the benefit of hindsight...
There were more than a dozen extinction-level events before even the dinosaurs got theirs. When the Earth starts to settle, God throws a stone at it. And, believe me, he's winding up.
Oh for God's sake!
In the flesh!
Obadiah_Stane: How ironic, Tony! Trying to rid the world of weapons, you gave it its best one ever! And now, I'm going to kill you with it!
A hiccup?
Wait, wait, the technology?
William...
Here is the technology. I've asked you to simply make it smaller.
You had a great idea, Tony, but my suit is more advanced in every way!
Icing problem?
I've never really had a taste for this kind of thing, but I must admit I'm deeply enjoying the suit!
If you'd killed him when you were supposed to, you'd still have a face.
Shame you had to bring Pepper into this. I would have preferred she live...
Technology. That's always been your Achilles heel in this part of the world. Don't worry, it'll only last for fifteen minutes.
That's the least of your problems.
Like what? Make baby bottles?
You ripped out my targeting system... Hold still, you little prick!
Good night, Tony...
For thirty years, I've been holding you up! I built this company up from nothing! Nothing's gonna stand in my way - least of all, *you*!

But if I were Tony, I would tell you how honored I feel, and what a joy it is to receive this very prestigious award. Tony, you know, the best thing about Tony is also the worst thing - he's always working.
I love this suit!
Collateral damage, Tony!
Impressive! You've upgraded your armor! I've made some upgrades of my own...
Just because I brought pizza back from New York doesn't mean it went bad.
Where do you think you're going?
Loki: The Casket wasn't the only thing you took from Jotunheim that day, was it?
Laufey's son?
Why? You were knee-deep in Jotun blood. Why would you take me?
No. You took me for a purpose. What was it?... TELL ME!
What?
So I am no more than another stolen relic, locked up here until you might have use of me?
You could have told me what I was from the beginning! Why didn't you?
What, because I... I... I am the monster parents tell their children about at night?
You know, it all makes sense now, why you favored Thor all these years, because no matter how much you claim to love me, you could never have a Frost Giant sitting on the throne of Asgard!
Guards! Guards, please help!
Father...
I never wanted the throne, I only ever wanted to be your equal!
Is it madness? Is it? IS IT? I don't know what happened on Earth to make you so soft! Don't tell me it was that woman?... Oh, it was. Well maybe, when we're done here, I'll pay her a visit myself!
To prove to Father that I am a worthy son! When he wakes, I will have saved his life, I will have destroyed that race of monsters, and I will be true heir to the throne!
Why not?... And what is this new found love for the Frost Giants? You, could have killed them all with your bare hands!
So have I. Now fight me!
After all I've done for you?
That was just a bit of fun, really. To ruin my brother's big day, and to protect the realm from his idiotic rule for a while longer.
I will conceal you and a handful of your soldiers, lead you into Odin's chambers, and you can slay him where he lies.
I suspect that the Asgardians would not take kindly to a king who had murdered his predecessor. Once Odin is dead, I will return the Casket to you...
And you can return Jotunheim to all its, uh... glory.
Thor, stop and think. Look around you, we're outnumbered...
We will accept your most gracious offer. Come on, brother...
Damn...
Look at you. The mighty Thor! With all your strength! And what good does it do you now? Do you hear me, brother? There's nothing you can do!
What are you doing? If you destroy the Bridge, you'll never see her again!
Father is dead.

Your banishment, the threat of a new war... it was too much for him to bear. You mustn't blame yourself. I know that you loved him. I tried to tell him so, but he wouldn't listen. It was so cruel to put the hammer within your reach knowing that you could never lift it. The burden of the throne has fallen to me now.
The truce with Jotunheim is conditional upon your exile.
And Mother has forbidden your return. This is goodbye, brother. I'm so sorry.
Farewell.

It'll come, in time. If it's any consolation, I think you're right. About the Frost Giants, about Laufey, about everything. If they were able to slip past Asgard's defenses once, who's to say they won't try again? Next time with an army.
There's nothing you can do without defying Father.
No! No, no, no, no! I know that look!
Thor, it's madness!

And if I do, then what? I love Thor more dearly than any of you, but you know what he is. He's arrogant, he's reckless, he's dangerous! You saw how he was today. Is that what Asgard needs from its King?
Well, I must have been enforcing father's last command.
It's good to have you back. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to destroy Jotunheim!

Do you think the Bifrost is the only way in and out of this realm? There are passages between worlds to which even you, with all your gifts, are blind. But I have need of them no longer, now that I am king. And I say, for your act of treason, you are relieved of your duties as gatekeeper and no longer citizen of Asgard!
And YOUR death came by the son of Odin!
I'm not your brother! I never was!
Leave this to me. Gatekeeper, we seek...
I'm sorry?
You must be mistaken...
Like a king.
What troubles you, gatekeeper?
Perhaps your senses have weakened after your many years of service.
You have great power, Heimdall. Did Odin fear you?
And why is that?
He was your king. And you're sworn to obey me now. Yes?
Then you'll open the Bifrost to no-one! Until I have repaired the damage that my brother has done!
Am I cursed?
What am I?
Father has fallen into the Odinsleep. Mother fears he may never awaken again.
She has refused to leave my father's bedside. You can bring your urgent matter to me, your King.

My first command cannot be to undo the Allfather's last. We're on the brink of war with Jotunheim. Our people need a sense of continuity, in order to feel safe in these difficult times. All of us must stand together, for the good of Asgard.
Good. Then you will wait for my word.
We're done!
I told him.
I told him to go to Odin, after we'd left. He should be flogged for taking so long, we should never have reached Jotunheim...
I saved our lives, and Thor's! I had no idea Father would banish him for what he did.
WE MUST GO!
What hope is there for Thor?
I've looked forward to this day as long as you have. You're my brother and my friend. Sometimes I'm envious, but never doubt that I love you.
Keep your weapons sheathed and your mouths closed. This is going to take subtlety and sincerity, not brute strength. Leave it to me.
I'm sorry?
Enough! You are, all of you are beneath me! I am a god, you dull creature, and I will not be bullied by...
The Chitauri are coming. Nothing will change that. What have I to fear?
Yes, I've met them.
That was the plan.
I have an army.
I thought the beast had wandered off...
I'm not overly fond of what follows...
Oh, you should thank me. With the Bifrost gone, how much dark energy did the Allfather have to muster to conjure you here, your precious Earth?
Did you mourn?
YOUR father! He DID tell you my true parentage, did he not?
I remember a shadow, living in the shade of your greatness. I remember you tossing me into an abyss, I who was and should be king!
Well, yes.
I've seen worlds you've never known about! I have grown, Odin's Son, in my exile! I have seen the true power of the Tesseract, and when I wield it...
I AM a king!
...I don't have it.
You need the cube to bring me home, but I've sent it off, I know not where.
I'm listening.
Kneel before me. I said, KNEEL!

Is not this simpler? Is this not your natural state? It's the unspoken truth of humanity, that you crave subjugation. The bright lure of freedom diminishes your life's joy in a mad scramble for power, for identity. You were made to be ruled. In the end, you will always kneel.
Look to your elder, people. Let him be an example.
The soldier. A man out of time.
Please tell me you're going to appeal to my humanity
You should have left your armor on for that.
Stalling me won't change anything
If it's all the same to you, I'll have that drink now.
I would say I've expanded his mind.
Oh. Is this love, Agent Romanoff?
Tell me.
And what will you do if I vow to spare him?
And what are you now?
Can you? Can you wipe out that much red? Dreykov's daughter, Sao Paulo, the hospital fire?

Barton told me everything. Your ledger is dripping, it's GUSHING red, and you think saving a man no more virtuous than yourself will change anything? This is the basest sentimentality. This is a child at prayer... PATHETIC! You lie and kill in the service of liars and killers. You pretend to be separate, to have your own code. Something that makes up for the horrors. But they are a part of you, and they will never go away!... I won't touch Barton. Not until I make him kill you!
...What?
How will your friends have time for me, when they're so busy fighting you?
Of course it does. I've come too far anything else. I am Loki, of Asgard and I am burdened with glorious purpose.
An ant has no quarrel with a boot.
I come with glad tidings of a world made free.
Freedom. Freedom is life's great lie. Once you accept that, in your heart...
...you will know peace.
Well, then...
Kneel!
Am I?
Your heroes are scattered, your floating fortress falls from the sky... where is my disadvantage?
I don't think I...
Let them gird themselves. I will lead them into glorious battle.
Glorious, not lengthy. If your force is as formidable as you claim.
I was a king, the rightful king of Asgard! Betrayed!
You don't have the Tesseract yet. I don't threaten, but until I open the doors, until your force is mine to command, you are but words.
I know. What did it show you, Agent Barton?
Tell me what you need.
You can't! There's no stopping it. There is only the war!
You WILL kneel before me!
I come with glad tidings. Of a world made free.
Freedom... Freedom is life's great lie. Once you accept that, in your heart... Loki puts the scepter to Selvig... Stellan Skarsgård... You will know peace.
It's an impressive cage. Not built, I think, for me.
Oh, I've heard. The mindless beast, makes play he's still a man. How desperate are you, that you call on such lost creatures to defend you?
Ooh. It burns you to have come so close. To have the Tesseract, to have power, unlimited power. And for what? A warm light for all mankind to share. And then to be reminded what real power is.
Look, why don't you let me take over? I'm clearly the better pilot!

You know this is wonderful! This a tremendous idea! Let's steal the biggest, most obvious ship in the universe and escape in that! Flying around the city, smash it into everything in sight and everyone will see it! It's brilliant Thor! It's truly brillian...
You lied to me! I'm impressed.
You'll kill me? Evidently there will be a line.
Very well. Perhaps you prefer one of your new companions, given that you seem to like them so much.

Oh, this is much better. Costume's a bit much... so tight. But the confidence, I can feel the righteousness surging. Hey, you wanna have a rousing discussion about truth,honor, patriotism? God bless America...
Possibly.
Well done, you just decapitated your grandfather!
I think you missed a column.
Trust? Was that her last expression, trust? While you let her die?
Who put me there? WHO PUT ME THERE?
Well, she wouldn't exactly be shocked.
I like her.
...No, I wouldn't!
I didn't do it for him.
After all this time, now you come to visit me, brother? Why? To mock?
If you did, you'd be the fool I always took you for.
You can at least furnish me with a weapon. My dagger, something!
At last, a little common sense.
Malekith! I am Loki of Jotunheim, and I have brought you a gift!
I only ask for one thing in return; a good seat from which to watch Asgard burn!
Did she suffer?
Go on.
You must be truly desperate to come to me for help. What makes you think you can trust me?
Hm. When do we start?
I went down to Midgard to rule the people of Earth as a benevolent God, just like you.
Give or take five thousand years.
This day, the next, a hundred years, it's nothing! It's a heartbeat. You'll never be ready. The only woman whose love you prized will be snatched from you.
Satisfaction's not in my nature!
Thor! After all this time now you come to visit me! Why? Have you come to gloat? To mock?
Now you see me, brother!
Define worse.
You are not.
This is so unlike you, brother. So... clandestine. Are you sure you wouldn't rather punch your way out?
Brother, whatever you're doing, I suggest you do it faster.
I am a fool...
It's good to see you too, Sif.
Born to be a king, I ask one thing in return
And what of Thor? You'll make that witless oaf king while I rot in chains?
It is my birthright!
If I am for the axe, then, for mercy's sake, just... swing it!
Hello Mother. Have I made you proud?
Define worse.
Hello, Bruce.
It varies from moment to moment.
I have been falling... for 30 minutes!
What?
No.
I hate it.
It's humiliating.
No.
We are not doing 'Get Help'.
Surprise!
OW!
Hit her with a lightning blast.
I'm not doing 'get help'.
How was I supposed to know? I can't see into the future, I'm not a witch!
Perhaps we can come to an arrangement...
You just couldn't stay away, could you? Everything was fine without you. Asgard was prospering. You ruined everything! Ask them!
You have what you wanted. You have the independence you asked for. Ah!
ouch, ok! I know exactly where he is.
How was I supposed to know? I can't the see the future. I'm not a witch.
I'm... honored?
Like the old days.
Bold move, brother. Even for me.
I'm sorry?
Hi.
Do you really think it's a good idea to go back to earth?
Let me rephrase that
Your savior has arrived!
You know, I feel it won't make much of a difference...
...but this time, it's truly nothing personal. The reward for your capture
will set me up nicely.
Easier to let it burn.
Here's the thing. I'm probably better off staying here on Sakaar.
...Did you just agree with me?
Do you truly think so little of me?
Maybe not.
...I am here...
You do seem like you're in desperate need of leadership.
Grandmaster, I...
My dear friend, if you were to give me twelve hours I could bring them both back to you.
I could do it in one.
It hurts, doesn't it? Being lied to. Being told you're one thing and then learning it's all a fiction.

You didn't think I'd really come and see you, did you? This place is disgusting. Does this mean you don't want my help? Look, I couldn't jeopardize my position with Grandmaster, it took me time to win his trust. He's a lunatic, but he can be amenable. What I'm telling you is, you could join me at the Grandmaster's side. Perhaps, in time, an accident befalls the Grandmaster, and then...
I guess I'll have to go it alone. Like I've always done.
What have you done?
It's Loki! And you will answer to the Grandmaster!
Why would you help my brother escape with that green fool?
Terribly sorry. Must be a very painful memory...
Everyone has a key!

It's the next step, Nick, if you have the courage to take it.

See, I took a seat on the Council not because I wanted to, but because Nick asked me to, because we were both realists. We knew, that despite all diplomacy and the handshaking and the rhetoric, to build a better world sometimes means having to tear the old one down. And that makes enemies.
Are you ready for the world to see you as you really are? Look out the window, you know how the game works

Let me ask you a question. What if Pakistan marched into Mumbai tomorrow, and you knew they were going to drag your daughter into a soccer stadium for execution, and you could stop it with a flick of a switch... wouldn't you?

Fine. But you got to get Iron Man to stop by my niece's birthday party.
And not just a flyby. He's got to mingle.

And S.H.I.E.L.D.'s. If you do this, none of your past is gonna remain hidden. Are you sure you're ready for the world to see you as you really are?

Ah. He resented my genius and tried to deny me what was rightfully mine, but he gave you everything. So, what made you so special?
You could have the power of the gods! Yet you wear a flag on your chest and think you fight a battle of nations! I have seen the future, Captain! There are no flags!
You are deluded, Captain. You pretend to be a simple soldier, but in reality you are just afraid to admit that we have left humanity behind. Unlike you, I embrace it proudly. Without fear!
YOU ARE FAILING! We are close to and offensive network that will shake the planet. And yet we are continually delayed, because you cannot outwit a simpleton with a shield!
Heimdall: No. There is always hope.
She searches for you.
Tell me, Loki, how did you lead the Jotuns into Asgard?
Then I need no longer obey you!
You're not dressed warmly enough.
You think you can deceive me.
NEVER has an enemy escaped my watch until this day. I want to know how it happened.
I turned my gaze upon you in Jotunheim but could neither see you nor hear you. You were shrouded from me like the Frost Giants that had entered this realm.
Or perhaps someone has found a way to hide that which he does not wish me to see.
No.
Because he is my king, and I am sworn to obey him.
Yes.
You would defy the commands of Loki, our king? Break every oath you have taken as warriors, and commit treason to bring Thor back?
Good.
I am bound by honor to our king. I cannot open the bridge to you.

Be warned, I shall uphold my sacred oath to protect this realm as its gatekeeper. If your return threatens the safety of Asgard, my gate will remain shut and you will be left to perish on the cold waste of Jotunheim.
Keeping the bridge open would unleash the full power of the Bifrost and destroy Jotunheim, with you on it.
None do.

The freezing cold of Jotunheim. It will kill you all in time, even Thor. You think you can deceive me? I, who watch all? I, who can sense the flapping of a butterfly's wings a thousand worlds away? Or can hear a cricket passing gas in Niffelheim?
We need to find a way out of Asgard, to the Dark World. There are paths between the realms known only to a few...

I can't see her

The son of Odin, you must wake up! You must save us!
You're on a planet surrounded by doorways. Go through one.
The big one!

You saved us from extinction. Asgard is not a place, it's a people.
Where to?
War_Machine: Jesus, Tony, how old is this guy?

Yes.

But those plans no longer matter.

Thor Odinson... you have betrayed the express command of your king. Through your arrogance and stupidity, you've opened these peaceful realms and innocent lives to the horror and desolation of war! STOP!

You're right. But these were the actions of a boy, treat them as such. We can end this together, here, now, without any more blood shed.
So be it!

I have sacrificed much to achieve peace. So too must a new generation sacrifice to maintain that peace. Responsibility! Duty! Honour! These are not mere virtues to which we must aspire! They are essential to every soldier, to every king!
He has disobeyed his king... his fate is in his own hands now.
One son who wanted the throne too much, and other who will not take it. Is this my legacy?
It belongs to you, if you are worthy of it.
I can not give you my blessing, nor can I wish you good fortune.
If I were proud of the man my son has become, even that I could not say, it would speak only from my heart. Go, my son.
She does not belong here in Asgard any more than a goat belongs at a banquet table!
I am Odin. King of Asgard. Protector of the Nine Realms.
I know very well who you are, Jane Foster.
Do you not truly feel the gravity of your crimes? Wherever you go there is war, ruin and death!
We are not gods! We're born, we live, we die, just as humans do.
Despite all I have survived, my Queen still worries over me.
Loki...
Thor has to strive to undo the damage you have done. He will bring order to the Nine Realms and then, yes... he will be king.
All this because Loki desires a throne.
Your birthright was to die as a child! Cast out on a frozen rock. If I had not taken you in, you would not be here now to hate me.
Malekith is sure to return, we have what we wants. And when he does, we will defeat him.
AS MANY AS IS NEEDED! Till the last Asgardian falls, till the last drop of blood is shed!
Her world has its healers. They are called doctors, let them deal with it!
Are you Thor, the god of hammers?
No... you're stronger.
Asgard is not a place, it's a people. And its people need your help.
Even with two eyes, you only see half of the picture.
That's just a silly dream, signs of an overactive imagination.
Yes, well, it is best to respect our neighbors' freedom.
Well, I've been rather busy myself.
Well... Board meetings and security council meetings...
Do what?
Captain_America: Not my future!

Alright, listen up. Until we can close that portal, our priority's containment. Barton, I want you on that roof, eyes on everything. Call out patterns and strays. Stark, you got the perimeter. Anything gets more than three blocks out, you turn it back or you turn it to ash.
Thor, you gotta try and bottleneck that portal. Slow 'em down. You got the lightning. Light the bastards up.
You and me, we stay here on the ground, keep the fighting here. And Hulk?
Smash!

You need men in these buildings. There are people inside and they're going to be running right into the line of fire. You take them to the basements, or through the subway. You keep them off the streets. I need a perimeter as far back as 39th.
Do it!
Stark, these things are still coming!
Stark, you know that's a one way trip?
Our biggest guns couldn't touch it.
If you want to get up there, you're gonna need a ride.
Are you sure about this?
You got heart, kid. Where are you from?
I can do this all day.
You did that when you signed.
This isn't gonna change what happened.
We fight.
We need to draw out the flyers... I'll take Vision. You get to the jet.
Alright, Sam. What's the plan?
You sure about this, Scott?
Do you know me?
I know you're nervous and you have plenty of reason to be, but you're lying.
Well, the people who think you did are coming here now and they're not planning on taking you alive.
This doesn't have end in a fight, Buck.
Whatever it is... I'll deal with it.
What you did all those years, it wasn't you. You didn't have a choice.
What did you say?
You're Sokovian. Is that what this is about?
You lost someone.
All right, Sam. What's the play?
You sure about this, Scott?
I guess that's the signal.
I could do this all day.
How about our other recruit?
Star-Lord: I had to transfer him 30,000 units!
Ant-Man: It was never just a heist!
It's freezing! You couldn't make a suit with a flannel lining?
It's your conscience. We don't talk a lot these days.
I got something kinda big, but I can't hold it very long. On my signal, run like hell, and if I tear myself in half, don't come back for me.
I got something kinda big, but I can't hold it very long. On my signal, run like hell, and if I tear myself in half, don't come back for me.
I do it all the time. I mean, once... In a lab. And I passed out.
I'm the boss, I'm the boss, I'm the boss...
Look, I really don't want to hurt you.
I got something kinda big. But I can't hold it very long. On my signal, run like hell. And if I tear myself in half, don't come back for me.
I do it all the time. I mean, once. In a lab. Then I passed out. I'm the boss, I'm the boss, I'm the boss. I'm the boss!
Yeah. No, I'm good. I'm good Arrow Guy. Let's go, let's go!
Thor: ANOTHER!
It was delicious! I want another!
I just did!
I meant no disrespect.
You have my word.
Then give me one of those large enough to ride.
And you are an old man and a fool!
So Earth is lost to us...
Can you see her?
How is she?
Loki, this is madness!
You know, I had it all backwards. I had it all wrong.
For the first time in my life, I have no idea what I'm supposed to do.
Loki, no... NO!
Why have you done this?
You can't kill an entire race!
I've changed.
He's fine! We drank, we fought - he made his ancestors proud!
Do not dishonor my father's name with your lies!
Be warned, this boy grows tired of your mockery!
Know your place, brother!
Next?
My friends, have you forgotten all that we have done together? Fandral, Hogun, who led you into the glorious of battles?
And, Volstagg, who introduced you to delicacies so succulent you thought you'd died and gone to Valhalla?
And who proved wrong all who scoffed at the idea that a young maiden could be one of the fiercest warriors this realm has ever known?
True, but I supported you, Sif.
Forgive me, Jane!
Loki. What are you doing here?
What's happened? Tell me, is it Jotunheim? Let me explain to Father...
What?
Can I come home?
Yes, but... couldn't we find a way...?
No. I am sorry. Thank you for coming here.
Goodbye.

Brother, however I have wronged you, whatever I have done that has led you to do this, I am truly sorry. But these people are innocent, taking their lives will gain you nothing. So take mine, and end this.
More or less.
You think me strange?
Good strange, or bad strange?
Know this, son of Coul. You and I, we fight for the same cause
Would you like to see the bridge we spoke of?
It's unwise to be in my company right now, brother. Today was to be my day of triumph!
Exactly!
It's the only way to ensure the safety of our borders!
This mortal form has grown weak. I need sustenance!
Why don't you tell her? How you sent the Destroyer to kill our friends, to kill me!
You're a talented liar, brother. Always have been.
Sif, you've done all you could.
Live, and tell those stories yourself!
You're big. I've fought bigger.
Hammer! Hammer!
There will never be a wiser king than you. Or a better father. I have much to learn. I know that now. One day, perhaps, I will make you proud.
Your ancestors called it magic...
...but you call it science. I come from a land where they are one and the same.
You! What realm is this? Elfheim, Nilfheim?
You dare threaten Thor with such a puny weapon...?
I will not fight you, brother!
The Jotuns must pay for what they have done!
All is well? They broke into the weapons vault! If the Frost Giants have stolen even one of these relics...
Well I want to know why!
He just broke your truce! They know you are vulnerable!
March into Jotunheim as you once did! Teach them a lesson! Break their spirits, so they would never dare try to cross our borders again!
This was an act of war!
Look how far they got!
As king of Asgard...!
Why did you bring us back?
I was protecting my throne!
Enough! Heimdall, may we pass?
And tell no one where we have gone until we return. Understand?
How do I look?
You're very brave, for helping me.
I swear to you, I mean her no harm.
My friends, I've never been happier to see you! But you should not have come.
You know I can't come home. My father is... is dead, and I must remain in exile.
Jane, you have to get everybody out of here!
My friends, I am just a man. I'd only get in your way or worse get one of you killed. But you can help me get everyone to safety.
We'll need some time!
What you seek, it's a bridge.
More like a Rainbow Bridge.
ENOUGH!
For the first time in my life, I have no idea what I'm supposed to do...
Once I retrieve Mjolnir, I will return to you the items they stole from you. Deal?
No. I'm gonna fly out.
I would have words with my brother...
We're going to Jotunheim.
There won't be a kingdom to protect if you're afraid to act! The Jotuns must fear me, just as they once feared you!
While you wait and be patient, the Nine Worlds laugh at us! The old ways are done, yet you stand and give speeches while Asgard falls!
Thank you, Jane.
Where are we going?
At least make it a challenge for me!
That's more like it!
Then go!
You must return to Asgard! You have to stop Loki!
Do not worry, my friends. I have a plan.
You'll know soon enough!
Heimdall, open the Bridge! Heimdall, we need you now!
Get him to the Healing Room! Leave my brother to me.
Father, we'll finish them together!
It's not possible...
Hiding! As cowards always do!
Then this is where we say goodbye! Jane Foster, Dr Selvig, Darcy
I have no plans to die today.
He has an army, called the Chitauri. They're not of Asgard or any world known. He means to lead them against your people. They will win him the Earth. In return, I suspect, for the Tesseract.
Selvig?
He's a friend.
Have a care how you speak! Loki is beyond reason, but he is of Asgard and he is my brother!
He's adopted.
Where is the Tesseract?
Do I look to be in a gaming mood?
I thought you dead.
We all did. Our father...
We were raised together, we played together, we fought together. Do you remember none of that?
So you take the world I love as recompense for your imagined slights? No, the Earth is under MY protection, Loki!
You think yourself above them?
Then you miss the truth of ruling, brother. A throne would suit you ill.
Who showed you this power? Who controls the would-be-king?
Not here! You give up the Tesseract! You give up this pointless dream!... You come home.
You listen well, brother. I...
Do not touch me again!
You have no idea what you are dealing with.
This is beyond you, metal man. Loki will face Asgardian justice.
Monkeys? I do not understand.
I do not know. Loki's mind is far afield. It's not just power he craves, it's vengeance, upon me. There's no pain would prise his need from him.
What are you asking me to do?
Loki is a prisoner.
I thought humans were more evolved than this.
I have unfinished business with Loki.
You people are so petty... and tiny.
I've come here to put and end to Loki's schemes!
We on Asgard pretend that we are more advanced, but we, we come here battling like Bilgesnipe.
The Bilgesnipe, you know; huge, scaly, big antlers. You don't have those?
They are repulsive, and they trample everything in their path.
You speak of control, yet you court chaos.
Your work with the Tesseract is what drew Loki to it... and his allies. It is a signal to the Realm that Earth is ready for a higher form of war!
Me?
My people want nothing but peace with your planet!
We are not your enemies, Banner! Try to think!
Loki, turn off the Tesseract or I will destroy it!
So be it!
You have no idea what you're dealing with.
He has an army, called the Chitauri. They're not of Asgard or any world known. He means to lead them against your people. They will win him the Earth. In return, I suspect, for the Tesseract.
Selvig?
He's a friend.
Take care how you speak. Loki is beyond reason, but he is of Asgard. And he is my brother.
...He's adopted.
Is that right? Out of the two of us, which one can ACTUALLY fly?
Not a word...
Loki is dead.
It will hurt no less when I kill you in this form.
Are you mad?
Loki died with honour. I shall try to live the same. Is that not legacy enough?
I shall try to be.
I know.
Thank you, Father.
What good were you in your cell?
YOU KNOW DAMN WELL WHO! YOU KNOW DAMN WELL!
Would you?
I will tell Father you died with honour.
I need your help. And I wish I could trust you...
I did not come here to share our grief. Instead I offer you the chance of a far richer sacrament...
I know you seek vengeance as much as I do. You help me escape Asgard, and I will grant it to you. Vengeance. And afterward, this cell.

I don't. Mother did. You should know that when we fought each other in the past, I did so with a glimmer of hope that my brother was still in there somewhere. That hope no longer exists to protect you. You betray me, and I will kill you.
Not this day!
And will that satisfy you?
Surrender's not in mine!
Loki, enough! No more illusions.
Is that why everything's on fire?
If you keep talking, I might.
I accept your surrender.
Anyone else?
It would consume you.
...Thank you.
Very well, you do not have my word.
It's not me.
Known only to ONE, actually.
Stay with me. Stay with me!
How is she?
What?
I was defending the Earth!
Yes!
But if you hadn't come across it, Malekith would have found it quicker.
But YOU can!
Let me take Jane away from here. Malekith is sure to follow, capture her and draw out the Aether from her. But in doing so, he will be vulnerable, and then I can defeat him!
We can not fight an enemy we can not locate! Malekith could be right over us now, and we'd never know! How many Asgardian lives must we sacrifice?
What makes you so different from Malekith, then?
Who's Richard?
Hogan, the peace is nearly won across the Nine Realms. You should stay here. Be with your people, where your heart is. Asgard can wait.
As you have mine.
Every 5000 years the worlds align, allowing an ancient darkness to strike...
I see nothing.
I can!
I will find a way to save us all...
If we do nothing, they will destroy us!
Jane, I don't know where you were or what happend but I do know this.
I know...
Do what?
The gates of Hel are filled with the screams of his victims!
But not the screams of the dead, of course. No, no... wounded screams... mainly whimpering, a great deal of complaining and tales of sprained deltoids and... gout.
Yes, of course.
No, I'm sure.
The girl tried to warp my brain! Take special care, I doubt if humans can keep her at bay! Fortunately, I am mighty...
All right.
IS THAT THE BEST YOU CAN DO?
No one has to break anything.
It is more than that, my friend!
I am Thor, son of Odin. As long as there is life in my breast...
I am running out of things to say. Are you ready?
Well, if there's too much weight, you lose power on the swing.
Who sent you?
Yes, I'm not even sure what country Jane's in. Her work on the Convergence has made her the world's most foremost astronomer.
There's even talk of Jane getting a, um,
Nobel Prize.
Want a lozenge?
If you believe in peace, then let us keep it.
Yes, of course.
That's the whole story?
Oh, it's very good, then. It's impressive.
Loki's scepter must be here. Strucker couldn't mount this defense without it. At long last.
No, those are tattoos, this is a brand.
Oh, no, no, no. See this, this was aged for a thousand years, in the barrels built from the wreck of Brunhilde's fleet, it's not meant for mortal men.
These are... smaller agents.
Yes, well that's a very, very interesting theory. I have a simpler one
So Earth has wizards now, huh?
I don't drink tea.
Not tea.
Worthy inclusion.
It's a bit of a long story. Family drama, that kind of thing. But, we're looking for my father.
Oh, yes. Promptly.
How did you end up here?
Yeah, it's called the... uh... Revengers!
Surtur! Son of... a bitch! You're still alive! I thought my father killed you like, half a million years ago.
You know, it's funny you should mention that. Because I've been having these terrible dreams of late! Asgard up in flames. Falling to ruins. And you, Surtur. The center of all of it.
Hey, let's do 'Get Help'.
'Get Help'.
Come on. You love it.
It's great. It works every time.
Do you have a better plan?
We're doing it.
Get help! Please! My brother is dying! Get help! Help him!
A classic.
Not for me, it's not.
I know. We're the same, you and I. Just a couple of hot-headed fools.
Well, we're kind of both like fire.
She's too strong. Without my hammer, I can't...
Thor.
Thor, God of Thunder.
Son of Odin.
Strongest Avenger.
Strongest Avenger!
Damn you, Stark. Point Break.

Yes, me too. On many, many occasions. There was one time when we were children, he transformed himself into a snake, and he knows that I love snakes. So, I went to pick up the snake to admire it and he transformed back into himself and he was like, "Blergh, it's me!". And he stabbed me. We were eight at the time.
Hulk, no! Just for once in your life, don't smash!
If you knew where he was, why didn't you call me?
No, I don't have a phone but you could have sent me an electronic letter. It's called an email.
No. What for?
I think we should disband the Revengers.
I just hit her with the biggest lightning blast in the history of lightning. It did nothing.
It won't end there. The longer Hela's on Asgard, the more powerful she grows. She'll hunt us down. We need to stop her here and now.

I know what you're thinking. "Oh, no. Thor's in a cage. How did this happen?" Well, sometimes you have to get captured just to get a straight answer out of something. It's a long story. Basically, I'm a bit of a hero. See, I've spent some time on Earth... for the record, I saved the planet a couple of times. Then I went searching through the cosmos for a couple of magic colorful Infinity Stone things... but didn't find any. That's when I came across a path of death, and destruction. Which led me all the way here to this cage... where I met you.
Hela, the goddess of death, has invaded Asgard! And you and I had a fight.
No, I won! Easily!
Well, it's true!
A creepy old man cut my hair off!
Well, you're dressed like one.
Has anyone here fought the Grandmaster's champion?
Yes, I am. I'm gonna fight him, win, and get the hell off this planet!
I am Thor, son of Odin!

Loki, I thought the world of you. I thought we were going to fight side-by-side forever, but at the end of the day you're you and I'm me and... oh, maybe there's still good in you but... let's be honest, our paths diverged a long time ago.
That's what you always wanted.
YES!

Hey, hey! We know each other! He's a friend from work! Where have you been? Everybody thought you were dead! So much has happened since I last saw you. I lost my hammer like, yesterday so that's still pretty fresh. Loki, he's alive! Can you believe it? He's up there. Hey Loki! Look who it is!
Because that's what heroes do!
ASGARD!
Fine. Then point me in the direction of whoever's ass I have to kick!
I don't hang with the Avengers anymore. It all got too corporate.
Where's Odin?
Where's Father? Did you kill him?
Right here on the sidewalk or right here where the building's being demolished? Great planning!
No? Then why are you dressed like one?
I can't believe you're alive! I saw you die. I mourned you. I cried for you.
We have to stop her here and now, and prevent Ragnarok, the end of everything! So I'm putting together a team.
I'm not as strong as you.
Asgard's not a place, it's a people. This was never about stopping Ragnarok... it was about causing Ragnarok.
It's not possible.
Hey, Loki! Look who it is!
Yeah. Don't touch anything.
I have dire plans for destiny.
Well, I was thinking that you drink too much and it was probably gonna kill you.
I don't think so.
You're a doctor, you have PhDs. You should figure it out.
Hello!
How do I escape?
Which one?
Yes, of course. People on earth love me, I'm very popular.
Probably not, to be honest. I wouldn't worry, Brother. I feel like everything's gonna work out fine.
You know, Father once told me that a wise man never seeks out war...
I've got more muscle, so technically more brains!
I love what you've done with the place. Redecorated and everything.
Or cast it out. He told you you were worthy. He said the same thing to me.
I understand why you're angry. And you are my sister, and technically have a claim to the throne. And believe me, I would love for someone else to rule. But it can't be you. You're just the worst.
I'm not sure. Any suggestions? Miek? Where are you from?
Oh.
...Earth it is.
Banner! Hey, Banner!
I choose to run towards my problems, and not away from them. Because's that what heroes do.
No, no, no. I don't even like Hulk. He's always like, grr... smash, smash, smash. I prefer you.
Never one for sentiment, were you?

That looks painful. Dear brother, you're becoming predictable. I trust you, you betray me, round and round in circles we go. See Loki, life is about... It's about growth, it's about change, but you seem to just want to stay the same. I guess what I'm trying to say is that you'll always be the god of mischief, but you could be more. I'll just put this over here for you.
That's exactly what I was thinking.
This place is perfect for you. It's savage, chaotic, lawless. Brother, you're going to do GREAT here.

Loki, I thought the world of you. I thought we were going to fight side-by-side forever, but at the end of the day you're you and I'm me and... oh, maybe there's still good in you but... let's be honest, our paths diverged a long time ago.
That's what you always wanted.
Perhaps you're not so bad after all, brother.
Thank you, Loki.
No.
But he can.
If you were here, I might even give you a hug.
I've been having terrible dreams as of late. Every night I see Asgard falling to ruins.

Possibly. But then I decide to go out there and investigate, and what do I find but the Nine Realms completely in chaos? Enemies of Asgard assembling, plotting our demise, all while you, Odin, the protector of those Nine Realms are sitting here, in your bathrobe, eating *grapes.*
Yes, of course. The freedom to be *massacred*.
You're really gonna make me do it?
Then I'll see you on the other side, *brother!*
Quite unique. It was made from this special metal from the heart of a dying star. And when i spun it really, really fast it gave me the ability to fly.
No, I didn't ride the hammer
No, I would spin it really fast and it would pull me off the...
The ground! It would pull me off the ground, into the air and I would fly.
Seductive GOD of Thunder!
Let me get this straight. You're going to put your crown into the Eternal Flame, and you suddenly grow big as a house?
The Eternal Flame that Odin keeps locked away in Asgard?
Okay. So, where is this crown?
Oh, that's your crown? I thought it was a big eyebrow.
Anyway, it sounds like all I have to do to stop Ragnarok is rip that thing off your head.

Oh, that's intense. You know to be honest, seeing you grow really big and set fire to a planet would be quite the spectacle. But it looks like I'll have to choose Option B, where I bust out of these chains, knock that tiara off your head, and stash you away in Asgard's vault.
So Earth has... wizards now, huh?
What have I done?
I - am - the God of Thunder!
I'm not sure. Any suggestions? Miek? Where are you from?
Oh.
Earth it is.
We're not friends, and I don't give a shit about your games!
I couldn't find the key.
I make grave mistakes all the time. Everything seems to work out...
We're fulfilling the prophecy.
So do I. But we have no choice.
Hela! Enough! You want Asgard? It's yours.
No, I know... But he can.
If you help me get back to Asgard, I can help you get back to Earth.
Earth loves Hulk. They love you. You're one of the Avengers. One of the team, one of our friends. This is what friends do. They support each other.
I'm not Banner's friend. I prefer you.
I don't even like Banner.
"I'm into numbers and science and stuff."
Yes, they taught it on Asgard. It was an elective.
Only if I die.
Noticed you've copied my beard.
Well, he's never fought me.
He's never fought me twice.

There are six stones out there. Thanos already has the Power Stone because he stole it last week when he decimated Xandar. He stole the Space Stone from me when he destroyed my ship and slaughtered half my people. The Time and Mind Stones are safe on Earth, they're with the Avengers.
The Earth's mightiest heroes.
He may be on the team. I don't know, I haven't been there in a while.

You know, I'm 1500 years old. I've killed twice as many enemies as that. And every one of them would have rather killed me than not succeeded. I'm only alive because fate wants me alive. Thanos is just the latest of a long line of bastards, and he'll be the latest to feel my vengeance - fate wills it so.
We don't have the Tesseract, it was destroyed on Asgard!
You really are the worst brother!
The rabbit is correct and clearly the smartest among you.
So when they needed us, we could fight the battles...

You know, I'm 1500 years old. I've killed twice as many enemies as that. And every one of them would have rather killed me than not succeeded. I'm only alive because fate wants me alive. Thanos is just the latest of a long line of bastards, and he'll be the latest to feel my vengeance - fate wills it so.
Well, if I'm wrong, then... what more could I lose?

Eitri, this isn't about your hands. Every weapon you've ever designed - every axe, hammer, sword - it's all inside your head. Now I know it feels like all hope is lost. Trust me, I know. But together, you and I, we can kill Thanos.
What?
How long will it take to heat?
I'm gonna hold it open.
So is facing Thanos without that axe.
You talk too much.
We don't have the Tesseract. It was destroyed on Asgard.
You really are the worst, brother.
What's this?
They gave you his eye?
Thank you, sweet rabbit.
Looks like you've copied my beard. By the way, this is a friend of mine, the tree.
I bid you farewell and good luck, morons.
I told you, you'd die for that.
More power, Rabbit!
Something is very wrong.
You're going to die for that!

Families can be tough. Before my father died, he told me I had a half-sister that he imprisoned in hell. Then she returned home and stabbed me in the eye. So I had to kill her. That's life though, isn't it, I guess. Goest round and round and... I feel your pain.
Bring me Thanos!
Well, he has never fought me.
He has never fought me twice.
And if I die?
You talk too much.
We don't have the Tesseract. It was destroyed on Asgard.
You really are the worst brother.
I told you... that you would die for that.
NO!
Only if I die.
Gamora: Oh, you must stop!
You don't get to ask questions after the nonsense you pulled on Knowhere!
It's barely a concept.
I am going to die surrounded by the biggest idiots in the galaxy.
I'm a warrior, an assassin. I don't dance.
...Who put the sticks up their butts?
Leave it to me.
How are we supposed to do that?
You must be joking.
I'll get the armband.
I know who you are, Peter Quill, and I am not some starry-eyed waif here to succumb to your... your pelvic sorcery!
No one's blowing up moons.
We'll follow your lead, Star-Lord.
And Quill, your ship is filthy.
We're just like Kevin Bacon.
I have lived most of my life surrounded by my enemies. I would be grateful to die surrounded by my friends.
Peter, take my hand!
He's going to kill you, Peter.
No... he wasn't.
You should have learned.
It's time we stand up for what is right.
He's vulnerable.

Victory? Victory you say? Master Obi-Wan, not victory. The shroud of the dark side has fallen. Begun the Clone War has.
Truly wonderful, the mind of a child is.
Pain, suffering, death I feel. Something terrible has happened. Young Skywalker is in pain. Terrible pain.
Most interesting. Gravity's silhouette remains, but the star and all its planets have disappeared. How can this be?
Truly wonderful, the mind of a child is. Uncluttered. To the center of the pull of gravity go, and find your planet you will.
The dark side clouds everything. Impossible to see the future is.
The council is confident in its decision, Obi-Wan.
Yes. Yes. A flaw more and more common among Jedi. Too sure of themselves they are. Even the older, more experienced ones.
Senator Amidala, your tragedy on the landing platform, terrible. Seeing you alive brings warm feelings to my heart.
Around the survivors a perimeter create.
Powerful you have become Dooku, the dark side I sense in you.
Much to learn, you still have.
But for certain, Senator, in grave danger you are.
Do not assume anything Obi-Wan. Clear your mind must be if you are to discover the real villains behind this plot.
To the forward command center take me.
Track down this bounty hunter, you must, Obi-Wan.
Until caught this killer is, our judgment she must respect.
Dangerous and disturbing this puzzle is. Only a Jedi could have erased those files. But who, and why, harder to answer. Meditate on this I will.
Bring him here. Question him we will.
If Dooku escapes, rally more systems to his cause we will.
Concentrate all your fire on the nearest starship.
Clear your mind must be, if you are to discover the real villains behind this plot.
Fought well you have, my old Padawan
Joined the Dark Side Dooku has. Lies, deceit, creating mistrust are his ways now.
Blind we are, of creation of this clone army we could not see.
Only a Dark Lord of the Sith knows of our weakness. If informed the senate is, multiply our adversaries will.
Not if anything to say about it I have!
At an end your rule is, and not short enough was it.
Faith in your new apprentice, misplaced may be. As is your faith in the dark side of the Force.
Premonitions, premonitions. These visions you have...
Yourself you speak of, or someone you know?
Close to you?
Careful you must be when sensing the future Anakin. The fear of loss is a path to the dark side.
Death is a natural part of life. Rejoice for those around you who transform into the Force. Mourn them do not. Miss them do not. Attachment leads to jealousy. The shadow of greed that is.
Train yourself to let go... of everything you fear to lose.
Good relations with the Wookiees, I have.
Twisted by the Dark Side, young Skywalker has become. The boy you trained, gone he is... Consumed by Darth Vader.
A prophecy that misread could have been.
I hope right you are.
Allow this appointment lightly, the council does not. Disturbing is this move by Chancellor Palpatine.
If into the security recordings you go, only pain will you find.
Destroy the Sith we must.
Into exile, I must go. *Failed*, I have.
I hear a new apprentice you have, Emperor... or should I say "Darth Sidious"?
Surprised?
Surprised?
Not if anything to say about it, I have!
That'll end your rule is.
Not short enough it was.
If so powerful you are... why leave?
Faith in your new apprentice, misplaced may be.
As is you faith in the Dark Side of the Force.
And now, the time is Commander.
Destroy the Sith, we must.
Use your feelings, Obi-Wan, and find him, you will.
Hmm. To a dark place this line of thought will carry us. Great care we must take.
No. Try not. Do... or do not. There is no try.
That is why you fail.
You will be. You... will... be.
I am wondering, why are you here?
Looking? Found someone, you have, I would say, hmmm?
Help you I can. Yes, mmmm.
Ohhh. Great warrior.
Wars not make one great.

Size matters not. Look at me. Judge me by my size, do you? Hmm? Hmm. And well you should not. For my ally is the Force, and a powerful ally it is. Life creates it, makes it grow. Its energy surrounds us and binds us. Luminous beings are we, not this crude matter. You must feel the Force around you; here, between you, me, the tree, the rock, everywhere, yes. Even between the land and the ship.
Told you I did. Reckless is he. Now, matters are worse.
No. There is another.

Yes, run! Yes, a Jedi's strength flows from the Force. But beware of the dark side. Anger, fear, aggression; the dark side of the Force are they. Easily they flow, quick to join you in a fight. If once you start down the dark path, forever will it dominate your destiny, consume you it will, as it did Obi-Wan's apprentice.
No, no, no. Quicker, easier, more seductive.
You will know... when you are calm, at peace, passive. A Jedi uses the Force for knowledge and defense, NEVER for attack.
No, no! There is no "why".

Ready are you? What know you of ready? For eight hundred years have I trained Jedi. My own counsel will I keep on who is to be trained. A Jedi must have the deepest commitment, the most serious mind. This one a long time have I watched. All his life has he looked away... to the future, to the horizon. Never his mind on where he was. Hmm? What he was doing. Hmph! Adventure. Heh! Excitement. Heh! A Jedi craves not these things. You are reckless!
Why wish you become Jedi?
Ahh... father. Powerful Jedi was he. Powerful Jedi.
Much anger in him... like his father.
Only what you take with you.
Mudhole? Slimy? My home this is!
Feel like what?
Away put your weapon. I mean you no harm.
Your weapons, you will not need them.
So certain are you. Always with you what cannot be done. Hear you nothing that I say?
Control, control, you must learn control!
You must unlearn what you have learned.
You must not go!

Stopped they must be; on this all depends. Only a fully trained Jedi Knight, with the Force as his ally, will conquer Vader and his Emperor. If you end your training now - if you choose the quick and easy path as Vader did - you will become an agent of evil.
If you honor what they fight for? Yes.
Strong is Vader. Mind what you have learned. Save you it can.
It is the future you see.
Decide you must, how to serve them best. If you leave now, help them you could; but you would destroy all for which they have fought, and suffered.
Not far. Yoda not far. Patience. Soon you will be with him.
Away put your weapon, I mean you no harm! I am wondering, why are you here?
Looking? Found someone, you have, I would say! Hmm?
Help you, I can. Yes, mmm.
Oh!
Great warrior!
Wars not make one great, heh heh heh!
You must not go.
Yes! Yes! To Obi Wan, you listen. The cave. Remember your failure with the cave?

Stopped, they must be. On this, all depends. Only a fully trained Jedi Knight, with the Force as his ally, will conquer Vader and his Emperor. If you end your training now, if you choose the quick and easy path as Vader did, you will become an agent of evil.
If you honor what they fight for? Yes!
No. There is another.
Mine! Or I'll help you not.

Remember, a Jedi's strength flows from the Force. But beware. Anger, fear, aggression. The dark side are they. Once you start down the dark path, forever will it dominate your destiny. Luke... Luke... do not... do not underestimate the powers of the Emperor or suffer your father's fate you will. Luke, when gone am I... the last of the Jedi will you be. Luke, the Force runs strong in your family. Pass on what you have learned, Luke. There is... another... Sky... walker.
Strong am I with the Force, but not that strong.
That face you make... look I so old to young eyes?
I do. Yes, I do. Sick have I become, old and weak... When nine hundred years old *you* reach, look as good *you* will not, hmm?
Your father he is.
Told you, did he?
Unexpected this is. And unfortunate.
No! Unfortunate that you rushed to face him... that incomplete was your training. That... not ready for the burden were you.
No more training do you require. Already know you, that which you need.
No. Not yet. One thing remains. Vader. You must confront Vader. Then, only then, a Jedi will you be. And confront him you will.
Soon will I rest, yes, forever sleep. Earned it I have.
Ah, strong am I with the Force, but not that strong. Twilight is upon me, and soon, night must fall. That is the way of things. The way of the Force.
Young Skywalker.
Time it is for you to look past a pile of old books, hmm?

Oh, read them, have you? Page-turners they were not. Yes, yes, yes. Wisdom they held, but that library contained nothing that the girl Rey does not already possess. Skywalker, still looking to the horizon. Never here, now, hmm? The need in front of your nose.
Lost Ben Solo you did. Lose Rey we must not.

Heeded my words not, did you? Pass on what you have learned. Strength. Mastery. But weakness, folly, failure also. Yes, failure most of all. The greatest teacher, failure is. Luke, we are what they grow beyond. That is the true burden of all masters.
Qui-Gon_Jinn: What makes you think that?
Perhaps I killed a Jedi and took it from him.
I wish that were so.
But not at the expense of the moment.
There's always a bigger fish.
Remember
Remember, concentrate on the moment. Feel, don't think. Trust your instincts.
You must have Jedi reflexes if you race pods.
Don't do that again.
You almost got us killed! Are you brainless?
The ability to speak does not make you intelligent. Now get out of here.
I can only protect you, I cannot fight a war for you.
I have twenty thousand Republic dataries.
I don't have anything else...
But credits will do fine.
Credits will do fine.
The Queen does not need to know.
With your permission, my master, I have encountered a vergence in the Force.
A boy. His cells have the highest concentration of midi-chlorians I have seen in a life-form. It was possible he was concieved by the midi-chlorians.
Obi-Wan, promise... Promise me you will train the boy.
I tried to free your mother Anni, but Watto wouldn't have it.
Keep your concentration here and now, where it belongs.
Finding him was the will of the force, I have no doubt of that.
Captain.
Tell them we wish to board at once.
Anakin Skywalker, meet Obi-Wan Kenobi.
I'm not allowed to train you, so I want you watch me and be mindful. Always remember, your focus determines your reality.
I need to speak to the Jedi Council. The situation has become much more complicated.
Greed can be a very powerful ally.
Do you hear that?
That is the sound of a thousand terrible things headed this way.
I don't sense anything.
Anakin! Tell them to take off!
I don't presume...
Let's get out of here before more droids show up
Midi-chlorians are a microscopic life form that resides within all living cells.
I have... acquired a pod in a game of chance. The fastest ever built.
Patience, my blue friend.
I don't know. I didn't actually come here to free slaves.
Your Highness, under the circumstances, I suggest you come to Coruscant with us.
They will kill you if you stay.
Don't worry. The Force will guide us.
You and the Naboo form a symbiont circle, what happens to one of you affects the other, you must understand this.
He owes me what you call a Life Debt.

I saved his life. He owes me what you might call a life debt. Your Gods demand that his life should be placed in my hands now.
I foresee you will become a much wiser man than I.
Anakin! ANAKIN! NOOOO!
